3.description: One of those places that you pretty much take it for what it is.  Sadly when it first opened Seashell had really good food.  But with time and new management, quality has went down.  They have 2 for $7 dollar deals and a bunch of other affordable food deals so if you aren't looking to spend much but have a craving for something greasy, stop here.  But don't expect much else.  Tip: Order ahead at least 20 minutes otherwise be prepared to wait.

1.description: Every time I order from Sea Shells, they deliver.  My only complaint is the fries are always cold.   Even if I order onion rings, they arrive cold. I enjoy their chicken super taco,  and their chicken is seasons and fry just right.  Will continue to give them my business.

2.description: I always order the same thing but it is always consistently good. Chicken wings with lemon pepper salt are always fresh and never greasy.  They never taste like they have been cooked in old grease. When I have them delivered they are always fast and the food is hot.

9.description: Had delivery and it was the bomb! Wings arrived hot and crispy with extra lemon pepper just like I like them. Will order again for sure!

10.description: I love ordering my food from them. The food is good and so are the prices. I even got my mom hooked. The people working here are very well mannered.

4.description: I always do delivery from this place. They are fast and quick! This food is always hot and fresh! They have really good deals to if you are on a budget. I recommend this place if you are in a hurry and also want quality food as well.

6.description: The absolute worst customer service I've ever experienced in a restaurant, and that's saying a lot to a person that frequents many food establishments daily. I ordered 3 wings, fries, and coleslaw at 6:05pm, and the order was not ready until 6:40pm! I am not exaggerating; that is the exact time frame for that very small order of food which would take any other business less than 5 minutes. I went up to the cashier at 6:30pm to inquire my order, to which she said would take an additional 3 minutes. I was very patient (obviously), and was determined to see this through until the end. A complete and utter lack of proficiency by the staff, which looks like a frantic and confused at all times. The way they appear is the way they serve, and upon getting the food, I took it straight to the trash can. No food is worth eating if the service is that pathetic. If you're starving and absolutely need to eat something, don't go here....because you'll end up dying anyhow by virtue of their abysmal service. -WK williamkurk.com

12.description: Where crappy stinky heart clogging corner joints get shut down by the health department every week, this place really stands out.  Fast food, for sure, but it's good, and the place is super clean and professional.  You can get some chicken fingers for cheap, all breast meat, and it's really tasty.  They also have deep fried okra (hmm!) and "cake shakes."  No, I don't mean blowjobs - sorry - I mean they actually take some milk, ice cream, and a huge slice of the cake of your choice and throw it together in a blender.  Have you ever heard of something so crazy!?  I haven't tried them myself, but if I ever stagger in drunk I certainly will.   If you *are* looking for a blowjob, though, I'm sure there are places nearby you can get one. I kid, I kid . . . this is actually the neighborhood I live in, and I love it.They also have these great garden salads for only $3, as well as steamed collard greens and fruit salads.  The healthy fast food choices are great, especially considering that none of the places within blocks of Seashell offer anything that's not deep fried.  The cake slices and other desserts come from an independent baker, and they look great too.I plan to stop by again.

5.description: I know I shouldn't love it but I do.  Great tasting catfish fillets cooked just right.  Fast delivery, and very good customer service.  You can get deals if you Grub Hub your order.  Next time we want fried food, we'll order for delivery again.

13.description: Clean establishment.  Good fast food, reasonably priced and a polite staff working the pick up counter.  Some seating is available if you can't wait to eat.

11.description: Great Cheap Eats if your looking for something quick on the go!!!! Always Fresh and cooked to order!!!

8.description: I have only been here a couple of times and both times I was underwhelmed!  Yes, the prices are dirt cheap but the food is not good at all...its flavorless and greasy!!!Well, the gyros are good but thats the only thing!  Even when I'm low on funds this isn't a place I would run too I had to be reminded of that with my last visit!I still want my food to taste good even if I don't pay a lot of money for it!

0.description: Here I am. Over two years later and still, STILL, the deluxe crispy chicken sandwich comes so well-made, crispy, and crunchy; I am drooling just thinking about it.  I order the delivery. It is still as quick as before, always faster than the GrubHub estimate, and always hot.2 deluxe crispy chicken sandwiches for 2 for 7$??? Unbeatable. I mean, what more can you ask for?

7.description: Fast delivery food was good. But have to pay cash if its your first delivery order. I ordered chicken Philly very tasty I would order it again.

12.description: Best corned beef in Chicago!!!! This place is on point when it comes to corned beef sandwiches. The price is reasonable and the portions are enough to make 2 extra sandwiches. Nothing like hot corned beef on rye with mustard!!! Last time i visited they only took cash, which was annoying. But no worries, the food is so good that you will go get money and come back.

7.description: All good things usually come to an end. For most of its existence, AP deli enjoyed a cult like following, present company included. I stopped in to pick up a pound of corn beef. I guess when your product is elevated to rock star status, you no longer feel the need to ensure your customers feel appreciated. The place was empty when I arrived, I ordered a cheese burger with my beef. When I observed the young lady casually tossing ten fries in the deep frier, I asked if that was my order. I informed her the fries looked a little light. She replied you get a small order with the burger. I asked her how could she ensure it was a small order since she arbitrarily pick up some fries and tossed them in the basket. She refused to add more. From that point forward, the older lady working with her watched me with reckless abandonment. I don't know why, they were working behind a locked door and plexiglass. When I arrived at the house, I was very disappointed. The corned beef was very lean, but dry and lacking flavor. Usually the container is greasy from cooking process that gives the meat its unmistakable legendary flavor. I have purchased fatty meat, been given less than a pound of meat, but never given flavorless dry meat. The reason customers continue to patronize this place,regardless of the extremely exorbitant prices, is the unique flavor of the meat. High prices, less than stellar customer service, and unremarkable meat removes AP from the bucket list. No longer worth the trip.

3.description: This place used to have a lot more resturants. If your hungry and only have $10.00 , this should hit the spot.

1.description: I've been here countless times but the last time has made me decide to never return. Not only was the service shoddy but the prices r too high and my sandwich consisted on mostly inedible tough and fatty meat. Oh...and there wasn't much meat to start with. Last but not least...My fiancée went here a few days before me but didn't tell me. When he got sick he still didn't say anything. It wasn't until today that he told me and I told him that I wouldn't be returning here because it made me sick that he came clean about his experience. I will never eat here again. I'm all for supporting minority businesses but I refuse to support them when they have made me ill. My stomach was messed up for 2 days behind a skimpy, tough, fatty junior corned beef. The one positive is that they still make a mean French fry. If they could be consistent with the sandwiches like they are with fries they would make a serious comeback. FIRE THE COOK....and get uncle whoever to make the corned beef right!!!!!! Also...swing a mop or broom...it looks sloppy back there.I'm not going to comment on that fountain soda machine because I never took a chance on it but it may need a good "once over" as well. I wish them luck but I'm not going going back even if they are giving away invisible free sandwiches. The stars r for the fries.

2.description: The food is not the same. The meat has a lot of fat and the ladies there are really rude. I live close and I don't go there very often.

9.description: They raise prices and skimp on the meat.

10.description: I got the regular sized corned beef sandwich and wasn't all that impressed. The sandwich was the same size of a sandwich you would make at home only this one is like $6? Ridiculous. It was indeed good, but it wasn't big enough. I will still hungry after I ate it.

13.description: The food is good the service isn't . I waited 15 min for 2 hot dogs, watched them make 3 corned beef sandwiches. never knew there could be 4 employees huddled in the back and I had to wait that long . But they were good.

16.description: Outstanding... Corned beef... More than a bargin for your money...Pass on the wings

17.description: Ericka, (my daughter in Chicago) told yelpers that this is the best corned beef sandwich ever and it is the best in the Chicago Land. The portions OMG! you can actually split this sandwich with someone but you really don't want to because you will want to savor every bite with a crunch of the pickle and chips! AP Deli come on down to the Dirty South I need you!

15.description: The BEST corned beef sandwich i've ever had !

0.description: The way they pile the meat on you wonder will you be able to take a bite. It's amazing. This is old school sandwich making. I love it.

5.description: Let me say that I remember when you could come here and make two sandwiches from one or have one heck of a gut buster sandwich that most of the time I couldn't finish in one sitting!!!The reason I'm giving AP Deli 2 stars isn't because the corn beef on rye isn't still good but because the sandwich didn't have enough meat on it to be considered a real sandwich for one.Now, I know the economy is changing and many places have had to make cut backs but if I knew my sandwich wasn't going to be even half of what I remembered I wouldn't have wasted my time in stopping by and purchasing this mediocre version of what the sandwich use to be.I do need to add the staff was great the place was fairly clean and didn't have people just standing outside of the restaurant!!Unfortunately, I won't be back!!!

11.description: I've walked by this place a million times.  Who knew what I was passing up.  I got the Jr beef on rye. The woman who took my order was pleasant.  It was $9 (pricey) but delicious. I had more than enough meat to make a second sandwich (that I took to work the next day,  don't judge me). I'll definitely be back for a fresh yummy sandwich again.

8.description: One of the best corned beef sandwiches ever. I've eaten here so many times I cant even count and there is a reason why! The portions of tender buttery corned beef that they fit on those 2 wee pieces of rye bread look impossible and you end up with more meat on your plate than your sandwich...but it is absolutely delicious. Get that with a side of fries or plain potato chips and you're in business. This location has odd hours (like not open on Sundays sometimes) which I can never remember and I end up getting myself all worked up for a sandwich and cant get one because they aren't open! That's a small mishap tho because I usually get one on a Friday or Saturday so I'm good. Also, this isn't a joint that you sit down and dine. These folks are packed in there in line (sometimes out the door) and they are on a mission: to get their sandwiches and be out. That's what you should do too. You can get a 9 oz corned beef sandwich for $6.99.Give them a try. You'll be pleased...I JUST was... :-)

4.description: The corned beef here is great! The staff, prices, and environment: not so much.Despite all of the other minuses, the corned beef is delicious, perfectly shaved, and tender, so I will likely still saunter in here from time to time, as the spirit moves me.

14.description: Great corned beef sandwiches. I just wish they were a little more affordable.

6.description: I couldn't agree with La Tonya G. more. I don't get back to Chicago but once or twice a year now. AP Deli has always been my "Go To" corned beef joint, but the quality here has gone down slightly and the sandwiches only have half the meat they used to with a 2 dollar increase in price. Grrrr.

3.description: If you are looking for something quick, inexpensive and tasty then this place is for you!Don't expect big chicken wings but they are still tasty!  I usually eat about 3 to 4 wings but theirs were so small that I could have ate about 6 or 8 in order to satisfy my hunger pains...lolI didn't get many fries with the 4 pc meal I ordered so when I was done it was more like a quick snack but a tasty one...I have to say that the wings use to be bigger when we first started getting delivery from this place but as the time has gone by the wings have gotten smaller.I didn't like the men standing around and outside of the building and I'm not blamming or pointing fingers at the restaurant for that, but it did make me a little uneasy and  I had never been to this establishment because I only experienced their delivery but I was out and about and I thought I would save myself the delivery fee, but I will stick with delivery from now on!I have to say that it was very clean inside of the restaurant and the lady that took my order was very nice.I would recommend them if you are hungry, don't feel like cooking and also trying to stretch a buck...

1.description: I had a steak Philly for the first time @ and it was horrible....it smelled good, but didn't taste good. The meat was tough, the bread wasn't great either, really chewy. I wouldn't  recommend this sandwhich, its a waste of time & money.

2.description: When drunkness calls. That should totally be the title of my life after 1am if I'm out. I went to a beer tasting, got the munchies and on my way back home ended up here with friends, who were equally inebriated.The menu is totally overwhelming. Which sucks when you're vision is already blurry and everything at that point in your life seems like the most important decision you'll ever make!!! However, I ordered a turkey burger and fries.While waiting I glanced at everything they have behind the bullet proof glass, lol, and they sell EVERYTHING from condoms, to skittles, to chips, to alka seltzer! It's the funniest thing ever, but it works. While waiting, I decided to see if I could get some cheese put on some flammin hots. Yup. That happened. Got home and stuffed my face. Not the best, but not the worst; it did it's job.

5.description: This place is nice for desire to have a late night meal that is cheap and filling. This joint has burgers, chicken, tacos, and even fish. The BREADED chicken breast sandwich is one of my favorites.

6.description: Cheaper and better quality than alot of places in the area.  Friendly service.  I was pleasantly suprised and will be going back.

0.description: A great location to get a quick bite to eat that's cheap, tastes good and is filling. So far I've tried their chicken burrito and their cheeseburgers. I love both. Not yo mention nearly all meals come with fries and a pop. My only complaint is the people that hang out in front. They seem like some pretty ghetto shady characters. Smoking blunts, pants to the floor, just hanging around for no apparent reason.

4.description: The food is not completely horrible ( depending on what you order), but my tolerance for places in my community that say they deliver, charge a $3 delivery fee, and then won't bring the food to the door has run out. Please don't come in my community and make money off us and act like you're afraid of us, I'm fed up with that. Go to a community where you're not afraid to approach the door and take their money. I'm done. And don't order the buffalo wings if you expect the traditional buffalo wing. It's just a fried chicken wing that's a little spicy. No sauce.

3.description: So/so kind of Slow

1.description: Driveup super Long wait on December 4th 2015 at 8:30pm. Your trapped and can't leave . So stupid.  I was about to drive up on the curb and grass to get out but there is this stupid tree in my way. Next time I'm going to Popeyes or Harold's.

2.description: always check your order before you leave. i drove 20 blocks for this meal  when i got back to work i find they gave me one pc chicken instead of two . and no one will answer the phone when i called to let them know my order was wrong.

0.description: Has an exceptionally long wait in the drive thru line spoke to the manager the only thing that she could give me was a drink which I declinedI like the food but I'm not sure if it was worth the wait the only reason why I stayed in line was because I was locked in other than that I would have left

1.description: The Resturant is great before 2p The service is friendly food hot and quickly served BUT it never fails after 2p - 230p the worst costumer service and slow food orders I have been sitting at a booth for 15 minutes the waitresses are laughing and  talking loud  at the counter... I was only acknowledge by the busboy because I come in the morning he knew to get me coffee with a smile  17 min no one has ask for my order my test is overI am leaving now!!!! remember to come in before 2p

9.description: This place is great if your looking for a quick inexpensive meal, that's delicious and hits the spot. They have a mini breakfast and another similar breakfast that's really inexpensive and comes with a healthy portion of food. And they are pretty consistent with the quality of the food. I believe it was the mini breakfast I got when I was there. I got bacon 2 eggs and a heaping portion of hash browns with green peppers and onions. I have to say this place always hits the spot especially after a night of partying.  And their coffee is spot on all the time, the name of the lady that fixes it escapes me right now but she knows exactly how much cream and sugar to put in it, and she gets it right everytime. And they make fresh donuts everyday, and they a devilish delicious. If you want one grab them quick because they fly off the shelf quickly. This will be a constant favorite and go to place if I happen to be in the area.

12.description: This restaurant is good, but the waitresses are decent at best. Both times I've been here, I had to get up and refill my own water, or flag my waitress down. It's also in the heart of the hood, so if that makes you feel some sort of way, this might not be the place for you. They have a lot of meal options, and are inexpensive as well.

21.description: Restaurant has a nice seating area, unfortunately I walked in and asked to be seated and was promptly told that they only did takeout. I left since I was driving through the area and wasn't planning on eating in my car. If the restaurant had the typical burglar bars, and feel of the surrounding businesses I would not have been surprised. But the potential here was lost completely. If you are looking for a sit-down meal. This is not the place.

16.description: Love L&G's carryout. The food is pretty good, although the restaurant doesn't look so great. L&G's is diner style....an old dirty diner. The ladies that wait on you are usually rude or ignoring you because they are busy standing at the counter talking on their cell phones. It is what it is!!!

17.description: Restaurant has a nice seating area, unfortunately I walked in and asked to be seated and was promptly told that they only did takeout. I left since I was driving through the area and wasn't planning on eating in my car. If the restaurant had the typical burglar bars, and feel of the surrounding businesses I would not have been surprised. But the potential here was lost completely. If you are looking for a sit-down meal. This is not the place.

10.description: This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in the Hood. Always clean, hot and fresh food.  Also the service is on point every time. This is a spot to try and support.

5.description: The food was great but I think the service is horrible. The waitresses are not very friendly and if you call and order over the phone its even worse. They hang up on you or say hold on and leave the phone there. I was holding for 14minutes one time listening to their conversations. My friend and I ordered a salad with our meal. The waitress gave us cheap plastic forks that weren't even strong enough to grasp the salad. When questioned why she said the dishwasher was broke. Lol we asked if they could handwash some forks for us. She rolled her eyes. We left immediately.. Ive been to this place three times and always had a terrible experience. This was the last straw. Never will return.

11.description: Always enjoy the food, service is alright, nothing spectacular. I chose the Spartan omelet I believe and that was delicious to me, with a side of Turkey sausage. Until the next time! Definitely a must try!

3.description: Food is good. I never sat in and ate. I always took my food to grow. I usually order steak omlet.

0.description: I love this place for a quick inexpensive meal!!!I have gone here for years and I have not disappointed yet when it comes to my breakfast!This place is not for the health consious though!

20.description: On the corner, bright family restaurant, table top and booth seating. Nice staff, basic breakfast, lunch dinner.  South shore needs restaurants like this.  Not sure what the previous reviewer was talking about in terms of take out only, maybe the restaurant becomes take out only in the later hours.  I went for breakfast, and will be back.  Good to know I can count on a place in this area of town.  The area has some real classic beauty however, there are  some real scary characters rooting around though so be careful to and from the car.

19.description: Friendly and fast service. I am here at least once a month for breakfast. One of the few places open at 5:30. Most places in this area open at 7. The food is good and service is prompt. The specials are affordable.

2.description: Food is good but staff is rude and unpleasant. Expect nasty attitudes whenever you go.

18.description: Restaurant was very clean and great seating area. Had an omelette and it was delicious. Service was also outstanding. Place was very welcoming and friendly. Not sure what Orland meant about the seating arrangement because that place is packed in the early mornings. Might be a late night thing. Our inner city neighborhoods need more places like this.

13.description: Good coffee. Great service. Very bright and cheerful.

4.description: Cool place ,CLEAN , fast but attitudes of the waitresses are horrible food is great and cheap.

6.description: I absolutely love the donuts! The customer service needs work, but the food is great! Quick and cheap restaurant....can't beat that!

15.description: If you come early try to sit in Millie's section. Good service

7.description: If you want a quick, tasty take out breakfast and do not care about the service, this is the place to come. But if you care how you are treated as a paying customer, this is NOT the place to come. When I entered the restaurant, two employees looked and me, did not speak, and did not ask if I needed anything.  Once I did place my order, the takeout waitress, loudly, complained about a phone customer in front of other waiting customers and even ordered another employee not the take the call because she told her "to hold for a minute." WHAT!? If you can't deal with customers of all kinds, a restaurant is not the place to work!  Not impressed by the nice-nasty, rude, and entitled attitudes of the  employees I encountered, and I will not be returning.  Too bad, because I like patronizing businesses in my community.

8.description: The donuts look amazing!  You iced donuts are delicous!  I have to eat more than one when I'm here!!

14.description: Good cheap fast breakfast. Best way to describe this place. They also have really good donuts.  They also serve other food besides breakfast. I've had sandwiches from here too that were tasty.

0.description: Great neighborhood spot. Need to be buzzed in, but very friendly.

3.description: Very good places to get your cravings for chicken. Unlike my Church's Chicken restaurants this one has fast service, nice people and fair prices. The food was very good and the biscuits were soft and very very tasty.I will try to visit them again.

1.description: The food is very good but the staff members are lazy as Hell every time I go there they say we don't have spicy, it will be 45 minutes.  They are the kind of worker that will destroy a good business because of there Laxadazzy Attitude

2.description: I would give this place 4 stars, but the lines are entirely too long and too slow.I came here to purchase some sides to go with a meal I had purchased elsewhere, and waited in line for about 15 minutes before I was served. Once, I did order, I got my items fairly quickly, and the cashier was really nice, and thanked me for my business which a lot of fast food places never do these days.I ended up paying around 10 bucks and got: 2 biscuits, a large mashed potato and gravy and a single serving of mac and cheese. Kind of pricey for sides but whatever.I was also told if I wanted to order more than 1 single side, I had to order chicken off of the menu which I think is stupid. I shouldn't be forced to purchase more than I want to be able to get the exact items I want.

0.description: I haven't had Church's for awhile and I was having a hankering for some of that hot, greasy, crispy, tasty fried chicken.  Unfortunately, due too an error on our receipt I ended up with some cool, semi-soggy, and unexpiring chicken.  So, why did I give this place 4 stars; let me explain: When we went in the cashier was very patient with us as we placed our order and had a few add-ons.  She was smiling and talking to us and all in all just very friendly.  She made us some hot okra and checked our bag then checked her the receipt but what didn't realize until we almost made it home was that we were charged for a mixed special instead of just the Dark Special which was a difference of 5.00 dollars plus tax.When she gave us the price I thought it seemed high but the bus was coming and I didn't want to miss it to ensure that I had my hot chicken and sides.  I'm on the bus and the price is still bothering me and then I told my daughter what her portion would be and said "OMG MOM, What did you get?' I pull out the receipt checked and I was indeed overcharged.I call and was told to come back and bring the receipt.  They were expecting me and the manager was very nice and even made me some more fried okra.  I never thought about getting an entirely new order of chicken but now I wish I did because by the time I got home the only thing that was hot was the okra and if anyone has been to Church's before you know their chicken isn't the best when it gets not only cold but a little soggy from the steam of being in the bag.The reason I gave them four stars is not necessarily for the food because I'm sure it was good but I really didn't get a chance to taste it at its best but I did love the customer service from the beginning to the end.  I was not mad at the cashier because mistakes happen and she was very patient.The Okra was fresh, the Cole slaw was very good, the biscuits were delicious according to my daughter but I'm not a fan of them and the Hot Pepper was also very fresh.The mash potatoes were disappointing because they give you this very small bowl and call it a family size.  I know economical times have changed but come on Church's you are going to give that out and call it a family size when you use to get a container of mash and a container of gravy.  The next thing you know they will give you an individual size and call it family...You know the commercial can say "Sharing is Caring" one dot for you and one dot for you...lol This isn't against the store but the Corporation.I will be back but next time I will check my receipt before I go even if the bus is coming...lolEnjoy!!!

1.description: Beautiful clothing!

2.description: I simply love Sylwia!  She worked hand and hand with me to design the most beautiful and unique wedding dress.  Great design work, patience, and wonderful personality.  Check her out!

0.description: I don't know how many times I've been in this store just admiring and drooling over the gorgeous pieces that are in the window and hanging from the displays.Sylwia is a designer at heart. Her shop is full of classy, well made, fun and WEARABLE  clothes. She will also work with you to design a piece that you like, is stylish and timeless. She knows stuff! She can also do very whimsical items, ask her about the pajama party! This woman does her research and she works to stay current with the latest trends.Although it seems like the majority of her work is geared to women, she has started doing some mens items and she does do design work for larger sizes. She recently did a cocktail for me that had a custom corset and rosette skirt and then did a nice flowing bright asymmetrical skirt that I wore with the corset for a tropical wedding. They were the perfect outfits for both events!If you need something designed, party dress, wedding dress, cocktail, suit, coat, whatever, make an appointment and stop in to see her. The design process with her fun and gave me a better sense of what to look for in clothing that I purchase from now on. I can't say enough good things.

3.description: I just moved back to Chicago and I started going to Dawn on a regular basis. I told her I wanted to start and grow my hair out of the relaxer I had and I wanted my hair longer. When I first started to see her, my hair was at  my chin and now it is way past my shoulders. My hair has been more healthy and stronger since I've started with her. she is amazing at growing your hair, doing fabulous colors and great cuts. She keeps my ends trimmed every six weeks and it has really shown a difference, with the growth of my hair. If you are looking for someone to take care of your hair and keep it healthy you want to go see Dawn and she is also an amazing person, with great energy. its like going to the hair doctor!!! Thank you Dawn I will be in soon!!

1.description: I am addicted. I love the fact that I am never in the salon long. Dawn runs her business like a well oiled machine. You are in& out. She is skilled and an expert in the field of hair styling. She has taken very good care of my hair and always able to understand just what I am looking for. I Love to be fresh and well prepared for my job and Dawn keeps me looking good. I would recommend her to everyone but I also tried to keep her as my little secret! LOL!

2.description: Dawnielle has been doing my color, relaxer, trim & styles for years!  I trust no one else to do my hair.  I've relocated to Tampa, FL but Chicago is my home and I always look forward to getting styled by Dawn every time I visit!

0.description: My first time going to Dawn was last week. She was awesome, the shop was nicely decorated and not too crowded. I didn't wait long, I was in and out. She's such a sweet person and is very skilled. I've found my new stylist in my neck of the woods! See you later today Dawn!!!

4.description: Every time I sit  in Addie's chair, I always leave looking fabulous! She is an expert at creating unique colors whenever I want a new look. Addie cares about healthy hair and uses great products! Addie does my 7yr old's hair as well and she's awesome with children! I love the fact that this salon offers specials and Addie's prices are budget-friendly! Most of all the service at this salon is impeccable and we always have fun because everyone is so friendly!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

0.description: I like this Walgreens and the cashiers are really nice and the place is clean!Now, the people on the outside that likes to stand and loiterer is not a fabulous part of my visit when I come here but it is getting to the point where people are everywhere selling their loose squares, CD, DVD and now even make-up!Wow, I just thought about it that lady could have stolen that stuff from the Walgreens!Anyway, the Walgreens it self is clean and I have nothing to say but if I'm in the area again I will ignore the people selling things and hopefully I will have a great experience like I did today!

3.description: I think this store has great prices for its offerings. The food is good and the wait time is a little long but for the price, of their specials, it may be fair. I wish they could take my order by phone but they may be concerned about making an order that I will not show up to pay for (it's a shame they may have to worry about this). So, I think the time is a sacrifice I'm learning to take given the price I pay compared to their competition, down the street. I wish they could institute a web sight or call in ordering and payment plan so I could plan my pickup around my other plans with the food (hint, hint, wink, wink)...  But their greens and other healthy sides are a great options compared to other competitors so I will remain their customer and encourage you to try and support them also...

1.description: I've lived in the south shore for nearly five years.  After a random search of Yelp, I came across Surf's Up and knew I needed to go.  6 blocks away from my house and I had no idea it was there.  Go figure.  Now I wonder how I missed it all this time. Take away only location.Got the catfish - fresh, perfectly cooked, excellent seasoning.  The wings were plump and tasty.  Greens were deliciously savory, loved the fries and corn on the cob.  Totally blown away by the quality, selection and freshness.  Can't wait to go back for the perch, buffalo wings, grits and fried biscuits.  If its always this good, there's no way I can lose. They offer more upscale mains including a fried lobster Po'boy and crab legs for those craving something a little bit decadent.

2.description: Other than calling in and someone answers "hello" like its their house phone, the food was good!Actually very yummy! Worth the money and wasDone on time! Definitely will be back!!

5.description: I got the shrimp po-boy and dirty rice. The shrimp were amazing and very big. The dirty rice wasn't that great. It just taste like yellow rice in my opinion. I'd stick with Popeye's dirty rice. I will definitely be going back though BC I loveeeee SHRIMP!!! I would love it if they sold mac n cheese lol I told the cashier so maybe one day. Wait time was fast and store is very nice and clean.

6.description: I'd never heard of fried lobster and now I can't get it out of my head, or my taste buds.  Tender, juicy, and perfectly seasoned, this is a dish you have got to try.  In addition there are lots of other great meal choices like Po' Boys, Fish or Shrimp Tacos, and Buffalo Wings.  Many of the dishes are available either fried or grilled.  You can even order for delivery.Thank you Surf's Up for healthy choices that taste great, and being part of South Shore Chicago!!!

7.description: I've heard nothing but good things about this place. Its everything I've heard and more. Keep up the great food and great service.

8.description: The staff is excellent!!!!! Outstanding Customer Service.  Food is always fresh and hot. Will tell you upfront if they are out of something.   Will suggest another item just as great.I love the grilled catfish w/red potatoes and corn

9.description: Well...I wish I was writing a review of the FOOD.  But I never got that far.  My coworkers and I had a substantial order all ready to go, called it in...but they don't take credit cards over the phone.  Huh?  Spoke to the manager...at least I think it was the manager...he answered the phone like "yea" or something like that, I wasn't sure if it was the gentleman who took my order at first, changing his voice a little...anyway, I was told that due to "fraud" they don't take credit card orders over the phone anymore.  Ok, well maybe you should have that on your website?  No comment on that.  And I get it, if I were asking you to deliver to an alley, maybe that wouldn't be such a good idea to take a credit card.  But I was delivering to my JOB, which is a pretty well-known institution on the South Side.  I was calling from my WORK PHONE, which caller ID should confirm said institution.  Heck, I even offered to show ID for the credit card when you arrived...But anyway, moving on...I saw they had online ordering.  I asked about that.  I was told, no, that went to their OTHER store on Madison and they're closed right now.  But the website's online ordering system is still fully operational?  So, in theory, someone could enter their credit card information and food order into a BLACK HOLE and have it disappear?  You wanna talk about fraud, to me, THAT sounds like a bigger risk.  But, suffice it to say, I didn't get to order.  I don't know if I will, even if I have cash.  Though fried lobster sounds good...I was kind of put off by the attitude I got when I tried to place the order.  A shame, because that menu looked soooo good....

0.description: If you want your fish grilled and not fried, get it here. Yes, I said NOT FRIED! Do you have any idea how hard that is to find here in the 'hood?We had tasty tilapia, greens, and cole slaw. The very nice man at the counter let me have a giant cole slaw even tho it's not officially on the menu. The greens were tasty, a bit salty, lots of meat in there (guessing pork). The cole slaw was sweet and creamy. The fish was firm and well seasoned. Even the other customers seemed nice. I will be back.

4.description: I went into this establishment on Friday, and order their lobster po'boy. The sandwich and fries, were actually very good, and tasty. My only complaint is the bread was tuff, but other than that, the food was very good.  I will go here again, and try something different next time.

3.description: When people declare that Taco Bell is not "real" Mexican food,  I agree.  Taco Bell is an entity all it's own, and should be enjoyed for what it is. At 2am, authenticity is low on my priority list.  This Taco Bell happens to be one of the friendliest, and they serve up some TV commercial quality taco bell. The ladies and gents who work here must know the struggle of leaving a drive thru with your food,  anticipating the first bite of the classic Burrito Supreme, only to open the wax paper to find the epitome of disappointment and a huge mouthful of sour cream.  They must hire folks who love Taco Bell, and want every customer who leaves their drive thru loving it as much as they do.

1.description: They barely put any meat in their food. It's literally only a tortilla they serve with lettuce. The employees were very nice but they need to stop acting like the food is coming out of their personal kitchen . Or management needs to step it up

2.description: This Taco Bell has the nicest fast food employees I swear in all of Chicago. They are always super-friendly and happy and you cannot help but leave with a smile on your face, too. The service even makes up for how subpar Taco Bell's food has gotten over the years. I have never had an unpleasant experience at this location in regards to the service, only the quality of food. I sincerely hope they are paying their workers well here because they deserve it!

5.description: I mean Taco Bell is Taco Bell I don't go here expecting authentic Mexican Food so with that in mind, it is just a fast food joint!!!I wish this one wasn't just a drive thru or walk up!When I stop by this one I haven't had any problems, the customer service is okay but I don't know how you can shine too much with a bullet proof glass between you and the cashier!I'm not a fan but when I'm just trying to fill my belly with some kind of substance and the money in the pocket book isn't really plentiful Taco Bell works for me!

6.description: My first time getting breakfast from Taco Bell.... and they had no sausage patties and told me it would be a 15 minute wait..  ugh horrible first experience.

7.description: Oh taco bell.. how you have saved me many a drunken nights.Taco bell, in general, is not good food but is one of those standbys for me when I get that craving... and this taco bell is definitely NOT the best one.  The only reason I head through that double drive thru (yet I've only seen one side open) is because it's cheap and on the way from my office to my clients' houses.The chances of you speaking with a friendly staff member are slim, but it has happened... and they are not even that fast putting together your order.  This may be a good thing if they are making each item as you order but who knows.Thanks S Stoney Island TBell for fillin' my craving once every other month.  I won't be holding my breath for our next meeting.

8.description: I've stopped at this location a couple times over the last 3 years, but I have a problem with the fact that their drive thru is often dirty and full of trash. I also felt the quality of the food went down because they seem to overcharge for things. Most of these fast food places on the south side of Chicago seem to have a problem with staying clean and keeping the restaurant looking tidy. This particular location is located at the intersection of Stony Island and South Chicago Avenue near 79th Street. Another problem is that they have pretty poor standards in terms of how they care for the facility because today for example it was rainy and they had water leaking from above the drive thru that was dripping all down the sides and inside the drive thru window. This was one of those ghetto Taco Bells that needed to be shut down and refurbished to normal people standards where it doesnt look like a dump.

0.description: I come here regularly! Most of the time they will have you in and out! Nice variety of entrees.

4.description: I grew up on Taco Bell and recently have been eating it regularly, and I have to say, the staff here is the friendliest Taco Bell that I've ever encountered.

0.description: One of the nicest spots on 71th Street in South Shore.  The best Shea Butter in the City! Wonderful Black Soap!!! If you think of a scent you can get it here!!!  I need some more Shea Butter!!!

1.description: I have been hesitant to write them a bad review BUT after last night, I can't hold back any longer.2 hrs for a 45 min delivery (I live 1.5 miles away from this location) + Ordered half bbq wings, half mild wings, they were ALL MILD + The driver forgot the POP!!WHO EATS PIZZA WITHOUT POP?! (we did last night)Called to get refund for pop and instead the 'manager' gave us a $5 credit. (We have had credits before on our 'account' and none of the workers are able to find the 'notes' so I doubt he really put it in.)My advice is to NEVER HAVE THEM DELIVER!! GO PICK IT UP!!  ALSO SPEAK VERY SLOWLY WHEN ORDERING SO THEY CAN PUT YOUR ORDER IN CORRECTLYOk, I'm done.

9.description: Simply awful. I placed an order at 3:00. Called at 3:10 to confirm receipt of the order (it was there) and to make sure that the delivery driver would be informed that my front door buzzer was broken. I received a delivery estimate of 4:30 - perfectly reasonable. 4:30 came and passed. At 5:30 I attempted to call them in order to check up on my order - I was left on hold for what felt like forever. I kept calling back (this time, to cancel my order) but no one picked up. I even called the Pizza Hut order-placing line and explained to them what happened - they were very nice. They were unable to cancel my order but attempted to forward me through to the South Shore location.... who again, did not pick up their phone. Finally, the woman recommended just told me to refuse the pizza if it ever came.I didn't get through to them on the phone until 8:00 - FIVE hours after I placed my original order. The guy who picked up was unsurprised that I wanted to cancel my order and unapologetic. I don't see the point in yelling at people over the phone, and he clearly didn't get what the problem was, so I hung up.Order here at your own risk!

12.description: Oh dear.  Where to begin? First off, yes Pizza Hut is not great food, but I don't order it because it's great.  I order it because I need a quick, inexpensive pizza.  It is perfect if that is what you are looking for.  This location has been consistently bad.  I've ordered from them a dozen times over the past 2 years I'd say, and every time, there is something wrong with my order.  Items are missing, the food is cold, or, frankly, it arrives looking like it got dropped several times. My experience on 10/31/14 takes the cake though.  For starters, I expected that on Halloween night, pizza delivery would take a while, but I was prepared to wait.  I ordered a pizza through the Pizza Hut website at about 6:50 p.m., got a delivery time of 9:50 p.m..  No big deal, really.  The pizza arrived a little before 9:50 p.m., but when I got it back to my apartment, I discovered that I had been sent the wrong pizza.  So, naturally, I called the store.I was on hold for 20 minutes before anyone picked up the phone.  When they finally did, the line was so staticky that I could not hear the person, and that person hung up on me.  I called back and spent another 15 minutes on hold.  The first person I talked to had no idea how to help me, so she got the manager.  The manager (whose name I didn't catch) was extremely nice, offered to send the correct pizza back out immediately, but said it would still probably be an hour, just because of how back up they were.  I said that was fine.  This was at about 10 p.m..12:40 a.m. rolled around and still no pizza.  The store was closed at this point, but I did receive a call from the manager again that my order had gone out, but the delivery driver had been pulled over by the police and would not be delivering my pizza.  She said to call back the next day (today, November 1) and my correct order would be sent out, no charge.  So I called back today, and was again put on hold for 20 minutes before anyone picked up.  I talked to three different people, but finally got my correct order placed.  I was then put back on hold, where I will assume I was forgotten about because when someone finally picked up, they gave their opening "Thanks for choosing Pizza Hut" spiel.  I told them who I was, and they said my order was put in.  For pick up.I corrected the person, that no I was told it would be delivered, and she informed me that their delivery was so backed up that they weren't accepting delivery orders.  This is unacceptable on a number of levels, and it sucks that they expect me to go to the trouble of driving to the store to pick up food that they were supposed to deliver.  I finally talked to another manager who said it would be delivered, but the wait again was 2-3 hours.Bottom line: always expect to wait 20 minutes on hold if you call them, and 2-3 hours for your food to be delivered, no matter what time of day you order.  This location is clearly understaffed, and as a result, under performs.  I appreciate all the efforts of the manager to rectify the situation, but there are better places for cheap, fast pizza, and I will not be ordering from this location in the future.

21.description: I never expect amazing things from Pizza Hut, but I've always preferred them over Dominos. Thing is, almost every time I order the delivery gets here nearing the 30-minute mark. That's annoying sometimes when I'm hungry and waiting, and even worse considering I don't live that far away from the location. But like I said, it's not as if I expect amazing quality from a place like this.

16.description: I'd recommend eating something, perhaps a ham sandwich or a 4 course meal,  immediately after ordering from this Pizza Hut because chances are you will have had time to savor and fully digest that meal before the pizza even arrives.

17.description: I don't even want to give them 1 star.  The worst experience ever.  I have never experienced such an unprofessional business.  I soly ordered 1 pizza and a dessert. After waiting a complete hour, I called and after being on hold for 5 minutes they said the driver is close. I then waited another 30 minuets and nothing.  I called again and of course on hold another 5 minutes. They said my driver was supper close and will be here momentarily. Well another 30 minutes passed and nothing. I was so upset and finally my driver showed up. I took the pizza and it was stone cold!!!! Everything was cold as the winter day. I called with the driver at my door and was on hold 10mins outside freezing  and they said I could have my money back but I have to give the food back too. Are you serious! They offered a credit. I demanded a discount immediately.  The driver refused and had the worst attitude, he tried to take the food from me. Never will I order from there again! Horrible!

10.description: Yikes! I think the owner may have read these reviews and made some significant changes. I ordered two pizzas today (one from their "new recipes" menu). I conservatively ordered a standard pizza with a salted pretzel crust. I individually love pretzels and pizza - right? Why not have them make the sex? Maybe because its spawn's salt content was stroke inducing - seriously. After trying to scrape tiny bastard salt pellets off the crust for 20 minutes, which inevitably landed on the rest of the pizza and made it inedible, I phoned Pizza Hut just to let them know although, realistically, I expected little in return. The manager on duty was very pleasant. She listened and was appropriately responsive. I hung up the phone thoroughly satisfied with our exchange and I'll continue to order from the Stony Island store. On a high note, the cherry pepper bombshell pizza (sans the swine) is omg, high-fiving the angels good.

5.description: Customer service sucks. Would not honor advertised deals. First with my order then another customer that came in. Had attitude with me and other customer when we needed to look at menu to decide what we wanted because they said they weren't providing deals we wanted. By the way, other customer's expected deal wasn't the same as mine. I was polite the entire time as I always am when ordering food but girls still had nasty attitudes. WILL NEVER COME HERE AGAIN!!!

11.description: Look, I get that Pizza Hut isn't 5 star cuisine, but it'd be super if I even got a chance to eat it tonight. I'm hung up at my place with an injured foot and my boyfriend is helping pack, so I decided to order delivery. I ordered online and it said after it was placed that it would be 1.5 hours with delivery at 830pm. Ok, well that's a quite a wait for something two miles away, but I can't really get anywhere, so ok. 840 rolls around figure I'd check on the status. I was told the delivery driver was already out and would be there soon. Great, we're starving. 9pm rolls around. Nothing. Call again. Manager says they're out and should be there soon. Would apply a $10 credit to the next order. Uhhh ok, but how does this help me now? Fine. Would be nice just to know where this person is.920 comes. We are pissed. Seriously, I could have walked there and back on my busted leg faster. Angry I got delivery now. Boyfriend calls for the 3rd time and tells them to forget it, don't bother anymore. This was after being on hold for over 5 minutes.2.5 hours for one large pizza that never even arrived is actually so ridiculous I'd laugh if I wasn't so hungry at the moment.Get your game together at this location, guys. This was completely absurd. To all others: I'm sure there's a Dominos close by instead.

3.description: Picked up my pizza and wings and the front registers were not working. She asked if it was okay to swipe at the register in the kitchen. Really not okay taken the many ways credit card fraud can happen. There receipt papers all over the waiting area and the rug looked as if  it had not been swept or cleaned in days. The overall presentation of the pizza was lack luster, it did not have enough cheese, it looked as if it had been dropped because the toppings were shifted.

0.description: I ordered a pizza online. The delivery time was as expected and the driver was pleasant. I did have 1 topping missing from my pizza but when I called in to speak to a manager the issue was resolved in less than a minute. The manager offered to have a new pizza remade and sent out. I ordered pizza, pasta and a 1 liter drink. First time having the alfredo pasta and it was delicious. I also did the review on the receipt to make sure the manager receives recognition for good customer service. I will certainly be ordering again.

20.description: Food arrived on-time but cold and poorly made. I ordered two medium pizzas and one was OK but the second had half of the necessary cheese and sauce. There were huge patches of crust (in the center of the pizza) with no sauce or cheese. And considering it was one of the "lovers" pizzas, you would have thought it would have a decent amount of the other ingredients, but no, nothing. Back to Dominos I go....

19.description: Food arrived on-time but cold and poorly made. I ordered two medium pizzas and one was OK but the second had half of the necessary cheese and sauce. There were huge patches of crust (in the center of the pizza) with no sauce or cheese. And considering it was one of the "lovers" pizzas, you would have thought it would have a decent amount of the other ingredients, but no, nothing. Back to Dominos I go....

2.description: Don't order here!!! By far the worst delivery experience I've ever had in Chicago. It's been THREE HOURS since we ordered and the food is still not here. It's the second time this has happened. Customer service is also terrible - we called two times and the workers would give us no estimate, just said that "the delivery guy was on his way" and went away to do other stuff. Extremely disappointed with Pizza Hut and I sincerely hope this is not how they treat their customers at other stores.

18.description: I've been here twice for pick up pizza, the first time..the cashier wasn't friendly was acting a little rude and obscene, to be honest. And when we took the pizza home, it tasted nothing like 'pizza hut' pizza. Highly disappointed.The second time, we ordered take out again, and this time it was a different cashier, very nice and friendly. This time the pizza was just the way it's suppose to be. Tasty!So i guess all in all its a hit or miss with this location! Or maybe try number 3 will do the trick. Who knows.Till i yelp again...

13.description: I have been waiting on my small order for over 2 hours. I live exactly 2 minutes away. I will never order from this location again.  Every time I call the cashier says "He's 5 min away".  So upset right now.

4.description: I just had one of the worst delivery experiences I've ever had. It took nearly THREE HOURS to get our COLD food. I called after an hour to check the status, and someone assured me that my food was out for delivery. I called hour 2 for another status update and was told my food had not been made yet and that they would get it to me as soon as possible. I asked them to assure me that my food would be hot when it arrived, and it was promised it would be. They lied. The delivery driver did not even get out of her car! She rolled down her window, and I was signing the credit card receipt on the icy, snowy side of her car. Give me a break! This doesn't even take into account the fact that two of the items we ordered were not in stock, so we had to pick replacements for the food we initially ordered. No one offered me any apologies for the delay, any discounts, or anything. I work in customer service, and if I treated a customer this way, I would be embarrassed.

6.description: Horrible I have been waiting two hours for my delivery and it has yet to arrive. I even called them and asked what happened with my delivery she stated that he was leaving out that was 30mins ago and I only live down the street. If I could give them 0 stars that would be wonderful!

15.description: Since my last review this place has really gotten their act together. Everything is always fresh and done on time and they never slack on the toppings! I'm not sure who is back there making the pizzas but they are doing a fantastic job not to mention they always have a deal.

7.description: My boyfriend ordered a BBQ Chick. Pizza from here & it was delicious. Im so pleased with the changes they have made.

8.description: They don't answer the phone and I all I wanted to know was why have a app and place an order and 3 hours later trying to call just to see it went through

14.description: I ordered for delivery online around 4:30-5 pm yesterday. They say it'll be here around 8:30 pm. I was like that's a long time but I waited until 7 and called to see what happened to my order. They said they came and no one answered. First of all, they were supposed to call first, second they didn't come to my house cause I didn't here no doorbell or anything. They tell me they'll come back out in a few minutes so I said okay. I wait another hour and they said they should be on they way so I was like okay ummm it's not that far. Then I call a third time and someone different answers and said that it'll be a 3 hr wait cause it's one delivery driver but I ordered mine at 4 pm and it's almost 9!!! I told the to just cancel it cause there's no telling what they could've did with it by now. I was so disappointed. I'm ordering from a different one for now on. And the lady on the phone should've told me it's a 3 hour wait!!!

3.description: This shop does great work but you will wait for 2 hours because they have 2 people scheduled at the same time. I went to this shop on Saturday I had an appointment at 12. I came there to find another person also had an appointment at 12. They asked did I want to come back at 2pm and I said no I am fine with waiting here. I waited 2pm rolled around and the young lady that was going to do my hair. MAGGIE was  still finishing up. When I got up to walk to the door at 2:35 that is when someone stated that that they will start my hair. I got my hair started at 3pm and did not leave until 6pm. on top of that I was really irate and texting one of my friends about the situation and she was reading my text messages. HOW RUDE IS THAT! That is very unprofessional and it explains why they take soo long to finish somebody's hair. Since they are being NOSEY. When I got up to leave she stated I didn't have to call her a name. She wouldn't have known this if she was not LURKING in my phone. I advise you all not to go here since they do what they want and do hair when they feel like it.On a side note there is too much texting and breaks they take here.  I will rather travel to ST CHARLES than spend my money here. The first time I came here the service was fine, but the second time it was ridiculous. - SIGNEDNEVER COMING BACK TO THIS SO CALLED PLACE OF BUSINESS

1.description: If it was possible to give a business 0 stars that is exactly what this hair braiding shop would receive. I went to this salon to get a touch up on my Senegalese twist. I normally go to someone else, but considering I waited to the last minute, my shop was booked, so I decided to patronize this business because it's nearly walking distance from my home.My appointment was scheduled for 9am, and I arrived at 9am. When I arrived there was already one other woman being serviced, so I was asked to wait in the chair. I waited, and waited until another woman came strolling in at about 9:20am. We started at approximately 9:30, and my hair only took a little over 2 hours to complete. Not bad, right? That's what I thought too, until I looked at my hair in the mirror and noticed that my twist were significantly shorter than the twist that I originally had in my hair. When getting a touch up, you only take down the perimeter of your hair to be re-twisted, giving you a new and fresh look despite the twist that were not done over in the middle. I literally took down two rows of twist in the front, one row of twist in the back, and one row along the sides of my head. To be honest, I should have only paid maybe, $50, but when I asked Fatou what the price would be she told me $80. Now, granted we had already had a conversation about price the day prior and although I thought $80 was a bit expensive for a touch up, I still came to the shop because I had no where else to go. The problem didn't come in until I politely asked Fatou why is it $80 when my twist are not even the same length as my original twist. She immediately became aggressive and visibly upset. Keeping my composure, I asked her to calm down because it really wasn't necessary for her to be as angry as she was. I asked a simple question, and as a customer I have the right to do so, especially if my hair is not done how it should be. Fatou continued to display aggressive behavior, yelling  and carrying on. I explained to her that I have full intention of paying the amount quoted, however, I don't think it's fair considering she did not do my hair how it should have been, and it only took her a little over 2 hours. The price she quoted me is equivalent to almost half the price they charge for a full-head of Senegalese twist, which can take anywhere from 6-12 hours depending on the braider' speed, size, and length. The amount of hair that needed to be touched up in my head was not even close to half, it was barely 1/3, not to mention I took the hair down myself prior to coming to the shop, and they were not as long as my original twist. For these reasons there was no way my hair was worth $80, and because I decided to speak on that( very politely might I add), Fatou became extremely enraged. Besides the fact that Fatou was yelling at me, and very aggressive, once she received the $80 from me, she yelled at me saying not to come back and kicked me out of her shop. I've honestly never seen anything like this, especially towards someone that was nothing but nice during my entire visit. Fatou is very rude, doesn't practice good business etiquette and doesn't appreciate her customers. Sorry for the long post. I normally don't even write reviews, but this was very necessary.

2.description: Two stars because the first time I went I had a good experience and the second time was worth 0 stars. The first time, I got small sengalese  twists.  Maggie did them and she did a great job. I was annoyed that she was 1/2 hour late for my appointment but the quality of her work made up for it. However, this second time, I made an appointment a day in advance and when I got there there were 6 people having their hair braided and one waiting. But, I'd made an appointment so I expected to be serviced. After 20 minutes I was asked if I could come back tomorrow by the owner. I said no, because I had to work. So she said she would call a friend to come. But, after another ten minutes she told me that she needed me to come back tomorrow. I told her that since I'd made an appointment expecting to be serviced and she did not call me to tell me that she needed me to reschedule, I would not be back. General concept here. Respect my time and provide decent customer service.

0.description: So I initially wanted to go to Bijou's hair braiding place, less than two blocks away, but they tired to charge me $250 for mid-back senegalese twists, which is absolutely RIDICULOUS. SO then I walked over to Fatou's and I'm glad I did.The place isnt that great looking on the inside. but the quality of work made up for it.I asked her how much it would cost, and she said $180, which was an awesome price considered in have long, thick hair. I asked how long I would have to wait because everyone was busy and she said thirty minutes. Then I told Fatou that I was going to Walgreens to buy some chips and she asked me to hurry because we would get started soon. This was annoying because when I got back, I waited another HOUR until someone started on my hair. After a woman doing about five braids on my hair, she said that they were going to stop and eat. This was kinda annoying because i got there around 3 and i only have 5 braids in my head by 5..But when they were done eating, three people started working on my hair and finished it in about 3.5-4 hours, which was great because I thought it would take 5-6 hours. I was out of the shop by 9.My only complaint is that they do overbook. Fatou(the owner) scheduled about five or six clients for 9 AM the next day, and only four women worked there. Also they do braid tight but I love my hair!I would reccommend!

4.description: This shop is not closed and they are awesome!!!

1.description: I've been getting my bike tuned up here for years.  Fast, experienced, clean service at a really good price.  And best of all, great customer service.

0.description: Came in with a flat, fixed in ten minutes for ten dollars.

1.description: It was ok, it wasn't the best that I ever had but it defiantly was not the worse either. But I am sick so my taste buds are off. I will try them again in the near future and update my review.

9.description: I called ahead to order a jerk chicken dinner and the guy said 15 minutes. I typically know jerk chicken spots usually take at least 30 minutes. So I took my time getting there 30 minutes later and it was not ready. I only ended up waiting maybe 5-7 minutes in the restaurant. The food was definitely worth the wait! The chicken was fresh and seasoned well. And the sides were great and plentiful that it took 3 of us to finish the one dinner! I will definitely be back! Just be prepared to wait for your food.

23.description: Finally a restaurant in Chicago where the taste and heat level of ALL the food on my plate meets my expectations. The owner/chef is Paulette who is a sweetheart and will take good care of you. There's a single table which is more for waiting than eating. They do accept credit cards. Dinners consisting of meat, beans & rice plus two sides typically run under $10 bucks while the seafood dishes are a little more. The portions are very generous. Metra trains run down the middle of 71st Street so pay heed to the "Yield" signs which are all over the place here.Of course the jerk chicken is the dish to get. I have a weakness for curry, so I got some of that to go also. The dinners are served on a generous bed of rice and beans and come with two sides. For one side I got steamed cabbage. Paulette works her magic even on the lowly cabbage which is seasoned to culinary nirvana.Oxtails. Curried goat. Talk about authentic! They even had escoviched fish on the menu which is akin to a ceviche. And then there's callaloo which is like spinach and I've had it only in Jamaica.Jared S. was the First to Review this place and he uses the word "spectacular" to describe it. Totally agree.So after eating food from here I have this urge to go out and have my hair braided...

12.description: This place is a hidden gem with all the jerk chicken spots opening up in Chicago this one takes the cake. I called as they were closing and they took my order with no problem. I had the jerk wings and the half dark dinner. The chicken was spicy but not overbearing and the sides were amazing! I had Mac and cheese and cabbage. The chicken wasn't dry like I see at most jerk chicken places. If your over east on the south side of Chicago and you got a taste for some jerk you must try this spot!

21.description: Um, I don't know what place the other reviewers went too because this food was Nasty with a capital N!!!The jerk chicken wings were the only thing that had any saving grace to this place but the sides were just horrible!My daughter likes this place that's why I went but since she isn't a person that truly cooks or eats real food I should have known I would not like this place!!!This is another place I wouldn't go to if it was free!

16.description: Excellence Jerk Fish. Love the Cabbage! The Owner is about service and providing customers a good experience, he responds to inquiries you might have about food or service. I must warn you, call ahead or be prepared to wait..... Although you won't be disappointed the wait can be a bit long, otherwise would rate a five!

17.description: Uh, I stopped in on a Saturday afternoon and they pretty much had no food...so... I guess I can't review a restaurant that has no food.  Who does that? The woman behind the register seemed pretty indifferent to the fact. Come to think of it, I've never seen anyone in there either. Suppose I won't be going back.

10.description: The jerk chicken is decent enough and that's the main attraction. The rice and everything else is basic. The staff seemed in a state of perpetual irritation or indifference. The place has a Times Square vibe of hurry up and shut up. If I'm hungry and walking by and smell the grilling, I'd probably stop in again but otherwise I wouldn't make a planned trip to the place.

5.description: Not only did the lady had much attitude behind the counter but the gentleman who was trying to take my order wouldn't stop staring me in the face long enough besides trying to ask me for my phone number to get the fucking order right after all that the chicken is okay for jerk chicken not enough seasoning but my rice is swimming literally swimming in sauce The ox tails are sweet with sugar who the hell makes oxtail sweet for Jamaican restaurant

11.description: The man who owns it is nice.   The jerk chick was very good and the cabbage is delicious! Rice and peas and macaroni were normal, but good. I had curry chicken once and the portion was a bit smaller but only okay. Pretty consistent spot. Going to try the oxtails next.

22.description: You know a restaurant is going to be good when all of the staff speaks with a thick Jamaican accent. They are regularly out of certain items. If it was subway, I'd be upset, but these people cook everything from scratch! Be prepared for delicious food and huge portions!

0.description: Love the customer service and the chicken is soooooo good...I go to this establishment at least two time a week during the summer...

20.description: By far the BEST Red Beans and Rice HANDS DOWN!! My boyfrend and I went the first time and ordered the jerk chicken with red beans and rice, plantains, and cabbage and I must say that my boyfriend is a chef so he is EXTREMELY critical on food at restuarants and he LOVED every bite. Next trip we shared an order of jerk oxtails with the red beans and rice, cabbage, and plaintains ANOTHER winner. This food is simply delicious! I always thought Uncle Joe's was the go to place for jamaican, but I have def learned otherwise and the fact that I can get great jamaican food around the corner from my apt is why they def deserve 5 stars! :) Will try the jerk tilapia on my next visit.

19.description: Awful Awful Awful customer service. I ordered over the phone and I could barely hear the young lady on the other end. She said my order would be ready in 20 minutes so I waited. Arrived to pick up my order only to be met with a confused look and fumbling around. She went back into the kitchen and I waited for several minutes. I stood, waiting. She returned with a blank and un concerned look on her face - said something like "yeah this is what you ordered, it's going to be another 30 minutes. No apology. Just sheer confusion. I said no thank you and again she was unbothered and never apologized. The look on her face and tone was that of I did something wrong. Will never return.

2.description: Its a good restaurant but the service is not up to par.  I called in my order and was happy to know that I  would just walk in and just pay. To my surprise, when I got there 30 minutes later my food wasn't prepared. I had to wait an additional 30 minutes to get my food. To top it off that it was incorrect. They had gotten my order wrong. I didn't realize it until I got home.  The food was good though. The area is kind of suspect though. You got to be able to hold your own.

18.description: By far the BEST Red Beans and Rice HANDS DOWN!! My boyfrend and I went the first time and ordered the jerk chicken with red beans and rice, plantains, and cabbage and I must say that my boyfriend is a chef so he is EXTREMELY critical on food at restuarants and he LOVED every bite. Next trip we shared an order of jerk oxtails with the red beans and rice, cabbage, and plaintains ANOTHER winner. This food is simply delicious! I always thought Uncle Joe's was the go to place for jamaican, but I have def learned otherwise and the fact that I can get great jamaican food around the corner from my apt is why they def deserve 5 stars! :) Will try the jerk tilapia on my next visit.

13.description: Um, I don't know what place the other reviewers went too because this food was Nasty with a capital N!!!The jerk chicken wings were the only thing that had any saving grace to this place but the sides were just horrible!My daughter likes this place that's why I went but since she isn't a person that truly cooks or eats real food I should have known I would not like this place!!!This is another place I wouldn't go to if it was free!

4.description: not only are they extra slow but the lil girl who works there has a jacked up attitude! we are used to jamaican restaurants being slow but 45mins for a breakfast sandwich is ridiculous!  and instead of the lil girl apologizing she said well there are ppl ahead of you...uuummm really? i was the only one left from the ppl ahead of me and a guy who came 30min after me got his food before me. needless to say i didn't get any food because i asked for my money back and i did it without the attitude that I really wanted to give her. but being ignorant doesn't fix ignorance so i left hungry.  not to mention she must be use to giving ppl back their money because she did it without even batting an eye, without an apology,  and with an attitude.  smh one thing the owner needs to know is no matter how good the food is horrible service will shut you down. there are plenty of jerk chicken places in chicago with better food and waaaay better service.  ps...i only gave the restaurant a stat because i had to to post this. i don't care hiw good the food is if your service sucks everything sucks.

24.description: Was visiting a friend who just moved to the neighborhood and was looking for a place that had take out.  By chance I came across Royal Caribbean Jerk and ordered a variety of dishes including the jerk chicken and oxtails.  I am not very familiar with Jamaican food however the food was spectacular.  On top of the amazing food the price was extremely reasonable and the the food came out very quickly.  I did not have to wait but just 10 minutes for my food to be prepared.  If you love juicy flavorful food I highly recommend Royal Caribbean Jerk!!!!

6.description: This is not the type of jerk chicken I am use to seems like it was baked in the oven and it had no heat to it and the sauce is the worst jerk sauce I have ever had in my life all in all the chicken is not nasty but not what I was expecting will definitely not be back.

15.description: I love their jerk chicken dinner...man it can feed 2+ people...i definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for some good Jamaican jerk!!!

7.description: Ordered takeout and it did satisfy my craving. A bit pricy but you get good portions. Jerk chicken was moist and cooked very well. The mac cheese was impressive, which is not common. The rice and bean were a bit off because the gravy/sauce was a bit sweet. Not that terrible but  surprising.

8.description: I like white meat and lot of places tend to dry it out,but Not here! The jerk sauce is very spicy and has a nice texture to it, not watered down like some places.  I usually get plantain and mac and cheese for sides so I haven't tried any of the other sides yet. My food is always hot and fresh so I keep coming back. .BUT. . the service is terrible...extremely terrible.  They're rude as heck!  Extra rude...And you might want to go before it gets dark outside because the surroundings are less than desirable. Ijs.

3.description: This is a hidden gem! The customer service is excellent, fast and friendly! I'm a creature of habit, I usually have jerk chicken with plantains, cabbage and rice (DELICIOUS). So I was a bit apprehensive when it was suggested that I try the lobster, but it was AMAZING! The lobster over with rice garnished with onions and peppers was seasoned perfectly! The potato salad and green salad really complimented the lobster and rice. As usual I was very pleased with the service and food!

14.description: Finally a restaurant in Chicago where the taste and heat level of ALL the food on my plate meets my expectations. The owner/chef is Paulette who is a sweetheart and will take good care of you. There's a single table which is more for waiting than eating. They do accept credit cards. Dinners consisting of meat, beans & rice plus two sides typically run under $10 bucks while the seafood dishes are a little more. The portions are very generous. Metra trains run down the middle of 71st Street so pay heed to the "Yield" signs which are all over the place here.Of course the jerk chicken is the dish to get. I have a weakness for curry, so I got some of that to go also. The dinners are served on a generous bed of rice and beans and come with two sides. For one side I got steamed cabbage. Paulette works her magic even on the lowly cabbage which is seasoned to culinary nirvana.Oxtails. Curried goat. Talk about authentic! They even had escoviched fish on the menu which is akin to a ceviche. And then there's callaloo which is like spinach and I've had it only in Jamaica.Jared S. was the First to Review this place and he uses the word "spectacular" to describe it. Totally agree.So after eating food from here I have this urge to go out and have my hair braided...

0.description: Have you ever been to a beauty supply store and they make you feel like they just saw you on a line up on CSI Investigations well this place doesn't do that at all; they make you feel like they want your business and you are a valued customer.I always feel comfortable and the owner as well as the staff is very friendly.  They have a very wide selection of wigs.As far as price goes they are about comparable to many other beauty supply places.  I have been here a few times and each time I have had a good experience.  My daughter went crazy buying so many different barrettes and balls for my granddaughter hair that I thought she was trying too start her own store....lolIt's a nice size store  and it's well lit...If you buy wigs you know that is important!I will be back!Enjoy!!!
