1.description: I don't know how this subway has survived but it has!  I mean when I went it wasn't that the staff was rude, or the place wasn't clean but my sandwich wasn't fresh!I like the old subway, you know the one that didn't charge you extra for everything!  The one that use to really add meat to the sandwich so when I bite down I can taste the meat.Now, when you go to subway if you don't purchase extra meat you are biting down on a hard bread sandwich with veggies!!On that note unless every restaurant is closed in my neighborhood and my stomach is growling for any type of substance to feed the hunger then that is the only way I would be a customer of this subway again!!!

2.description: The cashier was rude and I lost it and threw a sandwich at him.  :(Now I can't go back there.  And everyone in the neighborhood recognizes me as the crazy girl who threw a sandwich at the Subway guy.I'm sorry!  Here's five stars.

0.description: I've never been disappointed in this Subway. You tell them what you want, and they make it. They don't give you attitude, and always thank you for your business. The restaurant is ALWAYS clean, so I don't have to worry about if roaches were dining on my bread right before me. They also accept those little Subway coupons you get in the mail too which makes it nice and might save you a dollar or two.However, I don't think I recall seeing a bathroom for customers, and they never ask me if I want my bread toasted. Luckily for me, I don't like my bread toasted anyways!

I ran across B Selfish when they were at their first location and although the barbers are the same I missed their larger location.This one is smaller but the barbers are the same and my daughter will probably laugh but I can't remember the barber's name but I know he was the one in the middle and he was kinda cute...lol but not only that he was good at what he did when it came to cutting hair.  That's what counts the most!!!He had a line waiting for him and seemed as if he got in a zone when he began to cut hair as he got into the rhythm and buzz of the blades going against the grain of the hair he was in his own world.For my ladies we just found out from a natural hair care tech if you just want to cut your hair off then go to a barber but if you are looking for  something that entails the health of your hair you may want to go some place else...this by no means takes away from this establishment but you don't go to a shoe store for clothes so don't go to a barber if you are looking for healthy hair.Since this was just  a simple chop and go we didn't worry about the health of the hair right now but next time she may go if she decide to grow out her hair.The natural hair tech wasn't at the barber shop either I was just giving you some information that was given to me.The barbers are friendly but I do feel like I'm peeking into a secret world of men that I'm not suppose to see when I go in...lol not because they are disrespectful in any kind of way but because I am the older lady at the shop...smileIf you are in need of cut check out B Selfish and I believe you will B Satisfied!!!Enjoy!!!

58.description: Healthy portions, but have a way to go for that authentic caribbean flavor.

56.description: This place is the best, I am in love, the macaroni & cheese taste like my granny is back there cooking. I definitely recommend this place anytime jerk is mentioned. I am a Banana Leaf spokesperson...LOL!!!

29.description: I enjoyed the chicken. I have ordered 2x by calling ahead. I ordered the quarter jerk chicken only and it's less than $6, very filling. I'll be back.

42.description: Amazing carrabean food. i've tried stew chicken, oax tale & jerk chicken. Cabbage is great, rise is nice & moist. and they do give you spices on the side, for us "yankees" :)neighborhood gem. Do call when ordering take out (i've uploaded the pic of the menu), it does take 10-15 min.

23.description: Banana Leaf never disappoints!! The jerk fish Rice, cabbage, and macaroni is to die for!! Calling on your order is the best way to order because wait times inside could be between 20-40min on Friday or Saturday nights..Definitely worth the wait

47.description: I highly recommend this place.  Everything was good starting from the time I entered the restaurant until I finished my food.  I called ahead of time and place my order and the young lady called me back to let me know that my jerk catfish would take a little longer and wouldn't be ready until a certain time and when I arrived at given time, my order was ready as promised.  She was polite and very pleasant and my food was just hot and delicious.  Love it!!!

8.description: Why are they so much haters never thought such a group of people can hate on each other for petty stuff...!? You go their for the food if it's good or bad what should shape your mind not if they don't kiss your ass.?! Everyone in my mind is entitled to have a bad day .. Tin woman moment . Relax. No wonder public servants get a lot of beefs here.. Be happy you have nice food business in your neighborhood a lot of us is just stuck eating just boring Mexican in ours ! Bottom line great food consistent decent service for a takeout style joint . Consider what price point non 5 star Reaurant likes of Shaws, alinea, maestros ect.. Don't expect to be butt pissing and yes they do say please and thank you. Decent food for price and what it is fast food busy take out type place . No soup for u

31.description: Excellent food. Great owner in Rick I love this place. I have gone there many times. It is the best Caribbean food in Chicago

16.description: I have tried several Jamaican Restaurants in Chicagoland area & around the country, But I have never come across many that would measure to the quality & freshness of the food, great customer service  as well as quantity even fir the reasonable prices. Banana Leaf is the spot, & I will recommend it to individuals, large groups & even catering. Rick just knows how to keep the customer happy & has always gone above & beyond the call of service. Please consider trying it & I promise if you really know about what you are looking for in the jerk business, you will never be disappointed.

13.description: Where to start, the food is good, it really is- but VERY SALTY! The salt has never failed to be in excess at this restaurant, its all throughout the side dishes and in the curry, jerk and stewed dishes.  You can't eat here more than once in a 2 week period unless you don't care about hypertension.  On to the good: The food as i stated is good and they give you good portions. Most of the staff is really friendly but there is one young dark skin woman there that really shouldn't be on the phones or have contact with customers; she mumbles on the phone and always sounds like she would rather be any other place but there. Sometimes the music is too loud and you are asked to repeat your orders. Don't even think about coming here with a debit/ credit card, the sign says the machine is down but since i've been going to this place it's never worked.The jerk chicken is excellent, the curry is either hit or miss and the stewed dishes are just ok. The string beans, cabbage and rice and peas are all good, just very salty. The mac n cheese needs work.

11.description: I am in love with this place. The salads are off the chain. You won't be disappointed!!!

39.description: Still one of my favorite places to eat! Keep up the good work!

37.description: man, I hate to give such a low review, but this is the average of the three times that I've gone. man! So disappointed because the food was sooooooooooo salty! Did I say SALTY?!!! man! I almost had an aneurism when I bit into the chicken the last time I went.SO - the backdrop. After a 35 mile bikeride, a friend recommended this place as having some of the best mac and cheese in the city. Being a mac and cheese, and jerk chicken fan, I said "must try this place." Since i was also starving post my bike ride, I decided to hop in the car and head straight there. I orderd the 1/4 chicken dark, a large mac n cheese, the cabbage and green beans.When I got home, I broke out the food and it was deeelicious! The mac n cheese was definitely very good, the jerk was also very good and tender, and the cabbage and string beans were well cooked. I was a fan!However, I've gone back 2 times since then and MY GOODNESS! The salt content in the food was out of control!! The first time, I thought it was a fluke..maybe an off day. The second time, I realized my first experience must have been the fluke. It seems like over salting is the norm. The last time I ordered from there, I literally rinsed off every piece of chicken, piece by piece, and then had them soak in water. Still too salty even after that. Ended up throwing most away.I had to do the same with my vegetables (soaked, re-soaked, and soaked again) - and then heated back up in microwave. Still over salty.And then the biggest disappointed ever - the mac and cheese! Texture was still great.. flavor would liokely have been great too if it weren't for the fact that it, too, was soooooooo salty! I ended up rinsing (gross, I know) my mac n cheese, as well, in hopes that I could save it. Nope :(  Ate around it some, but ultimately threw it out as well because much too salty.My siste r- who loves salt and has a much higher tolerance than me - even said it was way too salty. Her words: "man! If I think it's too salty, you know that's a problem."So hopefully, they figure out what's going on with the salt before all their customers die from strokes.But since i don't want to be one of them, I'm going to stay away for now.ah well...

0.description: People are definitely sleep on this place. The jerk chicken salad is phenomenal!! They give a generous amount of chicken on top and the chicken is seasoned to perfection!! I would call in the order, otherwise be ready for a bit of a wait.

38.description: Great jerk salad, its a must try. However, when I ordered their chicken is was sooo salty. Therefore I only get the amazing salad oh, and that good mac n cheese

51.description: great prices fresh food love the jerk salad since going here i don't go anywhere else Norman is crazy with his review but he eats at the red pagoda so ....... that says it all. good food great prices

27.description: The first thing I would like to say is the food is GREAT!!!! but the downside is if you call your order in and they will tell you 20mins . Do not believe it the real time it takes to get your called in order is 1 hour!!!! ;( once you arrive to the restaurant to pick up your order that should be ready in 20mins be ready to wait the other 40 mins in the restaurant!!! The lady works there at the front desk is nice I even asked If they deliver to business she said yes!!So I tell my co-workers all about this great food .. I call to place an order they said they don't have a DELIVERY MAN!!!!  So they get three stars from me!

32.description: The food was good, I order the Jerk Chicken (white) with Mac&Cheese and Greens, but the customer service needs some work.

54.description: Suggested BL again for a baby shower, Man the mac and cheese was a superior hit! You can't buy really good mac and cheese at too many places, so people were loading up and coming back for more on the mac alone! The jerk chicken was tender and hot as usual. As long as the customer Service maintains at great and the food just keeps getting better...keep it coming Rick, we need great eating spots on the southside, you are def one of the top contenders.

48.description: The wings are too die for! They are not too hot like most of the jerk chicken places around here. The girl who works there is polite and both of my visits have been short and pleasant. I'll write once I try more entrees.

44.description: The jerk Salad is amazing, the blackened tilapia is good but it's a bit too salty . Pricing is mediocre . All in all it's a pretty good spot. Ps: plantain isn't included in meals

24.description: I can eat here daily . My specialty is the wings, the white chicken dinner ,the jerk chicken salad,their shrimp, jerk chicken salad with shrimp! (Oh me, Oh My) and last but not least the plantains (reheat a little bit in some butter- Yes) But I have heard all their other items are good as well. Sometimes they a little heavy on the salt with the vegetables!Try it and I believe you will be satisfied !

7.description: I noticed that girl that works we're gloves all the time that means she is touching money and people's food.... Smh that's not good and when I asked about it her answer was not good at all

49.description: this is the place to go for some real jamaican food. i strongly recommend you try the chicken ,string beans ,mac & cheese but a hidden jewel is the shrimp and crap dip  it is to die for.    love everything  that rick serves, the best jamaican food around !

40.description: I am a return visitor for the Jerk  chicken and tilapia salad on a regular. I did NOT care for the jerk soup, lamb chops and jerk wings. If you would like a excellent salad stop in.

53.description: Great food! Im a health enthusiast and have them prepare all my meals for the week! I get a tray of jerk chicken and specially prepared blackened tilapia to last me through the week!

30.description: The mac and cheese and yams were good.  I'm glad to know that I'm not the only one who felt the food was a bit salty.  The jerk chicken and fried chicken were definitely too salty.  Come on, Banana Leaf, you know we need to watch our blood pressure.

46.description: I came here after reading reviews and looking for a nearby place for takeout. It took multiple attempts to find their website with a menu, but I eventually found it. I ordered jerk chicken wings and she said the wait time was only 5 minutes. I got there about 20 minutes later and my food was still hot. I didn't have to wait very long to pay. The food was delicious. I will return. On 79th street they have the pay to park boxes but I parked on Euclid where there was free parking and many open spots

1.description: What can I say The Banana Leaf is the best jerk spot on the south side of Chicago in my opinion. Prior to eating here I wasn't a fan of jerk cuisine, but I had the pleasure of meeting the owner Mr. Bailey and he convinced me to try it. I absolutely fell in love and have been a customer ever since. I absolutely love the jerk salad and the rice, but you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The prices are reasonable and the food is seasoned to perfection!!!!

55.description: I consider myself a jerk chicken expert having been to Jamaica quite a few times.  This place has the best jerk chicken in Chicago!  It's tasty and juicy.  And they are fast...you don't have to wait forever for your order and deal with nasty staff attitudes like a certain other jerk chicken place on the South Side.

9.description: It was alright. Sometimes i think living in Miami and traveling to Jamaica makes it harder for me to appreciate Jamaican food in other places.

26.description: I ordered 2 white jerk dinners. 2 jerk dinners half white with string beans and peas with rice and cabbage with a slice of bread and a can of pop. The meat was very plentiful and tender a little too burnt on the outside for my taste. The peas and rice was nasty and the gravy tasted burnt. The cabbage was over cooked. I heard rave reviews about the banana leaf and I was disappointed with the peas and rice and the cabbage. Customer service was good and the wait was a little too long.

25.description: Ok. So I went here and figured that im a natural fan of Jerk but they have some greatly prepared Jerk chicken. See, why I recommend this place is because you get a variety  of selections with one dinner is which I search high and low for in a restaurant so it automatically gets approval. The dinners are very affordable. Suits as one of the best when it brings up all aspects. I love to eat but don't eat beef or pork so I specialize in Chicken, Turkey & Fish. When I ordered living on 79th & Oglesby, I visited this place with friends & the dinner was right on time. I eat to live and live to eat Good.Don't get it twisted.Street-preneur.

12.description: I come here for the jerk chicken salad!! I work across the street from Uncle Joes yet I still travel 15mins away to get my salad for lunch. Not only is their small salad larger than Uncle Joes student salad (which cost a little more) but they give you so much more meat and they use real GREEN lettuce as opposed to Uncle Joes yellow/green iceberg lettuce!!! The ladies that work the counter are always polite

59.description: Ummm....Well, I went in on a referral from a good source (I thought).  He did remind me we only discussed the Curry Chicken which of course I forgot about.  Here it goes...I was so hungry.  I went to a nearby boutique to browse as I waited for a friend to join me for dinner.  When she finally got there, she wanted to see what I got and of course, she then wanted to "browse" before dining.  When we finally got in the restaurant,  I ordered first because remember, I was starving.  The dinners are already set meaning you could not deviate from the side dishes but I didn't care, I was hungry.  But my friend did.  She questioned if all the dinner options were this way and they said yes, you can only have rice & peas, cabagge and the special bread along with your entree choice.  Plus NO plaintain came with it.  She was bothered by this and decided against ordering.  The young girl behind the counter was not happy with this and made a couple of choice faces as my friend walked away.  I decided it wouldn't be right to stay so I asked if it was too late to cancel the order (It is NEVER too late) and the young girl behind the counter asked the cook and he said yes it was.  I got the food (because I was hungry) and proceeded to leave when I remembered I was suppose to order something for another friend but I didn't get a chance. Thank God I didn't. I did not turn back because I didn't want them to mess with the next order because my friend did not make one.  I decided to share my meal with the other friend.  We ate (because we were both hungry) overcooked rice, cabbage,and deprived jerk chicken.  I was highly disappointed and so was the other hungry person.  I will probably not patronize this place again.  My friend had a right to complain.  Oh and I did get a banging dress at the boutique across the street thanks to the Banana Leaf.  Thanks!

21.description: The Jerk catfish gives me life!!! Everything is Flavorful! They don't run out of chicken like other jerk places, service is fast! I can get in and out with my food, plantains delicious and they have Mac and cheese which is good also!

17.description: I've gone twice and plan on going again. MAKE SURE YOU CALL AHEAD or you'll be siting for 30 minutes. The food is great a lil too salty for me, but still good. Great portion sizes and lunch specials.

10.description: Ok. So I went here and figured that im a natural fan of Jerk but they have some greatly prepared Jerk chicken. See, why I recommend this place is because you get a variety  of selections with one dinner is which I search high and low for in a restaurant so it automatically gets approval. The dinners are very affordable. Suits as one of the best when it brings up all aspects. I love to eat but don't eat beef or pork so I specialize in Chicken, Turkey & Fish. When I ordered living on 79th & Oglesby, I visited this place with friends & the dinner was right on time. I eat to live and live to eat Good.Don't get it twisted.Street-preneur.

5.description: I absolutely love everything I have had here!! Tilapia, cabbage, Mac and cheese, rice, jerk veggies and more!! I live in Boston but EVERY TIME I am in Chicago I make it a point to visit Banana Leaf. You should too!

3.description: I normally  go to Uncle Joe's but heard such wonderful things about this place I gave it a shot.. All I can say is, salt.  I ordered jerk chicken and it was very salty and the string beans and cabbage that came with it were very salty. I don't think I will be going back but they seem to do very well so there are a lot of people that like salty food.

35.description: I went to this place because a friend of mine posted a pic of her Jerk Chicken Salad on FB and it looked delicious.  So I called in an order for my husband and I.  The Jerk salad for me and a white Jerk dinner for him.  The service was actually pleasant.As she stated  (friend on FB) and as it looked my salad was DELICIOUS.  However, my husband's food was not.  As another reviewer stated, the sides were EXTREMELY salty.  I love cabbage and could not eat it.  A couple pieces of chicken was burned (not jerked).They really should put less salt, if a person desires more they can add it.  But you can't take it out when you over do it.  It destroys the meal.

19.description: The only reason this review is getting three stars is because the food is actually good. However, the wait and customer service is about a one star. For example, one evening we ordered a jerk catfish/chicken combo dinner. They didn't have ANY sides with the exception of string beans. They did have plantains and refused to substitute despite their inconvenience of not having anything prepared. This same evening we waited over 40 minutes for our food. We even noticed another customer that called her order in waited just as long as we did. All things considered the food is good, I just can't say whether or not it's worth the risk of waiting almost an hour for.

28.description: It was alright. Sometimes i think living in Miami and traveling to Jamaica makes it harder for me to appreciate Jamaican food in other places.

45.description: Good place to get some decent jerk. Hot sauce was great. Mac n cheese was good-it's the real stuff, just like the homemade kind, but too salty for me. Rice and beans have never dissapointed, and I could've passed on the cabbage --I'm used to the red peppers and carrots and SEASONING in there. You get a good amt of food with great, great service, so you can't beat that. Also they do catering. I've had them for 2 events, and they're professional, reasonably priced, and on time. Everyone loved  the chicken and Mac and cheese. Great business.

33.description: The customer service was great. Yet, the food was awful. I will not be coming here for a meal again. I was craving Jamaican food and got something totally different. SMH On a positive side, their portion size can feed two people so you get more bang for your buck.

43.description: At this tme, it was terrible.  Chicken was too much salty. It  was not chicken but SALT !!!  Maybe chicken was soaked in salt water long long time before cooking.  I really disappointed and  threw out a  haf chicken meals.Owner MUST KNOW  3 things.1. Customers want fresh chicken.  2. Too much salty chicken can not be consumed. 3. Chicken not salted is no problem because we can eat it with our own salt.Let  customers enjoy yout food with their own standard of consuming salt.

2.description: This is a hidden gem.  My husband swears by the wings.  I prefer the jerk chicken salad. It has jerk chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, red onions and your choice of dressing.  It comes in a small or large with a buttered piece of wheat pita bread.  I can't comment about the other food selections as I stick with the salad because it's delicious.  But the aforementioned items are affordable. My only issue is as a West Indian, I wish they had West Indian desserts and bread.

18.description: Tried going Sunday afternoon and they were closed. No sign or anything. Make sure you call ahead because the hours are wrong!

41.description: If you want a fried breaded thing, then this is the hood for it. And a side of gross hot sauce that is mostly salt? Easy to find around here also. So when I came in here, I set my expectations low. But man it was so good. The mac and cheese is a new favorite of mine. Add this place to the short list of places in this hood you can get a delish somewhat healthy meal. The chicken is done in the jerk style, so its not fried. And you get enough for 3 people, and cabbage and beans. They have Jamaican sodas here. Love.

52.description: I lived up the street from this place and I have been eating here since they opened up. I love the large portions and seasoned food. Only place I have found with tender ox tails...Cabbage...OH MY...I just absolutely love this place...I now live up north and travel to 79th just for a GREAT meal...I will actually be catering a party from this this weekend..

50.description: This is THEE go-to spot for jerk chicken. I have been to numerous jerk restaurants in Chicago, and when I tell you this is the best......this is the best! The jerk chicken is seasoned to perfection and always juicy. I Love the dark meat and wings, the breast is good too, but dark meat has more of that crispy skin. Oh, and please do not leave out of this place without trying their Mac & Cheese. Their Mac & Cheese is to die for! I introduced this place to some of my friends and family and they refuse to go anywhere else. Also, this place has only been open for a few years and they have gotten a lot of recognition. They were in the Taste of Chicago Festival last year and will be returning this year. I would suggest checking them out . Hope this review helps!!

4.description: The jerk chicken salad is what made me fall in love with this place and the non-chalant, could careless attitude women who work the registers and take the orders made me hate it. Everytime me or my fiance have gone to this restaurant  (a total of 5 times), 3 different women, with funky a** attitudes have taken our order. No "please"  "thank yous", nothing, but they sure know how to take our money. It came to the point where we made our own jerk chicken salads so wouldn't have to deal with this establishments terrible customer service. What resturants need to understand, is their customer service HAS TO BE as good, if not better than their food. P.s. I'm only putting a star because I have to!

6.description: As good as it gets outside Jamaica...ignore the petty comments.  Taste is true Jamaican, grilled jerk chicken (not baked)...desserts are xcellent also.  Always a stop when I'm home visiting Chicago.  (Favorite Pizza place: 'Italian Fiesta')

22.description: Tanya is sooooo sweet they forgot my jerk sauce in one order (I've ordered so many times) they were so polite to offer me something complimentary for even having to make the trip back up there. I love this place not only are The salads sooooo delicious, they give you so much meat but the customer service is off the chain. Unfortunately places on the south side usually do not make u feel welcomed they don't greet u NOTHING but this place did and I think that's a great start.

15.description: Local neighborhood Jerk spot offering tasty food. However, they are rather inconsistent to reach.

57.description: Aww yeah!  THE BANANA LEAF!  I've had the Brown Stew Chicken meal, the cajun(?) Tilapia meal, and both were tasty.They have a great jerk chicken meal, because compared to some other jerk spots in this area I've tried, Banana Leaf's chicken is super moist, not dry.Parking is not great, but hey, it's the city.  If you're in the area, definitely check this one out.

20.description: My absolute favorite spot on the southside to get jerk chicken. They would be my favorite jerk restaurant bit they d ok nt have brown stew often which is a bummer.  I love the 5wing dinner with the string beans. I also like the fact that you get a free drink with the meal. If you are looking for amazing jerk on the southside this is a place to try.

36.description: I'm a fan of great food and customer service. I have only been here once but had a great experience. The customer service was on point and felt more like "Cheers," a place where everybody knows your name.  I had the jerk chicken, which was absolutely tender, seasoned well, and plentiful. I also had the cabbage, which was also very good.. Once I'm down with this Raw Food Detox, I will be back..LOL! The only think I do recommend is that you call in your order. Since they make everything fresh, it takes a while to get your food but it's worth the wait.

14.description: I can eat here daily . My specialty is the wings, the white chicken dinner ,the jerk chicken salad,their shrimp, jerk chicken salad with shrimp! (Oh me, Oh My) and last but not least the plantains (reheat a little bit in some butter- Yes) But I have heard all their other items are good as well. Sometimes they a little heavy on the salt with the vegetables!Try it and I believe you will be satisfied !

3.description: I make my order online, when I get there they say that they're closed when it clearly says they close at 1:00 it was 12:50 when I get there...why would they have me make my order, then say come pick it up when you're closed..and not even closing at the right time. But yet they all wanna pack up the food and take it home for themselves. Pissed me off. Who does that?!

1.description: The food is very overpriced. They claim to take debit, but it is a "cashless atm" so they take the money from your card but charge you 3 bucks to use it. I was not aware of that til after I had purchased my meal. The chicken wings are huge but not in a good way. The grease was old tasting the last time I was there, and of course the customer service is terrible. If I'm spending money in any place, I would like to be greeted as such. Only go here because it is across the street, but if you want good tasting Harold's, try the establishment on 83rd and stony, still overpriced but the customer service is good and the establish looks cleaner.

2.description: Overprice..,,,,the wings look like they're on steroids and customer service sucks.the pop machine never works. There so call Mild sauce is so bitter.

5.description: Walked in on a whim, and I think I interrupted the cashier's lunch break because she had sauce all over her mouth area and was talking on the phone. I got wings and asked for extra sauce which I didn't receive, but the wings were still good.

0.description: I attempted to call the order and the line was busy. I had to drive r to the location before placing my order. Once inside the seating was noticed as old and tattered....but you are able to sit. The line moved quickly. There was a 15 minute wait for my order.....However it was hot, fresh, and delicious! I am so glad I stopped by for lunch.

4.description: I grew up in the city and I grew up eating Harold's. The food is great but this Harold's customer service sucks and I will never be back.

58.description: I hadn't been in this blues bar since 1994. I already give it 5 stars. great place to show off with your friends. Certain nights have guitar night where people can play their instrument and other nights entertainers will show off their guitar blue songs. Great food and drink as well.

56.description: The mission: plan a Girls' Night Out for self and five suburban girlfriends. Destination must include music and dancing.  Destination must not remind anyone of any of the cheesy suburban joints we've attended in the past. Choice made: ROSA'S!! to see Vance Kelly and the Backstreet Band.Result: SUCCESS!!Vance Kelly is a regular at Rosa's and I HIGHLY recommend his show.  The sound was amazing and the vibe of the joint got even the snottiest of my girls to get on her feet and dance.  Cheap drinks, great service, good times.

29.description: Finally went back after about 10 years. Love this place. Melvin was performing the Saturday night we went and he delivered an incredible performance.Rosa's is one of those authentic Chicago gems worth seeking out..

42.description: This is perhaps the most authentic Blues club I've ever been to in the city. There's a cover charge, which I tend to hate, but I'd say it's worth it. Awesome music and good drinks. Oh, and perhaps the best part-in the women's bathroom, they have this on the wall,"Nobody leaves this place without singin' the blues." So fantastic! If you don't know what that quote means or is from, well you just need to brush up on your Chicago themed cheesy 80's movies! Good times.

23.description: Had a wonderful time at Rosa's anniversary benefit show.  Hands-down best blues I've ever seen live, from artists who play there regularly.  Felt very lucky that my friend lives nearby and knew to go there - pretty sure I was the only tourist in the sold-out house.

47.description: The reviews are spot on. Rosa's is a cool blues joint. An $18 cab ride from downtown Chicago. $12 cover, $3-$4 beers, and friendly bartenders. Eric "Guitar" Davis was outstanding! His "Trouble Makin' Man" is a solid CD. Took doorman about 25 minutes to hail a cab back to Chicago because it's a somewhat rougher neighborhood. I shared a cab back with three in town from Claremont Colleges (CA) - one of whom was a music professor. The word is out. Well worth it (even if it takes a while to find a cab back)!

8.description: Roses lounge is THE home of Chicago blues! If you're looking for an authentic, off the beaten track blues experience in a city where "blues club" has often become synonymous with "tourist trap," Rosa's is somewhere you simply must go! It will restore your faith in the blues scene in Chicago.The interior is as dark, slightly grungy, and eclectic as you could hope. The stage is small and the space is intimate. Often times, you'll rub shoulders or brush elbows with the musicians at the bar. Speaking of the bar, the drink selection is simple but sufficient and relatively inexpensive.Whether you show up on a Monday night or a Saturday, Rosa's will give you a warm welcome and the music will not disappoint! You owe it to yourself to go check this place out!

31.description: Wow, this venue is amazing! So much smaller than other Chi blues places that I've been, but far better. I was seated right up front and they have a blasting sound system.Melvin Taylor has been on my list for some time and I was blown away by his live performance. Amazing guitar play and I liked that he mixed up his own tunes along with some great covers. Wish I could have lasted til 3am!

34.description: Very laid back bar that has an amazing array of highly touted, professional music that is as good as any top-notch blues/jazz bar that would cost 2-3X as much on the other side of town. Drinks are stiff/top shelf and the music is stellar. Every time we go we have an amazing time. Highly recommend

16.description: Rosa's Blues Bar at 3420 West Armitage Avenue Chicago. Eric Clapton has dropped in to this place as well as Eric Burdon and many other famous artists. This place is a fun time full of friendly people. In my opinion it's one of the best Blues Bars in the City. Make sure you visit when Melvin Taylor is performing there, you won't regret it.

13.description: I have been coming here for almost 20 years, even before I lived in Chicago, and am very disappointed to how it is now being managed.  I have never had any problems in all the years I have been going there until recently in the last year, when the management changed and now there is a high school mentality running the place. Surly bartenders allowed to roughshod over guests and treat people rudely and with no respect, especially women.  (And yes, I'm a great tipper too).  You can wait forever to get a beer (and if a bartender doesn't like you, you won't get served at all).  They have also escalated the cover charge to $20.00 for most artists, but yet the bathrooms haven't been remodeled (or cleaned) in over 20 years.  Dirt hangs off the old decorations and they have recently removed half of the tables in front of the stage for a "dance floor" (4x4) which leaves even LESS room to be seated and ruins the view for others...the tables and chairs are in horrible disrepair (and it's not charming, it's dangerous).  There is just a narrow pathway to get to the bathrooms and you can bet if you are standing in the way of the over zealous and aggressive bartender/waitress, you will be knocked out of the way.  And if you complain, the fire eating manager comes after you!  Very disappointed to see the changes and the lack of cleanliness.  You will get more bang out of your blues buck if you go to Kingston Mines, Smokedaddy's on Division, (no cover and the BEST staff ever and so clean in there too!!!), Nick's Beergarden (no cover), or B.L.U.E.S. on Halsted, which are all in better, safer neighborhoods too.  That's where you will find me, sipping some craft beer, enjoying the blues music and watching my bluesician friends and, tipping the wonderful and kind staff that appreciates your business!! Don't get me wrong, I love, love, love a good divey blues bar, but this one has submerged.

11.description: I love this place. It has a "hole in the wall" sort of charming quality. You don't come here for fancy decor and fancy drinks, you come here for the music.Blues lovers, this is the place. The people here are nice, love music, and are out to have a great time.May not seem to be in the greatest neighborhood, but I've never experienced any issues.The service is quick, although it can get pretty busy. The bathroom is always clean and stocked (and gets cleaned if something happens in the middle of the night)Good time, good music, good people.

39.description: Clearly I will never keep this place a secret but at least I have you all beat because I can walk here whenever I want.  GF called me last week and told me the acts were great so I just dropped everything and wandered over.  This is when I love Chicago.

37.description: I originally visited Rosa's because I bought a groupon and I thought it would be a fun experience. I had never been to a jazz club before, so really have nothing to compare it to, but I had such a great time. This place gives off such a chill and positive vibe. The talent here is unreal making the cover charge well worth it.  I've visited this place on several occasions after my original groupon purchase and get excited everytime I get to introduce a new person to this great place.

0.description: I've been to Blue Chicago. I've been to Kingston Mines. I've been to Buddy Guys. They are all great venues and offer a different blues experience. But after visiting Rosa's last night with my wife Jessica I have to say that Rosa's takes the cake.Let's start with the people who run the place. Within twenty minutes of getting there around 10:30 we were outside smoking and began chatting up Tony - Rosas' son - and he quite simply could not have been nicer or more welcoming. An Italian by birth, he came to Chicago in the 1980's and is not only an accomplished player but a font of knowledge. The bartenders are amazing as well. Jessica spent several ten minute or so periods talking with them as they recommended tasty drinks and generally entertained her as I was fixated on the music.Which brings me to the star of the night: Lil' Ed and the Blues Imperials. There's no doubt these guys are the real deal. If high energy West Side Blues is your thing then Lil' Ed will fill your cup. And what is perhaps even more impressive than his playing (which I expected to be good) is the fact that during intermissions he's walking around the club, signing CD's, having a smoke outside with the patrons, cracking jokes, posing for pictures and just generally being an ambassador of his band, his music and this club. As Jess put it: "he made me feel like I was a part of it all." I can't put it better than that.This place is a must visit for locals and tourists alike.

38.description: I was at Rosa's a few weeks ago and really enjoyed the laid-back vibe and wonderful talent showcased at this place. This is the quintessential blues club complete with writing on the walls and photos of famous patrons. If you're looking for a swanky venue with 25 types of vodka, this isn't the place. But, if you want to listen to great talent and feel right at home, look no further!

51.description: Yay. Live nearby and have looked longingly out the bus window hoping I could drag some friends westward to stop in here with me...lo and behold, a Groupon comes along and for 50 bones we got admission for 3 of us on a Friday night plus many many drinks and the final bill was 10.00. More importantly the music was delicious and authentic and it felt like the kind of warm neighborhood joint where I would feel okay sitting at the bar solo listening to some music. I loved it as did my amigos. Best way to sum up the place is to relay a story about when we were leaving...an obvious regular said it was a pleasure meeting us, could he have our seats, and to say hello to him when we come back. And its pretty much a given...I will be back!

27.description: Our experience at Rosa's was great!  We saw The Kinsey Report there last night and had a blast.  It was a welcoming, non pretentious atmosphere, with GREAT live music.  Service was good, prices were very reasonable ($15/person cover, 3 beers & 3 bourbons for $45).  We will certainly be back.  Would be a great place for a girls night out, or a night with a big group as well - the dance floor was lively!  So glad it is so close to us - looking forward to walks in the Summer to catch some great live music!

32.description: What an awesome place!  We love blues, and have been to quite a few places in the city. Rosa's is relaxed, comfortable, and unpretentious.  The place was packed for a random Thurs nt -- and even the audience of locals was entertaining.  I had some prbs booking tkts on the website; when i called, Tony was so amazing - he just took my Groupon info and booked them for me over the phone -- super helpful and friendly. The bartender (Angel?) was great and drinks were well made.  Our Groupon deal included some drinks, but I love that there wasn't any "2-drink minimum."  There was a story-telling segment just before the main show that we only got to see the very end of -- love that they are showcasing new talent, and definitely wish we had come earlier.  The actual band came on abt 10:15 or so (listed as 9:30pm), so ended up being a very late night...and a late this morning :)We will definitely be returning...likely on a Friday or Saturday

54.description: Great place to listen to some good blues, really old school, a dive.  Came on a Tuesday night, $7 cover, kinda empty, good drinks and don't remember the prices being outrageous.

48.description: Go to Rosa's if you love the blues!!! Especially if the Chicago Blues Allstars are playing!! Get drunk....dance....Repeat!!!!!

44.description: First, the music is first class, not amateurish. As far as the rest of the atmosphere, it's borderline dive bar-ish. The whole place is pretty small, and it gets pretty crowded when there is a concert. I could not order an old-fashioned at the bar because they don't have bitters. This is the oldest whiskey cocktail in the history of whiskey, and they couldn't do it? Surprising, every other place I've been to could make an old fashioned. But I didn't come here to drink, came here to listen to the blues. The owner asked me on the way out how I found out about the lounge, and he was surprised to hear that it was from yelp. He didn't think anyone uses it. That's probably true for most of the crowd, which is made up of mostly people in their 40s and 50s. Did I mention the music is really good?

24.description: Awesome dive bar/Blues spot in Logan. Musicians all over the U.S. come here to play--quintessential Chicago.

7.description: What couldn't you ask for a more perfect blues night in Chicago? A shady bar, good beers, an enthusiastic crowd and great artists who perform with their heart and soul!  If you want to experience a great night of blues in Chicago, you want to head this way. Corey Dennison performed on Friday night and the crowd + personnel had an amazing evening. We came in around 20:45 which gave us enough time to find a great spot with good views. Most folk seemed to be regulars which only attributed to the entire experience. The place is quite dark which sets the mood perfectly. We will definitely come back here for some more blues!

49.description: My favorite blues bar in the City.  Staff is friendly.  $15 cover on a recent Saturday night seems a bit high to me but I like it anyway.  And will be back and back and back.  It was more crowded this week than last time and we took the very last seats in the joint at 8:30ishpm.  So get there a bit earlier if you can.

40.description: Don't get me started on the amount of love I have for this place.I said don't get me started!!!Ok.... you had to, didn't you.  I'll tell...Rosas is one of the most genuinely cool and laid-back places in this entire city.  The vibe in this place can't be beat.  Scenesters, hipsters, and other general trendy folk - you will be welcomed by the most classy owner despite the obvious.  You don't like blues, but someone told you to check it out because it's cool.  Well, I've got news for you, mr "I purchase $40 t-shirts that look like $5 t-shirts" dude, after leaving this place you WILL love the blues.  Lil Ed plays quite frequently and is always a great act to catch.  One of my first nights I went there I closed the place up and got to spend some time chatting with the band.  I'm a bit of a music fanatic and was thinking we may get into discussions about music and such, maybe I'd witness a little ego-strokin by the musicians...I was prepared.  You know what we ended up talking about?  Lil Ed had to stay up all night after the show to cook for a church event the next day.  We were swapping chicken recipes.  Yah...The owner?  Cool and classy.  He was nice enough to make sure all the closing time stragglers had a safe ride home.  He even walked patrons out to their cabs and said goodnight.  Again, total class.  You don't see enough of it this day and age.  If you're looking for a relaxing, low-key and fun night, Rosas will do you right!!

53.description: Live music was incredible.. Random people kept showing up off the street with instruments and joined in one after the other in one of the most amazing jam sessions i've ever witnessed..Drinks were stiff and cheap.. Everyone in the place was happy and friendly..

30.description: Rosa's Lounge - ok, I'll admit it, my first time of pulling up in front of the place I had a moment of wondering if maybe I'd read the address wrong - but that feeling quickly went away as soon as I walked through the door.  Rosa's is your basic, classic, unpretentious music room - the kinda place that musician's play cuz they love music and crowds that love their music.  If you're expecting long lines, doormen, dress codes or VIP lounges don't come to Rosa's.  If you want a basic blues room with great musicians then come on down.  The staff, and even the  musicians are some of the friendliest, down-to-earth people you will ever have the good fortune of meeting.Walk in, pull up a chair, get a drink, and have a great night of music.

46.description: What a show! We looked to yelp to find a good blues bar and we were very satisfied! Nick Moss & The Flip Tops with Curtis Salgado played a great set. Definitely recommend

1.description: We had a great time here last Saturday night - we advanced purchased tickets to see Melvin Taylor and upgraded to the "guaranteed seating" but when we got there around 8:30 most of the seats were already gone - but we were able to sit up on the back platform so although we were farther away - we were happy with our seats.  Glad to see they didn't let as many people in as last time - last time it was too crowded to move - this time we could get back and forth to the bar and the bathroom without a problem.  The staff was great and Melvin was awesome.  It was a great time.

55.description: Went here in April of this year and found myself in a seedy neighborhood. Had to take a cab out but was lucky that they have their own cab waiting across the street so I didn't have to call for one getting back to my hotel at night. It's basically a dive bar w/live music. There was something like a $5 cover (super affordable entertainment). James Wheeler was playing that night. Classy, older man that knows his blues.It was a pleasure talking with the bartender who gave me some tips on where to go and what to see while in town. She even invited me to hang out with her and her friends one day. I ended up, coincidentally sitting two rows in front of her at a Cubs game behind home plate a few days later! Crazy, small world! If I lived in Chicago, I'd come out to Rosa's all the time. It'd be my local joint that I'd hit up for pool, good conversation and great music. I ended up chatting with quite a few friendly locals, one of whom I ended up going to the Cubs game with! Anyway, great experience for out of towners to check out the local, friendly, scene.

9.description: I'll admit that I'm a bit lax with my Yelp reviews but a recent trip to Rosa's has spurred me into action. This place is my number one live blues venue in all of Chicago. It's got a friendly vibe, consistently great music and a true "bluesy" atmosphere that puts me in mind of my very favorite spots down in Clarksdale, Mississippi. If you're looking for tired retreads of "Sweet Home Chicago" and busloads of loud-talking tourists, then don't make the trek to this blues institution in Logan Square.  Rosa's is the spot for real blues lovers who appreciate top-notch music. Rosa's has been in business for over 30 years and there's a reason for its longevity. It's a home for blues lovers and a great place for musicians to both play and even hang out on their off days.Another thing I love about this club is that fact that they truly care about the musicians who play there. When Eddie C. Campbell had a stroke, they hosted a benefit to help with his health expenses. And when Eric "Guitar" Davis was tragically murdered, Rosa's put on a benefit to raise money for his children.  Rosa's is a family business who treats its artists like "famiglia" and has definitely earned the title of "Chicago's Friendliest Blues Lounge!"With summer winding down, it's time to take a gander at Rosa's September calendar where you'll find everyone from Jimmy Burns and Sugar Blue to Mike Wheeler, Melvin Taylor and other great artists on the docket.So whether you're in town for a few days or a died-in-the-wool Chicagoan, I would highly recommend Rosa's as THE place to hear authentic, true blues music.

26.description: They have the Blues musicians you want to see & hear close up & personal. Great cozy atmosphere, good people, decent street parking, and magical music. Every time I go, it's a great time and really memorable! I remember seeing Pinetop Perkins there many years ago, wow, what a show... so awesome. The owner is super sweet too & an authentically classy guy, for real. Sugar Blue, Melvin Taylor.. all good like butter. It's a smaller place, like 1/3 of Legends, so it's better if you can get there earlier rather than later. You won't regret it if you even remotely like the Blues. I'm more a rock person, but this is an awesome venue and I like to go see Blues here often.

25.description: Hands down the best Blues Bar in Chicago. If you want an authentic blues club devoid of tourists, this is the place. Rosa and her son Tony are great people.

12.description: This place is great- definitely the friendliest blues club in Chicago.  The music is a little funkier than I generally enjoy, but Tony and the bartenders make it a great place to hang out.  Every time we've come in Tony has managed to make the experience personal and worth remembering for our crew.  It's worth the cover charge, you're guaranteed a fun night here!

59.description: wow, amazing time here.screw kingston mines and the tourist traps down in river north. they can't hold a candle to Rosa's.Tony (owner/manager) hooks it up for you if you call ahead. Had a party of 15-20 and we had a reserved spot in the back area. Nice to have our own space and the venue is small enough where we had a great view of the band.Servers/bartenders were all nice and they had decent specials for a Saturday night. $3 high lifes and $5 martinis.The ONLY downside is it's a little far west, so cabs are hard to come by. Definitely try to call a cab company to have one swing by before you leave.Oh, and best part of the decor? Poster of JFK with an abnormally large american flag draped over his shoulder. You need to see it to truly appreciate its awesomenes.

21.description: I am so glad I finally made it to Rosa's as it is as another review notes an awesome dive bar/blues spot in Logan Square.  We saw Lil Ed & the Blues Imperials and they did not disappoint and while seemingly understaffed for the crowd they kept the drinks coming.  I would love to go back sometime to see Melvin Taylor.

17.description: Saw Tad. Great place and great artist, and the most legit blues club in Chicago. I hear the food is good too but I've only consumed the music and drink.

10.description: My favorite blues club in Chicago! Great tunes, good drinks, friendly staff and cozy, just the right size for a night of blues! Can't wait to go back!

5.description: Great Blues Joint that gets some amazing artists on a regular basis! I hadn't been in many years so I was expecting that it had changed quite a bit.. It didn't thank God. Hole in the wall style with a great stage in the back, amazing sound, bar and cocktail tables. They put the cover charge on the chalkboard where you walk in and it's usually very reasonable/ beer & drink prices also very fair! The good thing is it never seems to be totally crowded prob because it's kinda off the beaten path in what once was a bad neighborhood. My recommendation would be dinner at Osteria Langhe/ Live Blues at Rosa's/ Nightcap at Scofflaw! I'm Fuckin' ParTyiN'

3.description: I moved in the area and saw this place on Yelp. This place is just amazing. What a little gem in outskirts of Logan Square. The music is on point and the place has great vibes. It's BYOF and you are able to have things delivered. A+ for its atmosphere. Very intimate and great for a date night or with a group of friends.

35.description: We went there on a thursday which was the open jam....there were a few descent sit -ins....the regulars could play pretty good...staff was very nice and we met some very cool people...the hood could be a bit sketch if it gets late....down home blues baby

19.description: Great music! Good prices. Less tourists.  This place is chill with lots of quirky decor and a good sound system.  You can pay admission with a credit card if you don't have cash.

28.description: Awesome music. Good beer. Great ambiance. Classic decor (signatures on the walls; sparkly stuff hanging from the ceiling; big picture behind the band). Diverse, but seriously enjoying themselves/into the music crowd. Music is loud, but not insane.Cover was $20 on a Saturday night--- we came in 20min before close so he let 4 of us in for $40. Our 3 beers totaled under $20. If you want Chicago blues, this is a must! Just make sure you secure your car and keep anything valuable out of view...

45.description: I would come here frequently if I lived in Chicago. I would come back to hear James Wheeler in a heartbeat; I don't get a chance to hear the blues blues like his where I currently live. The people and atmosphere were super. The owners and staff were very welcoming. Getting here via the Blue line and then 73 bus in mid-evening was painless; I took a taxi back to the South Loop at 2 am for $20 (fare plus tip I think). Some reviews on the internet refer to this as a somewhat sketchy neighborhood. It seemed more quiet to me than threatening, but I wasn't in it long, so I'm not the best person to trust about that. All I know is that I would not hesitate to come here again. Drink prices were reasonable / bordering on cheap for a non-dive-bar with live music. The atmosphere was casual but this place has a cool vibe. You could come here in jeans or more dressed up and be completely comfortable. Although, if anything, a little more energy and less polite listening from the customers would have been good during my single visit, but it wasn't like i was hollering and dancing so I made my own bed. For better or worse, the atmosphere was casual upscale and comfortable. I'm just trying to paint the picture, not criticizing - my night here was great, and I hope to return before too long!

33.description: We came up from Indy specifically for the night of fantastic Blues featuring Billy Branch, Guy Davis, Corey Harris and Sugar Blues.  It was great!The Show:Billy shared some great stories and a little of his unlimited history of his blues journey.  Guy Davis was really good and his snappy personality brought the party to life.  I love his voice.  Corey Harris gave a great acoustic performance w/a strong voice singing what I would call the 'old' bues style.   (-not an expert, just my opinion)  I really like his song Station Blues. Then last but definitely not least, Sugar Blues did some accoustic and his band joined to fire up the house with electricity!  What a great harp player Sugar is, Rico- plays fantastic guitar effortlessly, Pooky Styx-my hubster has seen before & knew he'd be all over those drums, and Sugar's bass player (his wife) was right on and brought a perky personality to the stage. (not to mention, she brought a pretty good size baby about to come into this world)  What a beautiful name 'Llaria'.  Good show! The Club:This is a small club with limited seating, so it was up close and personal.  I called ahead from Indy w/a few questions since the 4day Windy City & these tickets were a birthday present for hubster.  Tony was very helpful.  He also helped us when we arrived there after the doors were open and all the good seats were taken.  The hubster was disappointed, but Tony knew about his B-day and moved a couple chairs up front for us!  -Thanks Tony, it was a great night.Other Stuff:--next time I think we'll drive our car there from the hotel, it was a little difficult getting a cab back to the hotel.  One review mentioned stiff drinks, but we didn't think so.  This place is definitely casual & unpretentious so don't be scared of the black plywood entry.All in all, we'll be back!

43.description: Rosa's advertises as Chicago's friendliest blues lounge.  In my opinion it's true.  I  was in Chicago for business this week. I was able to go to Tuesday and Thursday night. On Tuesday I went with some friends to see Nate Manos and Pete Galanis.  One of my collegues started chatting with Pete towards the end of the night and next thing we knew he was handed a guitar  and was playing the last 2 songs of the night.   It was a blast!  The Thursday jam night with James Wheeler as just as enjoyable.  He opened the night with some songs from his first album and then opened up the stage.  I am a stranger to Chicago and I've been to Rosa's only 3 times over the past 9 months, yet I was welcomed and treated like a regular by the staff and musicians.The emphasis here is on the music. There is no food served and the furnishings are basic.  Don't go for a touristy experience.  Leave your inhibitions at home and enjoy.  They are about a 25 minute ride from the airport hotels and it's not down-town.

2.description: Sorry, but there is no Blues spot in the city that even compares to Rosa's Lounge.  Be sure to have dinner at Osteria Langhe before the show, which is now my favorite Italian in the city.

18.description: We think this is the best Blues Club in a Chicago! Truly a hidden gem. This is not a cookie cutter Hard Rock Cafe 'esq blues club this is gritty and local. The atmosphere is a local bar around the corner. They claim to be the friendliest blues club in Chicago and we'd give them that too. Just had a great time!

41.description: Chicago is the city of the blues, yet as a native Chicagoan, I know few people that include this genre in their ongoing music calendar.   Fortunately for me, I have a friend -  new to Chicago - that is an avid fan.  So we went to Rosa's!Walking in, you know you are truly in a Blues club.  The decor, the photos, the clientele focused on the music - it was a lot of fun for the novice, and the avid fan. Who knew this existed this far west on Armitage?  Now that I do, we will return!

52.description: Really is as good as it gets. The owner and staff treated my party of 10 people with excellent service.  They saved tables for us when we called ahead, served our drinks promptly and even split the bill for us by couple without even asking.  I could go on about the great service, but I want to get to the great atmosphere. Perfect for a non-touristy, legit blues club. Great dive-bar vibe, but you can tell the owners care. Got to see harmonica legend, Billy Branch.  It was an all-around great experience.

50.description: This is a phenomenal place to go see some Chicago Blues.  It's a smaller place off the beaten path, and it's not filled with tourists or drunk kids a year out of college.  Another Chicago-only gem tucked away in one of Chicago's awesome neighborhoods.  If you want to hear some great music without being packed into a club like sardines and without ridiculously high drink prices, then Rosa's is for you.  I'll be back.  You should too.

4.description: You are looking for a great place to hear the best musicians. This is it. Very modest place, stick to the beer and wine. This place is family run and has so much personality.

6.description: Very authentic place, friendly staff and affordable beers. There is even a small area in front of the stage where people dance. I was on Halloween night and I did not want to have the frantic booze night. The band was awesome and I had a wonderful time. The cover was not expensive ($15).

22.description: We think this is the best Blues Club in a Chicago! Truly a hidden gem. This is not a cookie cutter Hard Rock Cafe 'esq blues club this is gritty and local. The atmosphere is a local bar around the corner. They claim to be the friendliest blues club in Chicago and we'd give them that too. Just had a great time!

15.description: This place goes friggin HAM sammiches.

57.description: My Wife and I enjoyed a little bit of Rosa's this past Saturday.  This was our first visit to Rosa's and after being at the over crowded Kingston mines a few weeks back, we were looking forward to it.  We arrived about 8:15pm as the doors opened at 8pm so we could get a good table.  the place was basically empty when we arrived so we had our pick of tables.  Now on to the reviews:The Drinks: STRONG STRONG STRONG.  They do not skimp on the liquor here and the prices were cheap as well.  My jack and coke was 95% jack with a splash of coke.  A little too much for me but you get your money's worth.  The Music: AMAZING!  The band was incredible, the sound in the place was incredible, the drummer Turbo was one of the best i have ever seen.  (Great Job Turbo).  I was really surprised this place is not more crowded, with this good music there should be lines of people waiting out the door.  The place was not packed, i would say maybe at 1/3 capacity.  The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is because the band was scheduled to start at 9:30pm and it wasn't until 10:20pm when they began.  Instead of waiting 1 hour for the band to start, we waited 2 hours.  Overall this is a great place to listen to GREAT music.

20.description: Rosa's is true blues bar, not the stuff created for tourist dollars.My first visit was 21 years ago and I was a regular at that time. I have since left the area and have to admit that I had not been back in 16 years. Finding ourselves open for New Year's, and my wife never having been to a real blues bar I made the arrangements. It was like seeing an old friend. You will find the owner on the property, in fact expect to be welcomed by him at the door if you arrive prior to the band. Tony wears many hats and is quite busy but still takes the time to be cordial with his costumers.They are a full bar with beer in bottles and a limited selection on tap. They also have the popular liquors available. The music is loud so if this is a problem sit closer to the door. You will not find any main stream performers here. It's all about the blues and the feature Chicago blues bands. Depending on the night, you will find different bands.It's a great place to enjoy some awesome music in an intimate setting.My wife loved the place and experience. She can now say she has been to real blues bar!

36.description: Just amazing. Walked in here late one night accidentally and it appeared to be an anniversary show. Stiff drinks and great music. We got in for half price and the owner even comped us for our next visit!

14.description: Rosa's is true blues bar, not the stuff created for tourist dollars.My first visit was 21 years ago and I was a regular at that time. I have since left the area and have to admit that I had not been back in 16 years. Finding ourselves open for New Year's, and my wife never having been to a real blues bar I made the arrangements. It was like seeing an old friend. You will find the owner on the property, in fact expect to be welcomed by him at the door if you arrive prior to the band. Tony wears many hats and is quite busy but still takes the time to be cordial with his costumers.They are a full bar with beer in bottles and a limited selection on tap. They also have the popular liquors available. The music is loud so if this is a problem sit closer to the door. You will not find any main stream performers here. It's all about the blues and the feature Chicago blues bands. Depending on the night, you will find different bands.It's a great place to enjoy some awesome music in an intimate setting.My wife loved the place and experience. She can now say she has been to real blues bar!

3.description: This is a great dollar store! Lots of random, interesting things. Ranges from kitchenware (lots of tupperware, cups, etc), to canned food, to children's toys and party supplies. They sell plenty of stuff that nowhere else in Hyde Park carries. The vast majority of items are $1.

1.description: This place is AMAZING!!! It is the best spot in Hyde Park!!You can find many random things. They have anything you want like school supplies, hardware stuff, cleaning supplies, souvenirs, candy and junk food, canned food, drinks, tobacco products, medicine, and all the other things I forgot to mention!! It is very convenient they have everything. The store is small but it is LOADED with stuff, you'll find yourself spending some time there because they have various things!! Above that the store is not expensive at all, in matter of fact it is one of the cheapest around that area. The guys who work there are very helpful, pleasant, and HILARIOUS!! They all speak multiple languages which is interesting and cool. One guy speaks French (as do I :D) which is great because we chat together, he is funny!! Overall the place is wonderful and convenient. I love this store!!

2.description: I'm going to go ahead and agree with the other reviewers and call out this store as AWESOME!  It is part small grocer, part pharmacy, part gift shop, part tobacco store, and everything else I forgot to list.  And the prices are low low LOW.  You'll spend longer in here than you think because every inch of the place is filled with interesting goods!The guys who own this place are friendly, accommodating, so kind to their locals, and they run a great business!

5.description: One of two dollar stores in the neighborhood, and though it's the smaller one, it's the better one. It's got a diverse selection of cheaply made but mostly useful products, exactly what a neighborhood dollar store ought to be. The Egyptian guys who run it are friendly, but the Mexican guy just sort of glowers at you (never helps you find anything or seems to know where anything is; is he security?) Be aware that some things are a bit more than $1, and they also sell cigarettes and tobacco products.

6.description: I find excuses to get grocery staples like hot sauce and bags of dried black-eyed peas here--I could go somewhere else less atmospheric without breaking the bank, but it wouldn't be as much fun.  It's a bit like a very clean and orderly low-budget bazaar.  The owner (or one of the staff) mentioned that Michelle Obama used to buy school supplies at this place for her kids.  He enjoyed her friendliness and lack of pretention.  And when I think of all the hours and trees I've saved by ditching the whole wrapping paper and ribbon thing for presents and just picking up one of the cheap yet pretty and tasteful gift bags instead (southwest corner of the store facing east), I'm really grateful.  The guys behind the counter are gracious, welcoming, and funny.  My only regret is that the area off to the back is closed to customers and used for storage, and it's supposed to have been some kind of speakeasy, so it's probably loaded with history and atmosphere.

7.description: YES! I am so excited about  yelping about this amazing little jem. Please stop in here if you are in the mood for a treat. They have everything random you may never consider...a bike lock perhaps, just $1! A year's supply of Aloe, just $1! If you forgot to buy a wing to jazz up your going out on the town outfit, just $1! Its amazing, the owner and service is funny and extremely nice. I love this little store, and stop in there to get mostly anything often!

0.description: Excellent place to find mostly small items that you need, like tools, dishes, kitchen and washroom accessories, and office supplies. Really cool guy runs this place. No longer sells lottery tickets, so the line goes by a lot faster!

4.description: This is my goto dollar store. I buy almost everything here. I take my pennies, stack em up and feel like a big baller when I go to this store. I have bought presents, cards, school supplies, personal care items, just about everything I might need here. The owner is very friendly and the little Mexican dude someone just mentioned, he is kind of the muscle of the store, he will get something for you if you ask but he mostly stocks the shelves. He is quiet but nice :) I love this store.

3.description: The egg roll was decent. I also ordered chicken and broccoli, beef fried rice and lo mein. The beef fried rice was the most edible. Everything else was greasy and tasted old. I have no plans of ever returning.

1.description: Never eat here! I just ordered them from grub hub and it took well over an hour to get garbage! I ordered the daily special which included 2 entree items a side rice and drink. I asked for bourbon chicken and shrimp in lobster sauce. Sounds good right.... Sike! The bourbon chicken was dry and barely sauced and it came with 4 tiny shrimp with a boatload of sauce. I goes I could use that for the dry chicken! I'm done!

2.description: Orange Chicken Baby!Ok I've never been a huge fan of orange chicken, because usually it's huge chunks of soggy chicken dipped in Orange sauce but this orange chicken I keep coming back for. It's crispy and small pieces of chicken, perfectly sweeten orange sauce that will make you soak your fried rice in it. Omg its delicious. Hey I've never been a fan, but now I'm a true Stan. lol I usually ordered large shrimp fried rice, small triple delight and a small orange chicken. Just enough for 1day of leftovers. Yum!

9.description: After reading the reviews I decided to go here for a quick dinner and it was a good choice. However, since this was my first visit I only tried the traditional dishes like the egg foo young and the pork fried rice... but next time I will definitely go for a speciality item. See Thur is now my neighborhood favorite for a quick "grab and go" meal and I recommended it. Enjoy!

10.description: This has surprisingly become my goto spot when we dont feel like cooking.  the Fish with broccoli and pea pod is definately my favorite dish.  And they deliver, which is so rare on the southside, although I always do pickup, but its nice to know that it is an option.

4.description: Damn there 9 dollars on a dinner special. Orange chicken and shrimp fried rice with one egg roll but the menu said 6.25. I ask for no onions on my food to my surprise there were onions on my food they bury the chicken with sauce I guess so you could've tell the chicken was problem a day or 2 old. The chicken was so not fresh at all. Will not be going back there

6.description: I'm really disappointed with this place. Don't put a business in my neighborhood and charge a delivery fee and say you deliver and then act like you're afraid to come to my door. "You don't come down I take the food back to the restaurant." Every other place we order from brings the food to the door. Put a business in a neighborhood you aren't afraid of and stop profiting off us if we're that scary!

11.description: Mostly everything I've tried has been delicious except for the chicken chow mien, but I would definitely recommend See Thru. They are also very generous with their portions so you feel as if you have your money's worth. Not only that, but they give you free things like egg rolls and rice when you spend a certain amount. My new favorite Chinese restaurant.

5.description: I order at least twice a month, but lately this December the rice "again" hard and seemed leftover?The orange chicken also. The Mongolian chickek so hot, not palitabble. No more for me.

7.description: Took a chance and ordered two dinner specials. Egg foo yung and Governors Chicken. Were both great! Very nice flavor and presentation. Well worth the money. Came with two free egg rolls and two cans of Pepsi. Will most def order again :)

8.description: Like no restaurants deliver to my area expect this restaurant and a couple of other restaurants. The food is always hot and fresh whether it is delivered or picked up. We love the shrimp and broccoli, egg foo young, vegetable egg foo young, vegetable fried rice, shrimp fried rice, shrimp and noodle soup, veg. And shrimp egg rolls, and love to get a strawberry smoothie which is always sweet. I have to give it to the delivery men crossing the war zone to deliver to us. One some thugs tried to rob the delivery guy escaped, and still drove down to deliver our food. Kudos! Good job! I appreciate it. The service in house has improved. One of the ladies was a little rude, but she is more pleasant. My fiancé loves this restaurant!

0.description: Great Chinese food at low prices. My family orders delivery from here quite frequently and it usually arrives very quickly.

28.description: Gotta love Starbucks! I really love this one, its close to home or when i'm on my way somewhere i can stop through and get a quick White chocolate mocha, or a Mocha Frap. It just makes the day that much better! When i have gone inside, i have not had any issues. People are drinking coffee, and handling business.. just like at any other Starbucks!

1.description: This is my favorite Starbucks. I love to come here and get my frappucino and sit with my laptop, and listen to smooth sounds.

9.description: I gave this starbuck 4 stars not because I'm a big fan of the coffee but because the customer service was amazing.I maybe cheap because I just can't see paying over 3 bucks for a cup of coffee no matter what they do to it but I had a gift card and thought I would go and try it out!I know this maybe like nails on a chalkboard for my starbuck friends but I enjoy McDonald's and Dunkin Donuts Carmel Mocha much better but my friends say that's because I like coffee with my cream...lolSo, for me the price point and the taste is just not a winning combo for me but the smiling faces and the exceptional help from the staff makes me want to come back and see if I there is a coffee that they serve that I would like to drink and spend my money on.I also have to say the place was clean and I did enjoy my visit!

29.description: Good Starbucks! I hate that they closed the location on 95th and Stony Island. But this spot is closer to my job so i guess that's not too bad. I've really been working on my coffee habit, however last Monday i was in desperate need of some java. So i made a quick stop during lunch. Normally i get a Carmel machiatto or vanilla latte. But on this trip i had a taste for a white chocolate raspberry mocha...yummmmy... Well Starbucks doesn't sell this drink. So i asked for a Latte with Raspberry flavoring. Man o boy did that hit the spot! It wasn't no white chocolate raspberry mocha but it was darn near close to it :)

23.description: I gave this starbuck 4 stars not because I'm a big fan of the coffee but because the customer service was amazing.I maybe cheap because I just can't see paying over 3 bucks for a cup of coffee no matter what they do to it but I had a gift card and thought I would go and try it out!I know this maybe like nails on a chalkboard for my starbuck friends but I enjoy McDonald's and Dunkin Donuts Carmel Mocha much better but my friends say that's because I like coffee with my cream...lolSo, for me the price point and the taste is just not a winning combo for me but the smiling faces and the exceptional help from the staff makes me want to come back and see if I there is a coffee that they serve that I would like to drink and spend my money on.I also have to say the place was clean and I did enjoy my visit!

5.description: Visiting Chicago from Las Vegas and while visiting this Starbucks the manager on duty was extremely professional and friendly. Her name is Linda Edwards and she went above and beyond what I expected from a manager at a busy place like this. While she was cleaning up after previous customers she initiated a conversation with me about where I am from and gave me great advice about where to go in Chicago. I will patronize this location as much as possible thanks to her and recommend others in my family to patronize it also. Great job Starbucks with giving this location a chance!!! Oh, and great job Linda for recommending a blend I don't usually consume because I liked it a lot and now will try other blends.

31.description: Keeps me coming back: I don't know who thought of Frappuccinos but God bless him or her. The Stony Island location is close to home and a great addition to the south side of Chicago. The staff is courteous, but the frappuccinos are hook, line, and sinker. I'm addicted, to be without is to suffer a great lost. My favorite: Venti caffe vanilla frappuccino, double blended with hazelnut and whipped cream. YUMMMM!!!

25.description: First off, they deserve more than their current one star rating for location alone (it's 2 blocks from my house, and when I moved from the north side, I would have never believed that there would be a Starbucks here).  I come here pretty regularly, and I can honestly say that the service is pretty good. Not excellent, but much better than the one at 87th and the Dan Ryan.  The inside decore is nice, and there is a nice outdoor seating area and they seem to be good at keeping panhandlers at bay.

12.description: I swear if I had time I would write corporate detaing the great staff here. I have never had a bad experience here even if I asked to have my drink remade. I remember once I forgot my credit card after running and they gave me the drink for free! I know thats Starbucks policy but all of them don't ways adhere to it. Great job guys!

21.description: When they first opened up, I went through the drive thru, with a $100 dollar bill! yes! of course no change, they gave me the tea, I insisted on dropping the monies off later.
