I did.  Wow!  Always excellent service. Chai tea, my beverage choice always made just the way I like soy, no foam, extra hot with 2 splendas!!!!!

16.description: Best coffee on the Southside. Keeps me up for hours. Especially with my gold card.

17.description: I love this SBs due it's drive-thru & customer service. Very friendly, & eager to please staff. The wait is pretty long but worth it. My fave are the chai lattes & frapps! Their breakfast items are very fresh!

10.description: I came into the Starbucks on 71st Stony Island at 6:01AM, it sits on the corners of 71st St. I went into the mentioned location and experienced the WORSE customer service from the MANAGER!!!!!!! It was unbelievable. After nearly BEGGING for assistance to use the WiFi.... 5 approaches to the COUNTER, and 1.31 HOURS of my MIDTERM study time pleading for assistance.... I must admit I gave up and left. STARBUCKS:YOUR  mission: "To inspire and nurture the human spirit - one person, one cup and one neighborhood at a time.When we are fully engaged, we connect with, laugh with, and uplift the lives of our customers - even if just for a few moments. Sure, it starts with the promise of a perfectly made beverage, but our work goes far beyond that. It's really about human connection".Starbucks...this is your mission statement and I experienced the total opposite of your "Creed" or do you really want to call this a MISSION STATEMENT!!!!?????? Or did you just mention this because it sounds GOOD!!!????? Well I received marginal service from your manager, it was totally LESSSSSSSSSSSSSSS than stellar!I could have gone to McDonald's and received better customer service than this.....Thanks for ABSOLUTELY nothing!!!!! Queen Starbuck$$$$$!!!!!waste of time and money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!May I suggest: McDonald's north on Stony Island WifiChef Sara's Coffee Café on corner off 71st and Exchange (directly on the corner) Wifi Chef Sara she is on-site serving and exercising great service! vegetarian menu offered as well...Dunkin Donuts (south on Stony Island 8600 blk)

11.description: The chia tea latte is kinda watery for my taste, other then that I have no complaints, the staff is friendly and the service on a good day is fast

26.description: I know the Starbucks drill, since I consider myself a little junkie.  I am pretty much a purist.  I want either a cup of coffee or an Americano.  But even this place can f*** that up.  They have a horrible drive thru, a postage stamp parking lot and some of the barristas want to argue and not listen.  At these prices, I'll take my happy a** slightly north to Hyde Park for better service and a better product.  But all is not lost, there are those days (during the week) when I don't have issues...but Saturday all hell seems to break loose.  Just sayin'...

35.description: There's a hot latin barista here.Don't be too flattered when he flirts with you though.  He flirts with everyone.

0.description: The manager Linda was awesome. VERY nice and professional. Store nice clean and everything stocked. She smiled and spoke to everyone who came through the doors. What was fascinating is when she realized that I was from out of town she stopped by my table and gave me pointers about the city and places to go visit.  I'll be sure to stop back by this location when I return to Chicago. Thank you Linda!!!

19.description: The drive-thru at this Starbucks is great. Even when there's a long line the move pretty quickly. The service has always been friendly and our orders are accurate.

33.description: I am not a fan of this Starbucks. They never manage to get my order correct when I request TWO different drinks of the same size........a Tall Skinny Vanilla Latte and a Tall Soy Vanilla Latte. I contantly hear......2 tall skinny vanilla lattes??! I understand it is just coffee, but its MUCHO aggravating.

2.description: This Starbucks is on my way to work, and I stop here once or twice a week in the morning, around 6:45 or 7:00.  The drinks and pastries are pretty standard for Starbucks, and the staff is extremely friendly.  However, the service tends to take a while, and the drive-thru especially moves slowly during the morning rush.  I should probably give ordering from the mobile app a shot, because there have been several times that I've driven by without stopping because it's so crowded and I know it'll take longer than I have to get my coffee!

34.description: Good location, drive through, convienient.  Love it.  And, on the way to work.  Rock on!

32.description: I came to this location about 3 years ago for a drink and I wasnt too impressed with it because it was watered down after I asked them for easy ice. Not only was this pretty bad, but I havent been back to this location since. When I ask for a specific way my drink is made I am a paying customer and I should get what I am buying. Just because some people don't want to make someone's order right means they shouldnt be in a job that requires them to work around people.

18.description: I love this Starbucks!!! Its very spacious..great customer services. They always have coffee brewed fresh.  .If its not fresh they're rebrew it for me. Don't have to worry about long lines.  I love it because it's closed to work

13.description: Friendly staff but your car will get dusty waiting and waiting and waiting in line for your order.  It's actually faster to drive to a further Starbucks.

4.description: This is one of my go to sbux and I love it!!! I tried the order ahead feature on the mobile app OMG my order was waiting on me at the front counter. For the most part you can order what you want the way you want but for some bakery items it is what it is warmed or not. This location is clean friendly and in the mornings fast the earlier you go you are likely to get what you want as far as food. The only downside to this location is they don't sell tumblers because I love their tumblers

24.description: Drive through is very efficient, would love more space from the ordering stand to pick up.

6.description: This is easily the best Starbuck's I have ever been to. My family stops here on our way out of town frequently, and the service is always quick and super friendly. We inadvertently test the skills of the people working the drive-thru with chaotic ordering, and they never fail to do a great job.

22.description: The drive-thru at this Starbucks is great. Even when there's a long line the move pretty quickly. The service has always been friendly and our orders are accurate.

15.description: This location needs way more organization. The drive through is always long and kinda slow. I came in here last week and ordered a tall non fat caramel brulee and there was a sufficient amount of people in line so of course there was a wait. The only problem was that everyone in front of me and behind me was given their coffee before I was. If I ordered mine before them, I should get it before them. Apparently the lady forgot about me because she didn't make it until I asked where the hell my coffee was. Typically understaffed.

7.description: I normally use the drive through...and they are very nice...imagine my surprise with the subpar service received inside.  Cold pastry, without an offer to warm it, like they do at every other Starbucks I frequent...cashier who appeared to be annoyed...super long wait...for an incorrectly made drink...sigh...I am going to chalk this up to a bad day for them and hope it's a one-off because I don't want to have to travel across the city for coffee!  Hey Starbucks...DO BETTER!

8.description: Place is run terribly. Have to wait for you to brew coffee on saturday morning? Really!!! You suck!

30.description: Visited Starbucks again on Stony Island this afternoon.  Seriously, only about 3 people in a full store were consuming beverages.This Starbucks is more like a public library due to the free internet.

3.description: There are a lot of starbucks all over the globe. I have been to many of them, but I can honestly say, this is the best one. The baristas are so kind and make an effort to get to know you and your drink is absolutely perfect!

14.description: I really love that Starbucks Drive-Thru's exist. This one is great. They always get my order right and are very friendly. There are also tons of people in there always which is nice. It just has an overall friendly feel to it.

29.description: Ranjana is lovely! This is a wonderful place to learn about the incredible variety of Indian cooking. We went on a Saturday morning and had such a wonderful time. Ranjana is patient and incredibly knowledgeable. I have been eating Indian food my entire life since I grew up with Indian friends--but I had no understanding of the taste elements of Indian cooking present in every dish...It was really helpful to learn how ingredients interact with each other--and also--for considering how you might pair dishes together for a larger dinner party to showcase your new Indian cooking knowledge. This class is the kind of gem you feel really lucky to find in a city that has become increasingly corporate in its food business. We have fewer independent coffee shops, bakeries and delis every year. This place should be celebrated--along with the communal kitchens that are popping up--enabling smaller food purveyors to showcase their craft. And regarding the review below--I didn't see anything in Ranjana's kitchen that looked less than spotless. The place was immaculate and beautiful!

42.description: What a fun class! I contacted Ranjana about signing up for the Northern Indian cooking class one Saturday. She was already booked but emailed me the next day saying that she could accommodate us later that same Saturday as there were other people that wanted the same class. Perfect! Our class consisted of my husband and I plus one other couple. Ranjana started the class by demonstrating how to make Masala Chai and went over some of the different Indian spices, how to use them, and which ones to add before cooking or after cooking. It was very informative and a topic that I didn't know much about. In all, we made several chutneys, samosas, daal, roti, paneer, an okra dish, an eggplant dish, plus dessert. Each person contributed to the cooking and some dishes (roti and samosas) were demonstrated by Ranjana and then each person was able to make their own. What I liked best about the class was Ranjana's flexibility. She asked what our favorite Indian dishes were and gave us general instructions on how they are prepared. She also gave us many suggestions on ways to modify different dishes either for dietary reasons or lack of time. I felt the class was really more about understanding Indian cooking techniques and ingredients rather than just sticking to a recipe. Ranjana had us taste as we were cooking to see if the food had enough salt, spice, etc... which is invaluable if you are going to be cooking on your own and want everything to be balanced. After completing the class, I was confident that I could cook Indian food at home. In fact, the next week after the class my husband and I made Masala Chai, chutney, and roti at home. I can't wait until we attempt samosas! If you have any interest in Indian cooking at all, Ranjana's classes are an excellent way to learn this cuisine. I'm really looking forward to taking another class with her.

23.description: I had a wonderful time at Ranjana's cooking class with my husband. She was very kind, warm and welcoming, as was her husband, and the whole experience beat my expectations. I felt right at home and I relish in the fact she put my husband to work! From what I recall, we made chai tea, two chutneys, the crispy fritters (I forget the name) and vast array of other delicious entrees.  We hope to return in the future to take another class and bring friends with us! My husband and I didn't get a chance to, and as other reviewers had mentioned, making a day out of it down in Hyde Park!.We had a brief chance to walk around the neighborhood and the nearby park. If not for other afternoon plans, we wanted to go to the Museum of S&I.Last point I would like to make is I think it's obnoxious for someone to post comments (that appear to be completely concocted from another universe) about the plates or the quality of ingredients especially judging by other reviewers wonderful experiences.This is a cooking class, not your own private chef. Ranjana is not there to make sure she ad hears to YOUR taste and diet or that fact that you are unfortunately from California. . I'm disappointed by the lack of intelligence and incompetence. Maybe that's why I live in Chicago - to avoid it.

47.description: A wonderful class! Started with a lovely conversation with Ranjana's husband and the hospitality kept going from there. Ranjana made us delicious chai tea and then we discussed spices and then we got to work! It was the best vegetarian food I've ever had and I loved hearing about Ranjana's life and how her life affects her cooking and vice versa. The Jackson Highlands neighborhood is worth the trip and Ranjana puts you spiritually and nutrionally in a great place. Loved it.

8.description: What a great experience!   I took the basic South Indian class this past Saturday.  I wasn't sure what to expect, but the experience was just awesome.Ranjana opens up her home and is just lovely, welcoming, gracious, funny, and so knowlegeable and patient.   Her home is beautiful and you feel very welcomed.  There were 6 in the class, which was a good size group.  We made about 10 different recipes - a combo of demo and hands-on.   Because the Dawali holiday is this week, she included some extra special recipes and went above and beyond.  All the food came out so good and flavorful.  I'm not vegetarian, but there wasn't a dish we made in which I missed or needed meat.  I would make all these recipes again at my home.  They were simple with complex flavors.  I can't say enough good things about Rajana and her class.  I am taking another class with her in a few weeks, and I cannot wait!

31.description: I actually found out about Ranjana's class while searching Yelp for a cooking course to gift my fiance for the holidays. (You can order a gift certificate--that she'll email you and you can print--by contacting her via her website.) We ended up taking the North Indian class on a Thursday night and it was a blast. Why? We learned a lot, had a ridiculous meal and got to enjoy the company of Ranjana who is the most patient, hospitable, interesting and talented cooking instructor I've come across. The classes are in her home which is very cozy and comfortable and a quick drive from the Loop. I highly recommend giving Ranjana's class as a gift. My fiance loved it and has been trying the recipes we learned in class (bonus for me). I think you can bring wine to drink during class, which we didn't, and in hindsight would've been nice to enjoy while sampling all the different foods.

34.description: Ranjana's class in one of the best experiences I have had in Chicago. The class is insightful, cultural, and creative. It allows every attendee to explore both the simplicity and intricacies of Indian cooking. As a talented chef and teacher, Ranjana creates such a beautiful and comfortable space for learning that it is impossible to leave without a smile and fully belly

16.description: We had the pleasure of having Ranjana bring her cooking class to my library in Calumet City, IL. It was a fantastic experience, needless to say. Not only was there demonstration and explanation of the philosophy in which Indian food is prepared, Ranjana also gave of herself, sharing her life experiences with the group. The food was flavorful and aromatic, in addition to being delicious. She prepared several authentic dishes for us that would be very easy to replicate at home. We would love to have her come back and prepare more dishes for us in order to round out our Indian cooking skills. I highly recommend her class and her food!

13.description: *Basic South Indian One tradition of my family's that I really enjoy is that we try to get each other activities as gifts, or something functional. My little sister is a vegetarian, but the kind that survives primarily on Boca Burgers and such. I wanted to take her somewhere fun and that would be interesting to her. So we signed up for one of Ranjana's classes. :) Delicious! I want to go back for more. :) She is friendly and makes truly delicious food; she also helps you to see how the spices from each area are different, the basics of ingredients for any recipe (must have color, heat, etc.) and while I was outspiced sometimes (I can do up to medium), I couldn't stop eating because it was delicious. We had a great time and Ranjana really loves to get to know people. I highly recommend for a gift, for fun, for a date, whatever! My sister is 16 and we came away with ton of recipes and food. :)

11.description: I just visited Ranjana for a second time with a group of 8 friends.  We got to pick our own menu.  It was such an awesome experience with the entire class of people you know.  Increased participation and group dynamic.  Ranjana is so knowledgeable and ready to share everything!  She has a wicked sense of humor too!Got cabin fever?  Book this class right away and have some fun this winter with your friends!  You'll have a hearty meal and a lot of fun!!!

39.description: I don't want to needlessly repeat the enthusiastic reviews below, and their accurate details about Ranjana's warmth, enthusiasm, grace and storytelling, as well as the intimate setting of cooking in her own home kitchen. So I'll just add another five-star recommendation for her cooking class as a wonderful, educational and delicious gift experience for anyone interested in cooking and Indian culture and cuisine.Please support Ranjana and take her classes! I know I will return for another before I leave Chicago!

37.description: Our wonderful cooking class was a cultural and culinary tour of India!  We enjoyed our class very much and like the other reviewers we walked away well fed, recipes and notes in hand and with an interest to pursue Indian cooking in our own kitchens.  Ranjana demonstrated and gave us a tasks in preparing several chutneys, chai, samosas, rotis, raita, an eggplant dish to die for, an okra dish and a dessert!  In one evening!  Because we participated in making these dishes, we all gained confidence and experience. Ranjana is very helpful and sweet.Highly recommended!

0.description: Such a cool experience! I love Indian food and I love cooking so my wife got me a cooking class with Ranjana for my birthday - I opted to take the "advanced north Indian" as I have some experience in the kitchen. This was so fun and I learned so much more than I ever imagined. We powered through a number of recipes but what I found most useful was the simple philosophy behind the cooking. She explained that the bases of Indian curries are much the same with variations from region to region ( I have never thought of it this way). Also that Indian food shares characteristics combining tart with salt with hot (red pepper). We used whole spices for the recipes which made a huge difference. I will definitely take another class in the future after I practice the many recipes that were provided in the printed out booklet she gave us. Highly recommend!

38.description: Wow! Ranjana's cooking class was about the best thing to happen to my culinary world since the magnetic spice rack. I took a private class with Ranjana last winter (sorry for the delay in reviewing) and was so impressed with every aspect of her class.  The menu was downright mind-blowing, as she not only tailored it to include a few of my favorite Indian foods, but also included a sumptous range of appetizers, beverages, vegetables, entrees, dessert, and even paneer making! I did not think it would be possible to make so much deliciousness in one class, but somehow we did. Every single thing we created was delicious and we worked very hands-on to be involved in the cooking process. She gave us a great book of recipes, but more importantly, she taught us many of the fundementals of Indian food, which we could apply to other foods and other recipes. I don't just know how to make samosas (although, goodness, those samosas alone make the class worthwhile), I know how to apply what I've learned to a range of other dishes. I definitely felt like a guest in Ranjana's home and not just a client. She introduced us to her family and shared many interesting stories about herself and her life. Her husband took some photos for us, and I look almost foolishly like a proud parent, as I hold up a lovely puffed roti. I can't recommend this class enough! Go cook with Ranjana!

51.description: I'll see how much I actually learned when I give some cooking a shot.  The recipes were nice, and overall a well designed nine course meal.  I would have preferred a bit more of the 'science' behind what works and what doesn't but that is probably a bit too much to ask for a introductory class.  A bit disorganized at times, but that's also a reflection of her attitude that cooking is a constant experiment.

27.description: My boyfriend signed us up for this class as a surprise for my birthday and it was wonderful.  We went this past Saturday and we ended up being the only people there as the other people canceled.  So we got a private lesson!  This made me a little nervous as neither of us tends to cook anything too complicated at home.  But, Ranjana made us feel at home and was not at all condescending while giving us hands on training.Her home is beautiful and Hyde Park is full of gorgeous homes and a beautiful lakefront path. I would recommend making a day of it - maybe bring your bike there and explore afterwards to burn off some calories!We took the Basic class and learned how to make some wonderful vegetarian dishes, which we look forward to trying on our own very soon.  Thanks Ranjana!

32.description: Last week, my fiance and I took Ranjana's Basics of North Indian cooking class.  We had an amazing time!  I have taken cooking classes before at the Chopping Block and other "schools" around Chicago, but had never been invited into someone's home and taught to cook the food that they grew up eating.  What an incredible experience.All of the food that we made was delicious, and much easier than I thought it would be.  Before coming to Ranjana's class, I thought that making Indian food at home was quite difficult, but with the right spices and a little instruction, it isn't!  I highly recommend taking a class with Ranjana!  Being in her kitchen, enjoying her company, is a wonderful way to spend an evening.  I can't wait to put all of the skills I learned to work!

48.description: I like to think that I take advantage of a lot that Chicago has to offer in terms of taking classes to further expand my knowledge of cooking, crafting, and any number of other random activities that are fun to explore (and Chicago's got a ton) ... but I have to say, hands down, whoa this cooking class was one of the best experiences i've had!If you've never known the joy of frying up your own samosas made from scratch, witnessing a chapati puff up like magic over an open flame, or seeing a bushel of cilantro transformed into that deliciously tangy green sauce they put on your table at your local indian food joint ... then i highly recommend you take this class. Heck, even if you've experienced these things before, take the class anyway, because it's an opportunity to learn so much more than the mechanics of Indian cooking. I took the Basic North Indian class, and let's just say that I came out with my head as full of information and wonder as my stomach was full of samosas. Ranjana, the teacher who holds this class in her kitchen down in Hyde Park, is really the element that made this experience so memorable. She goes beyond just explaining the ingredients  -- which she does a great job of, and includes a handy take-home recipe pamphlet with some information on the foundational spices and balance of flavors of indian cooking. Her manner in the kitchen is so casual, so comfortable and inviting that it seems less like a cooking class and more like an informal gathering of friends all there to talk about food and life in Chicago, with little tidbits about Indian culture thrown in the mix. It's hard to explain, but I just walked out of there with a glow....But don't get me wrong -- cook you will! Samosas, okra, eggplant, daal, chai tea, chutneys, just to name a few. And you will learn not only what to do, but why you do it a certain way, how to do it at home, and why you use a certain mix of spices. Ranjana is full of information and little tricks on technique.  And then you will eat. And you will go home happy knowing that you've learned some really useful skills, met some great people, and are no longer reliant on your favorite neighborhood Indian restaurant to provide you with fresh, healthy, tasty meals. Since taking the class I've made six of the ten dishes and am happy to report that there was no magic involved, and that the recipes are truly repeatable ( and delicious ).

44.description: For an early Valentine's day present, my boyfriend and I signed up for a private cooking lesson with Ranjana. I have to say it was definitely a great idea and I left having learned a lot of techniques that I could apply to my cooking style in general. I didn't participate in much of the planning of the course but I do know Ranjana was very flexible in accommodating picky eaters like us with no problem (Keep in mind that we did book private lessons). Ranjana's classes only include vegetarian dishes but she is great at telling you how you can tweak them to accommodate meat. Recipes are provided but she also does a great job at having you watch and take notes yourself so you can retain the information a lot better. Dishes we tried included two chutney dishes, several main courses, kulfi (ice cream), lassis (smoothies), and several breads. Ranjana is an excellent instructor overall. She has taught in the past and you can tell she puts a lot of work in accommodating different learning styles. I definitely learned a lot and would highly recommend her classes to anyone.

24.description: What a great experience!   I took the basic South Indian class this past Saturday.  I wasn't sure what to expect, but the experience was just awesome.Ranjana opens up her home and is just lovely, welcoming, gracious, funny, and so knowlegeable and patient.   Her home is beautiful and you feel very welcomed.  There were 6 in the class, which was a good size group.  We made about 10 different recipes - a combo of demo and hands-on.   Because the Dawali holiday is this week, she included some extra special recipes and went above and beyond.  All the food came out so good and flavorful.  I'm not vegetarian, but there wasn't a dish we made in which I missed or needed meat.  I would make all these recipes again at my home.  They were simple with complex flavors.  I can't say enough good things about Rajana and her class.  I am taking another class with her in a few weeks, and I cannot wait!

7.description: Was taken here for a surprise Christmas present and felt whatever the opposite of disappointed is. She is a wonderful cook, a wonderful teacher, and a wonderful person to talk to. We took the basic northern Indian cooking class, and in the few hours we were there experienced 16 different wonderful dishes and recipes, many of which were quite doable as quick, useable recipes at home. And, for the harder stuff there's the ensemble of recipes she gives you to take home with. And on top of all her expert guidance, she's a fascinating person to talk to with her incredible background helping others. Great course, great time spent, would recommend!

49.description: See those five stars I gave?  Multiply each of them by two.  This is a 10-star cooking class. How do you review an experience that indulges all of your senses and leaves you with a sense of peace and joy, a new set of skills, and a full, happy tummy with just five stars??Ranjana holds small classes in her sparkling professional kitchen at her home near Hyde Park (take the Metra Electric Line down and enjoy a 4- or 5-block walk through one of the most beautiful parts of Chicago to get there).  Not only do you learn to make the 9 or so dishes included on the menu, but Ranjana explains the general patterns of flavor and spice mixing involved in Indian cooking which will take you much further if you plan to branch out beyond the dishes taught in class. In addition to the dishes, she'll also show you how to make your own chai, your own yogurt, and roast and grind your own spices to be used as is or in garam masala - all easily achieved in your own kitchen as well. And surely nothing has taken me back to those childhood moments of delight and wonder as seeing my own chapati inflate like a balloon over an open flame. Everything we made was delicious, and there was plenty of hands-on practice.Dishes we made in the basic North Indian class:  Samosas, eggplant with tomato, okra, chapati (bread), daal, green chutney, mango chutney, tamarind chutney, halwa.  Also: chai tea, yogurt, toasted spicesBut even better than getting to eat your own crispy, spicy samosas right out of the pan is the chance to learn from the remarkable Ranjana.  Patient, clear, and expert at her craft, Ranjana radiates warmth, peacefulness, and hospitality and is simply spellbinding when she speaks.  Interspersed with cooking instructions are history lessons, stories of her own fascinating life, a prompt to smell the black cardamom and green cardamom to experience the difference, and gentle questions to get to know you as well. From the flavors, scents, textures, and colors of the food to the warm hug you get as you leave Ranjana's house to the wonderful helpful followup emails she'll send you, this is a magical experience from start to finish.  Do not miss this!

40.description: I am an attorney in New York City. I took Ranjana's class with my son, who is a junior in High School. We both had a fabulous time. We both love indian food. I am a vegetarian, but my son is not. We learned not to be afraid of cooking indian food and where precision is required, and where it is not. We made some of the recipes at home, and while they did not taste exactly the same as in class, they were delicious and blew away the rest of our family. I do not like bananas, but Ranjana put them in the Chutney. When she heard I did not like bananas, she told me she could have used pears. But I loved the chutney anyway and made it with bananas at home. So Ranjana opened up a whole world to me. My son was totally satisfied with eating a vegetarian meal, when it was so full of variety and taste and better than our favorite indian restaurant.in New York. This cooking class will live on in our family history as a terrific event that keeps giving as we experiment with more indian dishes. I wish we had the equivalent in New York. But there is no indian cooking class at such a high level of skill and personal warmth to be had in New York. Chicago....take advantage and go to this class!

53.description: Since I'm first to review Ranjana's cooking classes, I will give you a bit of background on what they are all about.  Ranjana is originally from India and moved to Chicago about 40 years ago. She's cheerful and sweet, and has a motherly quality which makes you feel right at home.  Based in Hyde Park, she gives cooking classes out of her kitchen, which is equipped with with an industrial stove. The classes accommodate 8 people, so the environment is intimate.  You can choose to attend classes one at a time (on Saturdays from 9 a.m.-1 p.m.) or in a 4 class series. This past Saturday we made 9 different dishes from Northern India including Matar Paneer, Pakori, Coriander Chutney, Pulav, Paratha, Chole, Aloo Gobi, Kheer and Chai Tea. Being a newbie to Indian food, Ranjana did a great job of taking us through all the spices and how they are used, where to shop for the items, and how to prepare each of the dishes. Everyone got a bit of hands-on cooking time, but mostly we sat, watched, took notes and learned, which was just my speed. One thing I find when we eat at the different restaurants on Devon is the food can be really oily. Ranjana showed us how much oil the restaurants tend to use, and it was great to see because it just reaffirmed it's probably kinder on the waistline to make Indian food yourself! The best part of the class was the end where we all shared the meal around her dining room table. It was fun meeting new people and  learning a new way to cook. I can't wait to go to Devon street to buy the spices so I can try the dishes at home.

30.description: Just like all the other reviews, I can't say enough great things about Ranjana and her class. She has so much knowledge and command of the kitchen, it's impressive to watch and learn. The food is absolutely amazing, and her patience and attention to detail is only matched by her excitement for sharing her gift. The neighborhood is on the south side, but the street they live on is very beautiful. Her husband is very kind and welcomed us into the home and gave us some background before the class, and then he took pictures throughout as well. Overall a very fun night and I would recommend this to ANYONE and EVERYONE who's interested in a great experience.

46.description: Ranjana won me over again!  I signed up for a second class with her after I received a discount offer for taking a previous class.  This time I went with the regional cooking class, which meant South Indian.  I was pretty excited to learn how to make some South Indian dishes because I had never tried my hand at it at home.  It ended up being just my friend and I in the class because the other students canceled.  What luck?!  It was like having my own private cooking class!  We made a TON of food again, even though it was only the three of us (Ranjana included).  The best part of all?  I LEARNED HOW TO AND WAS SUCCESSFUL AT MAKING MY OWN DOSA!!  Amazing, if you ask me.  We also made some fresh coconut chutney (we're talking take-the-coconut-outside-and-bust-it-open fresh), sambhar, rasam, idli, vada, lemon rice, upma (a side recipe that wasn't even part of the plan), a couple of different masalas, and payasam.  Seriously, a ton of food!  Don't even ask me how we managed to eat a good portion of it.Ranjana was as friendly as ever, sharing plenty of life stories, and teaching us a lot of shortcuts and new methods for cooking.  If you're looking for a good way to learn some real, authentic cooking, take a class with Ranjana, she's the best!  You learn to make a lot of different things, and feel comfortable enough to take your recipe book home and dive in in your own kitchen.  Take a class with a group of friends to make it even more fun.  Have a birthday party or a holiday party here if you're looking for a good group activity!

1.description: Ranjana is the most lovely woman. She was so kind to share her knowledge of Indian cooking and culture, with a dash of humor thrown in for flavor!I learned a great deal and would highly recommend her classes.

9.description: Fantastic experience. This was my first time here, and we had a crowd - nine or ten people. Ranjana was warm and welcoming, and very engaging - she involved everyone, and made sure that the experience was informative as well as enjoyable, delicious, and completely satisfying. And yep, as someone else here mentioned, her sense of humor is great. She is completely unafraid to take the occasional jab in good spirits. :)Loved everything about this. Her home is beautiful, and she made us feel like it was ours. We'll be back!

26.description: My husband and I were given a gift certificate as a wedding gift, and I am so grateful that we have such thoughtful friends!  We ended up being the only ones at this Monday evening basics class, and we had an awesome time.  I wasn't sure how the class was going to work out because even though both my husband and I love Indian food and I love to cook, my husband's idea of cooking is microwaving frozen White Castle sliders (OK that's a little bit of an exaggeration - but you get the idea).  I thought Ms. Ranjana did a wonderful job in engaging both of us throughout the class.  Everything we made was fresh, delicious, and actually realistic to make at home.  Tonight we learned to make chai (both on the stovetop and a quickie microwave version), samosas, two kinds of chutney, raita, palak paneer, a yummy fried eggplant dish, aloo gobi, roti, and halwa for dessert.  I was very impressed with Ms. Ranjana's cleanliness, technique, and the quality of her ingredients, so I'm not sure what that reviewer below (Brooke M.) experienced.  To the contrary, I thought Ms. Ranjana's kitchen was spotless, we made everything from scratch (even the fresh cheese for the palak paneer - magical!), and she even threw in a few peppers that she had just picked from her garden.  Doesn't get more locally sourced than that.  Over the course of the evening, we enjoyed a totally amazing vegetarian feast and I learned a lot of useful basic techniques and spice combinations that I know I will use in the future.  We even decided to buy a custom-made spice kit from her so that I could hit the ground running with my newfound Indian cooking skills.Her class would make for a really fun evening with friends. We are definitely hoping to come back!UPDATE on 9/30/12: I just wanted to say that I have made some of the dishes that Ms. Ranjana taught me, and they turned out amazing!  All thanks to her great instruction and her spice kit.

25.description: Ranjana is so sweet and easy going.  She makes you feel so welcome in her home while showing you how truly easy Indian Cooking can be.  Once she shows you the basics you will feel confident enough to go home and cook for your family and friends.  Consider making it a group event too, bring your friends and have a fabulous time!!!

12.description: You get more than you expect with a cooking class with Ranjana in her fully equiped home kitchen. She is so knowledgeable and passionate about teaching Indian cooking, that even if you don't do much cooking, you will literally leave with dough on your hands. While Indian cooking can be daunting given the different spices and herbs used, Ranjana presented everyday dishes that I can see making on a weekly basis: homemade yogurt, to make cucumber raita;  roti bread made on the fly; lentils or other legumes with a flavorful topping of savory butter or oil. I went with my family, who were visiting Chicago, and we had a great time, and to top it all off, her husband took professional quality photos for us as souvenir!! Wow, you can not beat this practical, informative, and fun experience. Well worth the price.

21.description: I purchased the Basic North Indian Cooking for my Boyfriend (who is from South India) and me (who is not Indian and never cooked Indian food).  I instantly felt welcomed into Ranjana's home.  Her husband welcomed us and immediately  took our coats.Ranjana lives on the south side in a beautiful home in an area in Chicago I had no idea existed.  After the entire group arrived (classes are limited to 8 people, which is  perfect amount) we were invited into the kitchen.  Ranjana had all the fresh ingredients lined up.  She also had a large map of India on the wall.  She began the class by teaching us a little bit about cooking in various northern regions of India.  She taught us that all Indian dishes need something Salty, Tangy, and Spicy (or some kind of heat) in it.  This is something I never knew but after making the dishes completely understood.  She provided hands on training while making me feel like I was cooking with my mom in the kitchen.  She spoke of her marriage, coming to Chicago (from India), and her kids (wow-what successful children she has raised).I have always been intimidated by Indian food.  It has always seem so complicated and time consuming.  Ranjana broke each recipe down to a very easy and manageable format. Come hungry!!! We made so much food that our group couldn't possibly have consumed all of it.  It's a fantastic deal for the amount of time Ranjana spends with you as well as the amount of food you get.My boyfriend has been cooking Indian food his whole life and even he learned a lot in this class.  He was engaged and eager to participate.  It's a very laid back and welcoming environment.  Don't let the south side location deter you.  It is 150% worth the trip.  My boyfriend and I can't wait to go back and take the south Indian cooking class!Ranjana is also extremely organized.  When booking the class, she immediately responded that she had room in the class I wanted.  She also created a "gift certificate" for my boyfriend so that I could present him with some type of gift.  She also followed up the day before with specific instructions (where to park--they have permits for the street and the street parking was wide open) and directions.If you looking for something different to do in the city, look no further!

17.description: This is the first time I am writing review. I just need to give feedback, because I have never been so impressed! We took class today and it was absolutely unforgettable experience. My husband and I were able to actually learn and make very tasty, healthy, and full of flavor Indian food! Ranjana has amazing personality and she is also a master chief! She shared magic of professional, artful cooking, had everyone busy doing different recipes, managed to tell inspiring stories about Indian culture that left very profound impression and strengthen my affection to the Indian food and culture and all of these at the same time! She made it so easy to follow and repeated important parts often that made it easy to remember, especially with recipes prints on hand and my very detailed notes that I proudly made along the way! We made about 15 delicious recipes in three hours and tasted all of them! I cannot wait for the next class to come!

10.description: This is a must-do for anyone who likes Indian food (or just learning new things). In preparation to meet my boyfriend's parents (who are coming in from South India), I decided to sign up for the Basic South Indian class. Long story short, there was a slight mix-up and Ranjana had been preparing to teach a North Indian class that evening. Instead of just going forward with one of the classes, she basically taught two classes in one, and we learned 18 dishes from both North and South India. She went through a ton of extra trouble just because it was so important to her to honor her promise to teach South Indian for me. This was a really fun, informative, and delicious experience. Highly recommended.

5.description: Ranjana is not only an excellent cook and teacher, but a wonderful person to spend an evening with. She started off by showing us how to make masala chai, then moved on to samosas, which we snacked on as we continued through the other 14 dishes. All four of us were complete beginners, and Ranjana walked us through every step of the process. She was genuinely invested in making sure that we understood the recipes and ingredients, as well as being a welcoming and generous hostess.I'd highly recommend this to anyone looking for a one-of-a-kind night out, or who wants to learn Indian cooking from an expert. Can't wait to try these recipes with our family and friends!

3.description: What a lovely way to spend a day. Ranjana is a gentle woman who can really cook! She loves it. That is very obvious, plus she wants to share that love and knowledge with you. And that she did. I learned so much in three short (and very delicious) hours. I have always enjoyed Indian cuisine, but I admit to a lot of ignorance. I can now not only order with much more confidence, I feel I can create some dishes on my own. I was impressed with the experience and wouldn't mind going back for more, with some more friends, too! Her home is easy to find. Parking is a breeze. She provides everything. What's not to like!?

35.description: Wow, I've now completed all of my four classes and I am cooking delicious and flavorsome Indian dishes at home. It's fabulous. Ranjana has not only taught me how to cook using traditional Indian techniques, she also dispersed so much knowledge about Indian spices and the tradition of the food that I have already started to create my own spice mixes and dishes based on the food I have in the fridge and pantry at the time of cooking. Thank you Ranjana. I'll be coming back for more cooking classes.

19.description: My boyfriend signed us up for this class as a surprise for my birthday and it was wonderful.  We went this past Saturday and we ended up being the only people there as the other people canceled.  So we got a private lesson!  This made me a little nervous as neither of us tends to cook anything too complicated at home.  But, Ranjana made us feel at home and was not at all condescending while giving us hands on training.Her home is beautiful and Hyde Park is full of gorgeous homes and a beautiful lakefront path. I would recommend making a day of it - maybe bring your bike there and explore afterwards to burn off some calories!We took the Basic class and learned how to make some wonderful vegetarian dishes, which we look forward to trying on our own very soon.  Thanks Ranjana!

28.description: This was an amazing experience, and a huge amount of fun. WAY better than some corporate "kitchen" cooking lesson.

45.description: I had a fantastic experience with Ranjana's Basic Northern cooking class. From the moment you enter her home, she and her husband welcome you with open arms and make you feel at home. The class was a combination of demonstration and hands-on. Each member of the class  was given a task and contributed to the meal we prepared. Ranjana is extremely personable and makes the rather labor intensive  process look simple! She corrects you until you can make your Roti look and taste like it came from your favorite restaurant. Not only is Ranjana dedicated to teaching you how to cook indian meals, she educates you about life in India and broadens your culutral horizons. She is an amazing woman. Her sweet husband will take pictures to commemorate the class! It was a great experience- one I would highly recommend!

33.description: *Basic South Indian One tradition of my family's that I really enjoy is that we try to get each other activities as gifts, or something functional. My little sister is a vegetarian, but the kind that survives primarily on Boca Burgers and such. I wanted to take her somewhere fun and that would be interesting to her. So we signed up for one of Ranjana's classes. :) Delicious! I want to go back for more. :) She is friendly and makes truly delicious food; she also helps you to see how the spices from each area are different, the basics of ingredients for any recipe (must have color, heat, etc.) and while I was outspiced sometimes (I can do up to medium), I couldn't stop eating because it was delicious. We had a great time and Ranjana really loves to get to know people. I highly recommend for a gift, for fun, for a date, whatever! My sister is 16 and we came away with ton of recipes and food. :)

43.description: My boyfriend bought me Ranjana's class for Valentine's Day.  It was wonderful!  I have some experience cooking Indian food, so I was familiar with some of the basics, but still learned several new things as well.  We made 9 dishes with Ranjana, including bread, somosas, curry, stuffed vegetables and two desserts.  A great value.  I also enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere of being in her home.  She took her time, answered all our questions and made sure we all had ample opportunity to roll up our sleeves and cook. Ranjana is a gentle hostess and a very interesting person. My boyfriend's gift was truly selfless, as he doesn't even like Indian food.   However, he enjoyed every single dish we made with Ranjana.  Thanks, Ranjana, or opening my boyfriend's eyes to the delight of Indian cuisine.

2.description: Simply awesome! Convinced a couple of buddies to purchase this class as Valentine's Day gifts for our wives. What a great experience. I saw online that I had two highly rated options for classes. This one was further for us, and we would have to leave early on a Saturday morning, but I went with it because I saw it was in her home and thought we'd get a more personal experience. I was not disappointed. When Ranjana found out we were travelling so far, she pushed the start time so we could sleep in a little. We were immediately greeted by her and her husband when we pulled up to the house. We sat and chatted with her husband while she finished last minute preparations in the kitchen. During introductions with her, she found out what our favorite Indian dishes were, and added those to the menu on the spot! We cooked and exchanged stories for about 5 hours, even though we were scheduled for  3. She is an amazing person with great stories and a wealth of knowledge. I highly recommend this class for anyone looking to learn about Indian or vegetarian cooking. We may take another one!

18.description: Ranjana is lovely! This is a wonderful place to learn about the incredible variety of Indian cooking. We went on a Saturday morning and had such a wonderful time. Ranjana is patient and incredibly knowledgeable. I have been eating Indian food my entire life since I grew up with Indian friends--but I had no understanding of the taste elements of Indian cooking present in every dish...It was really helpful to learn how ingredients interact with each other--and also--for considering how you might pair dishes together for a larger dinner party to showcase your new Indian cooking knowledge. This class is the kind of gem you feel really lucky to find in a city that has become increasingly corporate in its food business. We have fewer independent coffee shops, bakeries and delis every year. This place should be celebrated--along with the communal kitchens that are popping up--enabling smaller food purveyors to showcase their craft. And regarding the review below--I didn't see anything in Ranjana's kitchen that looked less than spotless. The place was immaculate and beautiful!

41.description: I just had an amazing cooking class at Ranjana's lovely home last night.  What an amazing experience!  Where do I begin?My boyfriend and I went to her beginner level Northern Indian cooking class.  We're both pretty good cooks already, but Ranjana really challenged us.  Everybody gets involved in a very hands-on way, and the tasks are great fun!  We were making chutneys, frying samosas, and watching rotis puff up on the burner.  All the food was delicious, and we were all so proud because we made it, with Ranjana's gently firm guidance the whole time.She really teaches you about Indian spices, and the components of Indian cooking.  She encourages you to be creative at home, and gives you enough knowledge that you can improvise without following recipes.  In addition to the recipes we expected to learn, she also taught us a few "extra" treats because she had leftover ingredients.She's also had an incredible life, and will tell you such lovely stories while you work.  You really feel like a guest in her home.  I hope very much to return for more classes.  I literally cannot imagine a better cooking class - most cooking classes just teach you really basic, noncreative food that you could probably figure out yourself.  Ranjana's class was exciting and challenging, and the food was delicious.  Can't wait to fry up some samosas later this week, on our own!  We've got to come back for a second class!

52.description: Groupon, you are my hero.I spent one of the best Saturday mornings I have had in a while at Ranjana's house. I had no idea what to expect but was glad to have changed my mind and chosen to accompany my friend who had found the $35 class deal on the aforementioned Super Site.Yay!!In a little more than three hours we learned the basic of Northern Indian vegetarian cooking and a grand total of 9 dishes. Me likey! The atmosphere is totally relax and casual and we, the students are all around the "master" cook (not intimidating at all) who carefully explains every little thing she does while chatting about her background, childhood and Indian traditions. The smell of spices is intoxicating and it is pretty hard to wait 'til the end to dig in (or to retrain oneself from just stealing the piping hot samosas from the dish in the rudest of ways). I was lucky enough to be part of a very curious group who kept asking questions as well as sharing their various experiences and that made for a wonderful culinary adventure in the land of rajahs. We shared our delicious meal in the dining room and promised ourselves to make the next paneer (home-made cheese - ridiculously easy to make) that would pass our lips.With a trip to Devon, the next best thing to do if you want to immerse yourself in the magic fragrances of the East but are to broke to fly to Mumbai....

50.description: Ranjana's cooking class is a fantastic Chicago experience. We were invited into her home for a 10 course + Indian cooking bonanza. She demystified spices that I remember seeing used at home since I was a kid and taught us how to make nutritious, inexpensive and delicious Indian food. Seeing the simplicity with which she is able to prepare dishes gives you the confidence to cook regularly.An amazing part of the sessions are the stories of her life in Chicago and India she is able to weave into her different recipes. It makes for a fun experience to enjoy with a group of friends.One of the best underground food activities you can imagine finding in Chicago..

4.description: When my best friend decided to come to Chicago for spring break, I immediately suggested we take an Indian cooking class. I had noticed Ranjana's Indian Cooking Class a few months ago when I was reading through Yelp reviews and kept the idea in the back of my mind. As I write, all but two of the reviews for Ranjana's classes are five-star reviews--and now that I've taken a class, I will definitely keep the streak alive! I've made Indian dishes before, recipes in hand, but I've never understood the method behind the madness. (That's true for most of the cooking I do, actually.) Ranjana shared the building blocks of Indian cooking. Each dish should contain something salty, something tart, and some kind of chili; for the most part, cooks can mix and match one ingredient from each of the three categories depending on what's on hand. The spice mixture can set one dish apart from another.Furthermore, Ranjana's class was plain fun. Ranjana was full of stories about her childhood and the early years of her marriage, and she also shared anecdotes about the origins of popular Indian dishes.By the end of the class, we'd learned to make ten Indian dishes, including a fried eggplant dish I can't stop thinking about... and an easy okra side I can't stop thinking about... and a homemade paneer masala mixture I can't stop thinking about. I'll be cooking some of these again soon on my own!

6.description: Once in a lifetime experience with Ranjana in her home kitchen. Although nine recipes were promised in the basic North Indian cuisine class, we managed to review 17. Ranjana is such a ball of energy. Answers questions patiently. Blending spices seemed complex at first, but she breaks it into manageable steps. I loved learning how to make samosas, rotis, mango lassi, fresh cheese, okra. Ranjana has great advice on even small details. I took extensive notes but her handouts are a great reference tool. Can't wait to take another class with her.

22.description: This is the best cooking class I have ever been to. Ranjana is welcoming and informative. If you don't have the type of spice at home she tells you what you can sub it for. Not pretentious at all! My husband and I had a lovely time and I will be back for her South Indian class! You really get a lot for your money!!!

15.description: Authentic, genuine, delicious. That was my experience with Ranjana's cooking class. I bought this class for my girlfriend and I as a Valentine's Day date...life happens and we ended up having to reschedule to the next weekend. It ended up being just the two of us on a Saturday morning. We started off making Chai while learning the different parts of India and how their cuisines differ. We made Samosas, a dish that we both love, followed by a  plethora of other authentic dishes which the names escape me now. Ranjana was patient, attentive and let us get our hands dirty making our dishes. We left full of delicious food and a a desire to explore more cuisines. I would recommend Ranjana's class to anyone looking to explore the cuisine and learn how to make it!

20.description: I got the Basic North Indian cooking class for my husband for his birthday. It was a really awesome class that took place in her home. There were only 6 of us there, so we got a lot of hands on time. We also made some amazing food. We learned so much about how to balance Indian flavors correctly and how to apply what we learned to many recipes including samosas with a phenomenal cilantro chutney, an okra dish, and eggplant dish, chai, and roti. She even tossed together a rogan josh paneer dish just because one of the attendees said it was his favorite dish. Ranjana is also an incredibly warm and inviting person, we felt very welcome in her home. Just listening to her talk about her impressive career and life path as well as her successful kids was a lot of fun on its own. Eating the food she helped us prepare was even better. We ate around 12:30 and I don't think I needed to eat for the rest of the day because I had so much delicious food and because I didn't want to get the wonderful taste out of my mouth.If you've ever considered taking a class to learn how to make Indian food, this is the one to take. I'm so excited to recreate the recipes at home.

36.description: We just took a private cooking class with Ranjana.  She was very friendly, professional, and knowledgeable.  She thoroughly explained the numerous recipes we were cooking that day - not only the techniques involved but the overall principles of Indian cooking that were applicable to that dish!  Additionally, Ranjana was extremely efficient - cooking, managing the kitchen, teaching all at the same time.  This class is an INCREDIBLE value and I highly recommend it to anyone - both beginners and experts in cooking would find value in learning from Ranjana.P.S.  I am of South Asian descent, so I am familiar with Indian cuisine.  The recipes she taught us were some of the best I have ever had.

14.description: I purchased the Basic North Indian Cooking for my Boyfriend (who is from South India) and me (who is not Indian and never cooked Indian food).  I instantly felt welcomed into Ranjana's home.  Her husband welcomed us and immediately  took our coats.Ranjana lives on the south side in a beautiful home in an area in Chicago I had no idea existed.  After the entire group arrived (classes are limited to 8 people, which is  perfect amount) we were invited into the kitchen.  Ranjana had all the fresh ingredients lined up.  She also had a large map of India on the wall.  She began the class by teaching us a little bit about cooking in various northern regions of India.  She taught us that all Indian dishes need something Salty, Tangy, and Spicy (or some kind of heat) in it.  This is something I never knew but after making the dishes completely understood.  She provided hands on training while making me feel like I was cooking with my mom in the kitchen.  She spoke of her marriage, coming to Chicago (from India), and her kids (wow-what successful children she has raised).I have always been intimidated by Indian food.  It has always seem so complicated and time consuming.  Ranjana broke each recipe down to a very easy and manageable format. Come hungry!!! We made so much food that our group couldn't possibly have consumed all of it.  It's a fantastic deal for the amount of time Ranjana spends with you as well as the amount of food you get.My boyfriend has been cooking Indian food his whole life and even he learned a lot in this class.  He was engaged and eager to participate.  It's a very laid back and welcoming environment.  Don't let the south side location deter you.  It is 150% worth the trip.  My boyfriend and I can't wait to go back and take the south Indian cooking class!Ranjana is also extremely organized.  When booking the class, she immediately responded that she had room in the class I wanted.  She also created a "gift certificate" for my boyfriend so that I could present him with some type of gift.  She also followed up the day before with specific instructions (where to park--they have permits for the street and the street parking was wide open) and directions.If you looking for something different to do in the city, look no further!

3.description: They have a good selection of products for the hair, skin and nails and a discount card that can save you money off of your next purchase. One thing that I really like about this place is that they don't follow you around when you shop! Yes, I've noticed that most small business owners lose their minds when someone walks in with a large purse or bag. This store treats their customers with respect after all if you have security cameras do you need to pace up and down to rows to watch me too?

1.description: Pretty good selection of hair and the like. I really liked how they had a reward card, although I haven't been back since. Its a weird place to park your car so its better to walk. The employees had a good knowledge of black hair, so when I told them of the style I wanted to achieve, they were able to point me in the right direction. I bought braiding hair but if I ever get a chance, I'd like to check out their wigs.

2.description: I went to this place today and waited, and waited and waited to be serviced. There was only one person to assist and she was busy with another customer. She never acknowledged me. I walked around the store for a little while and got tired of being followed by security. I left and will not be back. Taking my business elsewhere.

5.description: LOVE THIS PLACE. I am a hair stylist and I do Hair Extentions. Now When it come to buying hair you don't want cheap stuff that will tangle and look a mess in a week. I will only do Extentions if you have remy hair.... Now the best remy hair that you can buy in Beauty supplys is Bohyme. It comes in all types of textures and colors. I have a very diverse clientel that ranges from, white, asian, black and mid-eastern.... and yes they all want extentions and this hair comes in all thoses textures!! Beauty one on roosevelt has them all!! The staff is friendly and knows me by name!! Even on days that I am too busy to go with my clients all I have to do is call and tell them what I need and they will have it waiting at the counter for my client!! So if you want  long lasting hair without paying online hair prices beauty one is your store.... And if you want it put in Hair By Danyel is your girl!! I am also located in the south loop 1518 S. Wabash 312-404-0853 or just pick up one of my cards at Beatuy One!!

6.description: Staff is generally neutral or friendly. Wide range of wig/hair, hair styling, hair accessorizing, nail polish/care, and skin moisturizing products. Prices are very affordable.

0.description: After receiving horrible service at 2 other beauty supply places, we stumbled across this one. They have a nice collection of wigs and hair products. The sales staff is very knowledgeable, friendly and go out of their way to find wigs that are suited to you.  A sign says that you can only try on 3 wigs for each wig cap you purchase but they'll waive that if you show you're a serious shopper.  I had only intended to buy 1 wig but came out with 3 plus some hair products!  They have a discount club after your first purchase that will give you 5% off future purchases.  Though I easily found street parking, I'm told that there is a parking lot in the rear of the store.I highly recommend this place!

4.description: This place is excellent. There is a great selection of hair extensions and products. The prices are reasonable, the staff is very friendly! I'm so glad this place is in the South Loop!

3.description: It was the middle of the night and I was starving, and the grocery stores were all closed, except for Save a Lot.Like a lot of discount grocery stores, it was made up mostly of generic, over processed products that I would never choose to ingest.  However, the tomatoes . . . .I've only found better tomatoes in farmer's markets and third world countries.  Perfectly red, evenly ripened, and still firm.  Never mealy.  And they're cheaper than all the other grocery stores.  $1.69 a pound!  Often less!  Since I eat tomatoes everyday, this is my regular tomato store.  I stop there at least once a week.From experience, the tomatoes are both better and cheaper than at Dominicks, Trader Joes, Jewel, and  Whole Foods.  There you go.

1.description: There is a grocery store in South Shore, Save-A-Lot.  It's clean, has a good selection of products, and you aren't paying inflated prices for "name brand" goods. If you need specialty items this isn't the place, but for all your everyday needs it's great. It's always open, and the people who work there are very nice.  It also helps me with my Urban Sustainability because it doesn't have all those cheap plastic bags, I bring my reusable ones.  A special shout out and thank you for having a place to dispose of them right at the exit door, and not in a hard to find place at the back of the store.

2.description: I think my husband and I go to this store like 3 times a week. I will admit, a lot of the products do not agree with our diet (i.e. heavily processed food, non-organic, etc.). I'm big on reading ingredients and if I find something that has the exact same ingredients as a more expensive brand and it's sold at Sav-O-Lot for $1-5 cheaper, I'm buying it! Therefore, it's convenience in location and cost savings make it the place to shop for some of our grocery needs. My hubby and I are both night owls (which is sad because we have to leave the house at 7 am to go to work) and this store is open 24 hours for people like us! I was a little salty that they were closed on Thanksgiving Day because most 24 hour stores stay open on holidays. But, I'll give them a pass on that because they'll be open the next day when I need to pick up that bottle of ketchup I'll likely run out of at 1 am.

0.description: Save-A-Lot is like the dollar store of grocery stores...lol I mean everything is not a dollar but they have many things that are a dollar and when you think of today's economy that is a good deal.This location is clean and the staff is nice!!!Now, sometimes you have a wait in line which can drive me batty but its worth it!!The frozen veggies which are just over a dollar is fresh the only one I don't like is the broccoli its more stem then floret.The other bonus is they are open for 24 hours so if you are a person that likes to shop at night and have the store to yourself...then Save-a-lot is the place to go!

3.description: I Love, love, love this place. I order for every celebration and they are always delish!  I tried delivery for the first time, it was easy, on time and still hot! Try the shrimp and wings with lemon pepper.

1.description: Always fresh food, cooked to order. Friendly staff. Yummy banana pudding. I eat here more often than I'm willing to admit lol.

2.description: So its 9:50 and their doors weren't locked so I went in thinking I was about to order but he stops me after I'm inside to say they're closed...no sir its not 10 so screw you guys I'll  yelp about it

5.description: Yes I did give a wing joint, on the south side, 4 stars. i have been accused of aspiring to be part owner of this fine (and clean) chicken establishment because they are the most consistent value, taste and service in the area. matter of fact, whenever you need wings you need wings n fins! their trays are perfect for parties or game night and they have great specials and some even include a pop. unlike some of their competitors no sauce is necessary and their wings are always cooked just right. Try Wings n Fins....dont be scurrrd!

6.description: I will say the wings are fantastic although I was a first time customer looked on the website it  gave misleading prices the website had not been updated and the cashier nor the manager wouldn't honor the original price from the website or compensate me in anyway. I will not return to this establishment. Rule 101 is the customer is always right especially when you mess up.

7.description: I've always hated...I mean hated as in refused to eat wings....BUT this place has made a convert out of me.  I have since come to the conclusion that it was the typical excess of sauce, especially the buffalo kind, that put me off in the first place.  I work near here, and they were brought in for lunch--I think I ate 10-15 which is quite a bit for my size.  They have about 7 different flavors to choose from (I personally recommend the lemon pepper!) and they are crispy, fried, little pieces of heaven.  In addition to the amazing wings, the prices are super super reasonable---bordering on downright cheap.  All dinners (4, 6, or 10 pc) come w/ fries and slaw and start around $4.  Now, I know what you are thinking---you used to hate wings what makes you the expert?--and you would be quite right.  So, I took the bf here the other day (quite the foodie and wings connoisseur) and he 100% agreed w/ me.  So if you are down in the south side def. make a quick stop here.  Call ahead to get the order fast or order and wait---downside is it's take out only.  p.s. the fish is good too--but I've always liked fried fish, so I won't rantwhatever you like...order it and you will like it.  the end.

8.description: Great Wings! I took them to a Christmas party and everyone loved them! They  want to know where I got them! I'm so glad they were a big hit!

0.description: I am never disappointed.  I love this place. It's always fresh and hot. When I call it in,  it's ready when they say it will be.

4.description: Great wings. Awesome selection. Nice people behind the counter. Always a great experience.

3.description: The food is good especially the fish and chicken but they need to come down on the prices for real.

1.description: Two stars only because the food is good; otherwise, it would be one star, due to horrible service. Double check your orders because they will throw whatever they want in that bag and argue if you try to correct them.  Do yourself a favor and get Popeyes instead.

2.description: Chicken is very good. I will definitely will go back.   The chicken is cooked just right. It also had fish if that's what you prefer.

0.description: The Perch is crispy and fluffy at the same time (if that's possible) every time. Chicken tenders are also excellent.  Call ahead and it's ready when you get there.

4.description: horrible service... ghetto.... cold food.... sauce was half full. ... delievery man would come to the door... don't order from them if you are looking for quality food and service!!!! no stars!!!

3.description: Hole-in-the-wall American version of Chinese food, that's all. Nothing special here. Oh yeah, it's a big deal that there's a giant window where you can "see thru" into the kitchen, so you can see all the old, beat up, cluttery kitchen equipment. It is clean enough, though.And why is the Kung Pao chicken not at all spicy, and contains no peanuts? Oh yeah, because it's American Chinese food.

1.description: When you're a single person ordering your lunch it's likely to be under $10. When you order it over the phone they should tell you to bring cash and no credit or debit for anything under $10.They turned me away completely after I showed them I have no cash. They will probably just put my food in someone else's stuff and call it fresh. Keep looking there are definitely better cheap Chinese restaurants.

2.description: I didn't hate it but I personally won't go back, it didn't taste like authentic Chinese. The chicken didn't taste like chicken. The fried rice was not dark or robust w flavor. They are fast and the food is made to order! The serving size is huge, a small can feed two ppl!

5.description: This is just good simple Asian-American cuisine right here. Their prices aren't bad and the portions are nicely sized. Most of the time I get the combo delivered because it's a pretty decent deal. Haven't had anything that tasted terrible and their delivery time is adequate. Sometimes the rice can be a bit dry, but the actual food is fresh.

6.description: Good food and fast service. The food is always fresh. The bulletproof glass you have to order through is a turn off. They deliver and have special coupons for free food

0.description: The delivery time was a bit on the long side (it took more than an hour) but once the food arrived I forgot about the wait. Not only was the meal delicious it was also way more than what was expected. I ate until full and still had only put a small dent in the amount of food given. I might have found a new favorite when I'm craving a bit of orange chicken and vegetable fried rice. I've eaten a lot of Chinese food, but this was by far one of the best.

4.description: My boyfriend and I have ordered from here twice and both times it was fresh, hot, and tasted really good. The woman who answers the phone is a little hard to understand, which sometimes requires a great deal of patience, but it's worth it.They're priced fairly but if you want a menu check out grubhub.com as they actually provide one for this place. Delivery takes around 30 minutes to my place and they give you a massive amount of food. The orange chicken and rice combo plate is my favorite, but the eggroll is gross.

1.description: The interior of the store was horrible... and customer service was just as if not worst.... once we got food they forgot to add the chicken to our gizzard combos and the fries tasted as if they were fried in old grease

2.description: This is the absolute worst Harold's Ive encounter thus far. I've never felt so disrespected. If you want even a slightly decent customer service experience, don't even bother. I've called before to ask about delivery and have an attitude respond cut me off and with "15 minutes" and hang up on me. Just today I've called and had someone pick up the phone place it down on what I'm assuming was the counter and not speak, however I could hear several conversations going on in the background, followed by someone eventually saying "hey hang that up" this is all a shame because the food is actually very good, so that much I can give this place. Is it worth the headache? Absolutely not.

0.description: This is not the worst Harold's but its not the best either!I sure do hate that got rid of their special that use to run Sunday thru Thursday but now its only Sunday!They only take cash and this is another place that is better to call ahead if you are in a rush because they do cook to order.
Had to do a last minute pickup of a few items and was surprised of the excellent service and prices.

1.description: For an after hours bar the crowd is mediocre at best the top shelf drinks are a lie save your money and order from the well  hate that they digitally monitor the pour  the only upside to this bar is that they are open until 4 am on a Friday night

2.description: One word, GHETTO! The security at the front door were nasty and obnoxious, the cover charge and "re-entry fee" were ridiculous, and the drinks were extremely over priced. The music was okay and people inside the pub were really nice and friendly.

0.description: ive been here over the years & even though its changed & they "renovated" it, i feel as if it still needs more renovation. the place is so small that it can get so crowded quickly. the drinks were overpriced but the bartenders were friendly. music was good & i liked some of the performances.

3.description: As WCs go, this one's a slacker, not a slider.  Staff slop the burgers around as they make and package them, yielding an amorphous blob in varying degrees of doneness.  Quality control!  First and 10:  the Skyway!

1.description: They can't get your order right to save their lives and have a really shitty attitude to boot. I literally repeated my order 5 times and the guy could not repeat it back right and then refused to do so and got pissed at me. I guess you are just supposed to pay for and eat whatever they decide to throw in the sack and be happy about it. For the record here was my oh-so-complicated order:  3 original cheeseburgers, 2 jalapeño cheeseburgers, 1 chicken slider, 1 small onion rings. Nothing customized like "no ketchup", no substitutions, nothing off-menu.  I left the line, which I imagine happens a lot. Go across the street to Taco Bell where they can actually pay attention, repeat your order correctly, give you the correct change and food and are extremely sweet.

2.description: Love the food however this fast food restaurant is a great example of fast food out of control. I ask for a small drink and apparently since I have been away from Chicago, what was once considered a medium drink is now small. I am not even close to being that thirsty.

5.description: I made the very big mistake of stopping here to get something to eat before I hit the road to take a road trip. My stomach was bubbling after about 15 minutes and I had to stop & rest , if you get my drift. I can't forgive them for that & haven't been there since. Aside from that, I wouldn't hit this White Castle after dark; the freaks come out & they want sliders.

6.description: In my best French accent.....GAR-BAGE.

7.description: Drive up is slow slow slow. They have double windows so they must have doubled the wait time also.

0.description: The name "White Castle" was chosen to confer an image of meticulous hygiene during an era when ground beef was considered a nightmare proposition, the by-product of Upton Sinclair-eque abattoirs. The founder considered it vitally important that the food was prepared in full view of the diners and that the employees wore spotless uniforms. I wonder what he would have thought about the pair of rancid pants we encountered on our trip to the drive-through. We had plenty of time to ponder the mysteries of the pants as we waited over ten minutes for our bitty burgers to arrive.They have a 2-lane drive-through with this cool robo-elevator that carries the sacks to the outer lane. This device has the unfortunate and unappetizing moniker of "The Vittlevator."The food? Most people love it or hate it. My White Castle cravings are becoming fewer and farther between these days, but there are times when nothing will hit the spot like several tiny burgers. They're cute, but it's really all about the viscosity: they go down easy, with so little of that bothersome chewing to distract you from the flavor.

4.description: I only give this White Castle's a 5 star because I've been going to this one since I was a kid in the 1970s.I love White Castle's so much I wish we had them out here in San Francisco.
