This is the one I go to the most often when I go back to Chicago to visit family & friends. This is sort of a rough area, hence why they have the bullet proof windows. Yes the folks that come in here are rather rude to the staff but I've never had any problems here. If there is a White Castle's in hell, I'd still give it a 5 star because I love their burgers so much!

1.description: I give Raye 5 star's but really she deserves a 10 plus more. Her skills are  phenomenal. What she has isn't talent ITS A GIFT. I've been a client for a couple of years and every time I got my hair done it always looked excellent! My hair is healthy from root to tip and every where in between and it's all thanks to her. Raye is an amazing hair stylist or artist shall I say and it shows in her work. Raye cares for her clients and the health of their hair. Her style is always unique. She always takes the time to make sure everything is just right. I haven't met another like her and after getting my done by her I  haven't been more satisfied. She is indeed the best! it's only right that you book your appointment today and see what I'm talking about i guarantee you won't regret it.     L.Libby

2.description: I've been going to Raye for years now and hwve absolutely no complaints...   She is very knowledgeable and stays abreast of all the latest trends...  You'll always be satisfied with Healthy Hair by Raye!

0.description: Coloring, cutting, styling, EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE and thee absolute sweetest stylist award goes to RAYE!! I've received full transformations that extend from a new cut, long extensions and a POP of color that leave me feeling fantastic. I feel elated when I walk out of the salon receiving compliment after compliment. Her prices are outstanding and she travels!! RAYE is my favorite stylist and I simply LOVE getting the entire #healthyhairbyRaye experience.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: This location of K & G has some of the best customer service in the city. Their tailors are really good too. My husband has to wear a suit to work daily and these are great suits for everyday wear at good prices. The prices can be phenomenally good when they are having a a special sale (yesterday he bought three suits for about $260, with tailoring costs!). The tailor even went on to the floor to help my husband find the right suit so he could get the sale price; the lady who helps in the fitting room is also very nice (I always have to stand waiting for the Mr. and she remembers us and chats with me so it's not too awkward). The young lady who checked us out yesterday happened to be especially wonderful (and we have never had bad service there); she was on hold with "corporate" waiting to see if we had any coupons on our account and because it took so long she asked the manager if she could give us a small discount. The amazing thing was that she didn't do it because we were upset or anything, but because she thought it was the right thing to do. LOVE this place.

1.description: I HAD NO IDEA...This place is GREAT...name brands at discount prices!!!

2.description: I love this K&G.  They always have great deals on clothing.  But, what stands out more than anything is their customer service.  I guess I didn't expect the "above and beyond" courtesy treatment as many times as my husband and I have received it from shopping at this location.  I've shopped at other K&Gs locally and in different states and they don't follow this store's friendly motto.  As a matter of fact, I had one bad experience out of town that kept me from shopping at K&G's for a couple of years.  But, I heard K&G's was have a great suit sale (and the hubby needed new suits fast).  One of our first few trips to this location, a manager gave us our first lesson in tying ties by showing the hubby and I how to tie a windsor knot (we're young professionals, so we're just learning this stuff!)  Anyway, she gave us the "fat man, skinny man" metaphor to help us remember and we've being tying ties every since! I just wanted to leave a review because it is such a rare experience to receive good customer service (and consistently)!

0.description: I go here along with 2 other locations for a lot of my brand name clothes and shoes such as Kenneth Cole, Perry Ellis, Stacy Adams, Sean John, etc.....Prices are reasonable and they have huge selections. They have just about everything you can imagine such as ties, watches, cufflinks, coats, briefcases, winter outerwear and other things we men love to wear . They sometimes have sales on suits: 2 for $150. They do alterations on site as well.If you are into urban gear, the casual look or business clothes, K&G will set you straight

4.description: My first experience here was today with mi madre. Not too bad of a place. The store was very clean, clothes were presented nicely, and they sell shoes!!! This is pretty much like a Marshall's or a TJ Max. However, this one is focused on fashion. Right now they have a kick ass sales on three piece suits. By two for $130! The store is primarily for more professional dress wear, not casual. The prices were okay. Not great. If you need suits for work and need to get them at a discount, then definitely check this place out.

3.description: this place has saved my ass so many nights when my frozen meat is still defrosting. it's not amazingly great in quality, but it's open late! my favorite is the original hoagy (which could use some work) and a double scoop of black walnut ice cream!

1.description: food was awful.  i ordered a gyro sub. i specifically asked for gyro sauce, lettuce & tomato only.  why is it when i get home i have fu $king what tastes like miracle whip mayo on my ish & mustard! who in the hell puts mustard on a gyro sub!  noone but these clowns!  there's an older guy back there that can barely walk that's doing the "cooking" but has to continuously ask the younger guy how to prepare the food.  i also got a turkey ham sub &what's on it? some damn mustard that i didnt ask for! u all watch ur sandwiches when u come to this place, better yet don't come here. they're slow,  the food isn't good& its a waste of money. i could've went to subway instead. uve been warned

2.description: This place was just okay. The food was decent and the service wasn't great but it wasn't bad. This is mostly a pick up place, they had two bar stools to a counter that had not been cleaned off. The meal was a good price we ordered two meals that came complete with fries and a canned drink and it was less than 13 dollars. They could use some remodeling and a good thorough cleaning but over all it was what i expected. While i would not suggest this place to anyone, it was cool if you just stumbled upon it.

5.description: What is the deal with the bad reviews? I think the food is delicious!!! Of all the places I've had a gyro burger,  I think theirs tastes the best. This was the first Italian Beef I have ever tried and I'd be disappointed if I had one anywhere else that wasn't so light and delectable. Yes it was juicy. And their catfish is the best out of all the places I've ordered a fish dinner from too. They also have this sauce that tastes like a mix of ketchup and tangy Carolina style BBQ, and I am not really a ketchup person and would never put ketchup on chicken or fish, but their mystery sauce is delicious on both fish and chicken.

6.description: So weird that the place can be called Hoagy house and have god awful terrible hoagie's made with cheap mystery meat... I'm never ordering from this place again! deserves negative 5 stars!

7.description: Ummm ummm good. The best in the business....delicious. Location very clean and friendly staff.

8.description: Hoagy' s, steak sandwiches, tacos, burgers, and shakes are off the chain!! Delicious food.

0.description: It's our go too resturant when we want something fast and don't want to cook love the Gyro Cheese Fries and Gyro Burger!!!

4.description: I love Hoagy House. Their food is delicious and really hits the spot when you're in the mood for fastfood. They're literally 4 blocks away from me and they deliver.

3.description: I have to say I didn't experience any rude customer service but they do need to hire more people!The lines even in the self check out are so long and I don't understand that!I do not frequent Jewel Stores as it is anymore because of the prices.  I do make sure I have my coupons ready and when I do go it's only for the sale items because they can be pretty pricey!

1.description: I live in this area, so I shop here solely because of convenience. Customer service is non existent. Only shop here when I don't feel like going to the jewels a couple of miles away.

2.description: I live in the community so naturally I would shop here.This all changed on July 1, 2015.I was having some meat cut from the deli and to my surprise A HUGE RAT came from behind the deli area.I was astonished. I yelled and the deli staff didn't seemed shocked by the fact of there being a HUGE RAT.I of course I left WITHOUT the meat.I did call the City of Chicago Inspections. We'll see how that goes.But if you don't want RAT with your order DONT SHOP HERE

5.description: I go to this store because it's  convenient but they have some of the worst produce selections majority of the time it's rotten just bad I guess I'll go back to shopping at my favorite store that's downtown better selections and prices. It's sad that you have to leave your own neighborhood to get better quality food.

6.description: I hate this damn Jewel. Its horrible. The team members are rude. The customers are ignorant and that's being generous. I'll try the extra 3 miles to the one on 95th from now on. Wish I could give it negative 7 stars.Oh yea and they are expensive!!! I'll be writing a strongly worded letter to Albertson's

7.description: Two stars for the helpful Employees. Produce selection sucks! Highly priced and very low quality. How in  the hell can you charge top dollar for rotten, anorexic, fruits and vegetables?

8.description: ABSOLUTELY THE WORST!!! This store should be closed down as a hazard, It is not only filthy and never completely stocked, but the customer service is PATHETIC. I was at the deli on yesterday and was literally in tears and appalled at the way I was treated and talked to by an deli staff by the name of MARYAM. She was the rudest, the most ignorant person I have ever encountered when patronizing a business. I am in the process of writing a detailed letter to corporate. NO ONE should ever be treated this way while spending their hard earned money, especially at Jewel.

9.description: Not a bad store... Can get crowded quick... But they do have self check out so that does help some

0.description: I had a great experience I needed something prepared on the fly for a party. Nicole was so very nice and assisted me so graciously. I am so grateful to her and Jewel. Their taco dip is amazing!!

4.description: All your essential grocery items in one place. If you ever need a delivery guy to take you home, they have a ton of them, so you should be covered. The employees here are always friendly and joke with me during checkout which I like.The butchers here deserve an award for customer service. They are the epitome of what customer service should be. Every time they've had ground beef on sale, but there was none out because they sold all of what they put out, they've gone in the back and have packaged up a few more, and let me take my pick of which one I wanted to purchase.I love that about this Jewel, there's always someone ready to help you, who actually wants to help you and doesn't make it seem as if they're only doing it because they have to.

1.description: Love this store the workers are very friendly and helpful. Great quality clothing and clean store. Prices are great and I love their clearance section. Three thumbs up!!!!

2.description: Your sign says that you close at 6pm, so why did you close at 5:30pm  i understand that its new years day, but that young woman drove all the way over there for nothing. I bet that wouldn't happen on the northside. Come on soithsiders, we don't have to stand for that.

0.description: This is a smaller Rainbow but they are packed with great trendy disposable clothes!!!Disposable Clothes= Items that you won't be able to have in your closet for years especially if you dry them but a great price for a trendy clothes!The staff is great and my service the last time I went for a return was very helpful!I was told because this store is only for Plus Size women they are able to bring different styles to their store!!!I was impressed and this is one of the Rainbows I frequent!!!They even have lay-away...that works for me!!!

3.description: I actually came across this place picking up dinner for me & my gf because since last nighg most of the fast food places near me were close. The Food here was delicious & very convenient with being open 24hrs; also the guy that's prepared the food fast. I'm actually going back tonight as we speak after work. Will be one of my new fav places to go & grab

1.description: I didn't care for this place. My order took to long and it was only wings. But something was off about the flavor of the wings, I don't know if the meat was old or if it was the grease that they use to fry it in but I didn't care for it. I don't think I will be back here because I don't think its that hard these days to make a decent fried chicken wing but I guess some places still cannot get the hang of it...

2.description: This is an update on this restaurant.  I got a gyro last night and I have to say at first I was enjoying it although it had watered-down Greek cucumber sauce drizzled all over it.  That wasn't the problem the problem was the sour meat that I tasted and unfortunately I had the same experience before with the wings but I thought it as just me until I let my daughter taste my sandwich. I also bought my grand daughter some cheese sticks and although they were good they didn't have that gooey stringy cheese filling that makes eating cheese sticks so good.  They were just warm covered cheese that wasn't that great.  I won't be back and I say to anyone that comes here to eat beware because the food isn't fresh.Maybe being open 24 hours doesn't give them an opportunity to keep up with the food but I know they need to be checked by the health department.  Too bad because when they were good they were good but who wants to take the chance of getting some bad food and paying for it on top of that.I would have given this restaurant 5 stars because I do really like the chicken,  but the last couple of times I went the chicken taste slightly unfresh.There is a slight language barrier but each time I have gone they have been very nice.I have only had the wings but they have a wide variety of food on the menu and you can add gyro meat to just about everything.  They also serve breakfast and I was surprised at how many people were ordering it but I have to say it was a good price.I am going to try other items but if I get another order of unfresh wings I won't be back no matter how reasonable the prices are.The restaurant is clean but there are people hanging out side the place at times so I just call my order in now to lessen my time at the restaurant.Overall it is a cool spot to go to if money is funny but you don't feel like cooking or want some fast food.I will update if the chicken isn't right!

0.description: 3 AM Sunday didn't want a slider or subway.  A ton of things on the menu however, I asked a local what's good here and the answer was either the chicken or the chicken tenders. So intent with the wings. It took a while cooked to order. I wasn't disappointed. Next time might do the gyro.  Be careful there is a place east of here that's open 24 hours also. I almost went there however noticed that the folks coming out didn't have food.  Seemed more like a convince store that sold food with flashy lights...

i been doing business with jeffro for as long as i can remember me my mom aunt they have nice things an reasonable prices mr.joe chroman used to be my salesman god rest his sole u guy's will be seeing me soon look for a small wooden table chair set to seat four

1.description: This is an awesome place for hair braiding less distractions and friendly service. Haley is awesome she's never late and care about your needs.

2.description: Done in less than 5 hrs.Reasonable prices.Friendly environment.Great service!What more could u ask for....... Will be back for more!!!!!!

0.description: Haley always do my hair she's quick and my braids are always nice and neat she cares about her customers   her prices are reasonable Thanks Haley you never let me down see you in a few months

3.description: The food is pretty delicious. Very generous portions to share! Delivery has always been swift and courteous for me.

1.description: This is a review based off of a delivery experience from GrubHub.It was late on a Sunday and I was hungry. I went through GrubHub and found this restaurant for the first time. I figured, why not. I ordered crab rangoon, gyoza, and orange chicken with shrimp fried rice but I substituted chicken for an extra dollar (??). I was not too happy to fork over that extra dollar but I prefer chicken fried rice.Order was supposed to be delivered in an hour and it arrived in about and hour and 10 minutes, which wasn't horrible but was annoying. Food arrived and there was a lot of food. Like a lot of food. Enough for days. The rice was okay but there were way too many mushrooms and it was missing something. The rangoons were mediocre - more breading than anything. There were was very little crab/cream cheese mixture. The gyoza were great. The orange chicken tastes like orange chicken.Overall, I wouldn't necessarily recommend this restaurant. The food is okay and the price was right, but that's about it.

2.description: Sadly, it appears that this restaurant has closed. Their phone number has been disconnected and they're listed as "closed" on Grubhub. Too bad, I loved their pot stickers and Pad Thai.

5.description: They serve some of the best Chinese and Thai food I've ever had! The beef fried rice was awesome and so was the cashew nut chicken. The satay chicken was delicious, even without the peanut sauce. I will have to order from them again. The only problem was with the delivery guy; he got lost finding my place. The food, however, was great!

6.description: WORST delivery service I have ever seen. I asked the delivery man to come into the courtyard and meet me in front of the building door (20 steps from the street) because I forgot to take the keys and cannot get back into the building if I leave, THREE TIMES! And all he repeated on the phone was "COME OUTSIDE"! Not even a PLEASE! I had to go back up to get my keys and come outside again, then he explains (in Mandarin) that he never delivers into the building in the evenings because it is dangerous. Wow! How brave is every single delivery man from everywhere else! I should rate Papa John's 100 stars, right? And I didn't even ask him to come inside, just to the building door because I had no key with me! Delivery fee was paid for delivery service. Not only the service was incomplete, but I also received no respect at all. I've seen rude delivery men, but this is my first ever "Never Order Delivery From This Place Again" restaurant, and I'm so happy about my decision, which was made right after I turned my back on him.

7.description: I had a menu from this place that had different sushi rolls so I went in and their menu in the store was much smaller. I asked if they had any handheld menus, like most takeout restaurants do, and she rudely responded that they didn't have any. I don't know what her problem was, if she was just being cheap or just plainly didn't want to give me a menu but I didn't appreciate it. And I had one before but lost it so I know they most likely did have some. Anyway, I tried to order some sushi and guess what, they had no Japanese food. I just left, annoyed. I don't understand why they have things on their menu that they don't have. I definitely wouldn't recommend buying from here from the rude service and the false advertisement.

8.description: I have to agree with the ladies the food is fair however I just received the MOST HORRIBLE TREATMENT from this establishment,whatever you do DO NOT ORDER YOUR FOOD ONLINE!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I ordered my food at 6:30 online and at 7:15 I called to make sure they got my order and to get a eta,the gentleman said an hour,ok cool,it's snowing so I get it. An hour later I call, he says that the driver isnt back and give them another hour I told him I want a refund,he says, oh good you're coming in to carryout I said refund,he says ok and hangs up,I call back to say how do I get my refund he hung up on me without giving me an explanation then I called back and they let the phone ring for a solid five minutes,I called the phone until I stomped into the store demanding the money back! Never again! I liked them and now I cant give them my business anymore, Im sad

9.description: I ordered from Asian Spoon as of last night & had a good experience (the service was friendly & the delivery prompt!)! Although there were two peculiar things that happened with this order: the first thing was that I had a craving for sushi & was excited to try some especially so close to my area for there aren't any sushi restaurants that delivers to my address however upon calling to place an order, I was told that their sushi chef was on vacation for the next few weeks! WTF?! So there's only one person responsible for preparing sushi @ this place?! Not cool! So I had to totally rethink my order (after failing miserably to find a place that would deliver sushi to my address, UGH!) which turned out to be Mussels in a Black Bean sauce, Shrimp in Lobster sauce, Crab Rangoon, Egg Drop Soup & as an added bonus b/c my order was over $20 an order of Orange Chicken for $1 with a coupon. Everything was tasty but (& here's the second peculiar thing) the Mussels order came with chicken on it! I've never had a Mussels dish with bits of chicken amongst it, but it did work in this case & I ate it all! Mainly because I was starving! All & All I will order from Asian Spoon again especially to try the sushi which had now become my Moby Dick (aka the elusive white whale!)!!

0.description: Okay. Firstly we ordered online through GrubHub with an expected delivery time of 8:30. Sadly our delivery driver had car issues, however the restaurant called us 20 minutes before our delivery time to let us know what happened. At 8:55 25 minutes after the delivery time i called to checkup, and the lady was unaware but was going to call the driver then call me back to let me know and apologized for the inconvenience. Immediately after the call the delivery driver was at the door. BOOMThe food was on point tastewise I ordered the Phanaeng Curry and it was great, they even threw in some serving spoons as well. The food was still perfectly warm and the order was entirely correct. They even threw in 2 $5 gift cards for our next order. Even though I read bad reviews before ordering and was skeptical this experience was wonderful and I will surely be ordering from them again. Great service

4.description: Surprisingly, everything was super tasty. I've never had Chinese food this fresh, and on the south side of the city at that. The portion sizes are nice as well. Makes for a day or two of leftovers. I'll definitely be returning.

3.description: Great Food. FAST. Clean.  Friendly service!!! Weekday specials. .. just great!!! Weekday specials. ... and food is always hott!!

1.description: I've got a story to tell.....WANNA HEAR IT?Okay...so my office (which is downtown) would make a large group order from JR's like once a month. It was the payday treat. Generally without any major issue.This past Friday, we made our order per usual...but the order wasn't correct. JR had to come back to our site, but I was out of the office so they didn't realize that I had never received my food. No worries...we call and speak with the owner and his daughter to explain. They apologize (they knew they messed it up), but said their driver was out for the day and did not know when they would return. Once again, no worries....they promised to deliver my order AND provide a refund for the purchase. I appreciate customer service so, no harm no foul. Our office contact even promises to make additional orders so that we can maintain our relationship.Monday rolls around, and no sign of JR. Office contact calls and is told that they are unable to deliver today due to a health inspector visit (troubling, but hey....I guess it happens)...but they will DEFINITELY make the trip tomorrow with my order that was missed, and with the extra items we planned to order.Now it's Tuesday. I get the message that JR is coming to deliver about 11:30am. I clear my schedule to make SURE I'm here. About 12:15p...the delivery person shows up with the extra items we ordered, but no sign of my order at all. To be fair, they did provide a refund for my purchase, but now I'm scrambling for a meal when I had my mouth set for Jerk. Sad part is, this was my neighborhood restaurant. I lived a block away for a few years and would often make the trip for lunch/dinner. I WANTED them to succeed...was willing to wait them out...I feel like I've been nothing but accommodating. Mistakes happen...I'm not trying to be THAT guy.But professional promises are just that, and that is the standard I will hold you to.Now, not only have you lost my business...but you've lost the business of my office. We tried calling, we go to voicemail. Texts to the daughter aren't replied. So, in a nutshell, I can't support the business. There are plenty of jerk places in Chicago (My fave is Daddy O's on Cottage). Find another one and let JR's management figure out how to operate a customer friendly establishment. Maybe a few less dollars in the till will help.

2.description: Hadn't had any jerk chicken in a while so I decided to give Jrs a try. Was pleasantly surprised, moist, seasoned like I like it and best of all a large amount of food. Will definitely be going back can't wait. Little bit of a wait but I know how to solve that, call it in first. Courteous staff, and eight dollars for a jerk chicken dinner with two sides. Daily specials will be calling my name, thank you Yelp.

0.description: Great neighborhood go-to for good jerk. Always consistent. Especially love their plantains and sweet potatoes- and duh, their chicken

36.description: I love the bakery. German chocolate cake is off the chain.Try it, I promise you will love it too. :-)

29.description: So... I am a firm believer of frequenting the local businesses in my neighbor, especially the businesses that are black owned. But I have been deeply dissatisfied with the pastries from this place. When they first opened, I was excited to have a dessert shop so near home. They so let me down. Their desserts aren't horrible, but nothing to scream about either. Personal opinion, they rate low on my dessert todium pole. It's so unfortunate. I've given them several opportunities to change my mind but they have failed each time. I have tried each of their limited selection of 'treats' and have not been impressed. I continued to go here hoping for improvement but that has never been the case. The brownies: dry and nothing special; the cupcakes: large and no matter what kind you get, they taste the same. Matter of fact, everything in this place taste the exact same - just blah (certainly not gross).The customer service is subpar. They never have anything ready and you would  think with only having about six items, they would keep the shelves filled, but that is never the case. Positives: the place is always clean and the knick knacks are... Cute (u guess). It really had a 'Color Purple' feel to it. The owner seems nice and very hard working, hence the reason for my frequency. But at this point, I'm done. I may on occasion, go in for a beverage because I would like her to stay in business, but I will continue to go else where for my sweet tooth.

42.description: Best bakery on the South Side!All of their baked goods are homemade, NO corners cut what so ever. Often I have heard customers complain about the price(as in $4 for a lg lemon square) but that is because the owner/head baker uses REAL lemons, not lemon extract or some chemical sustitution. They have the traditional American favorites, such as chocolate chip cookies, brownies etc, but they are always adding new things to the menu. Special orders are most welcome with at least 48hrs notice. The only thing is that I wished they had the knowledge/skill for cake decorating, because it is really hard to find someone that is good at BOTH baking and decorating of speciality cakes.

23.description: Okay, since I'm expecting my first child, I have been watching my weight.However, I'm ordering cookies from here for my baby shower favors. So when I stopped in to place the order, you know I had to get a few sweet treats. I got my usual oatmeal cookies, always a favorite. I also wanted a lemon bar, but they weren't available. However, Miss Lenore did have lime bars, and of course I tried one. OMG, this thing is a religious experience! The graham crust so buttery that you don't have to chew, it just dissolves in your mouth. The lime is perfectly sweet and tart. As I type this, I'm licking my fingers because it's that good. I sliced a SMALL piece for my buddy at work to taste. His reaction? "GOOD GOD, this is good!" All I have to say to the guests attending the shower is  'YOU'RE WELCOME!"

31.description: I have been here twice, with my wife and baby son. Both times I have had excellent cupcakes! (Red Velvet) And the first time I got a free sample of the lime cookies, very good. So the second time back I was going to order some cookies to go, they weren't ready yet (we were there early 7:30 am approx.) BUT we should try the Lime Bar, so we got one of them and one Key Lime Pie to go...O my gosh..they are delicious..not sure of the calorie content...well heck I am sure...it is High....but they are good bakers at Give Me Some Sugah, and they are real nice people to chat with too, if you eat at the Bakery. Parking is easy on 71st Street, and the seating area is nice, they have coffee too, which is good. My wife liked everything she got. My son didn't eat anything, but liked the attention from the owners.

34.description: My aunt works at the travel agency next to this place, and she and all her little old lady travel agent friends have been singing its praises since it's opened. And when the little old ladies speak, I listen.  But for some reason, I've not had the chance or opportunity to go in.Finally, a couple of Saturdays my daughter and I decided to stop in after her ballet classes.  Unfortunately I wasn't all that impressed.  Maybe I just got the wrong thing. I got a caramel cake which was just ok.  Nothing more nothing less.  I think I'm spoiled by the caramel at Brown Sugar bakery, but I just couldn't get into the cupcake I had.  And neither could my three-year-old.  This cupcake tasted more like toffee.  Not so great (sorry).On a lighter note, my aunt said that I might just not have liked my cupcake, but I would love some of the other stuff on the menu, so we'll be back on Saturday.  I really want to like you, Give Me Some Sugah.  I really do.  Because I know the travel agents would never steer me wrong.  So let's just say that the last visit was on me, and next time we'll have a different experience.

16.description: The cupcakes are pretty decent for the most part, Im more of a Sprinkles girl. This place was my new best friend for a while, I had become addicted to the potato chip cookies w/ pecans. I was purchasing 3 at least twice a week. Eventually the cookies started tasting stale or very weird taste as if they were frozen and then unfrozen ( maybe). Anyways their new "Spinach country soup" is a must try . The soups are delicious w/ a side of cornbread $5.  Great value

11.description: Today I had plans to take my sister in law to gimme some sugar for brunch. I don't live in the area but the pastries and food are really good. I'm all for supporting small businesses especially black owned so when I have time on my off days I'll stop buy and pick up enough to last for a while.Anyway we came by the store around 10am, the door was open so we walked in. A few seconds later the owner/cook said that they were closed. I asked what time do you open? Some random guy said 11am. I said ok we'll be back in an hour.They seemed irritated but we looked past their lack of customer service and waited in the car until 11am. 11am came and we proceeded to go in but the bakery appeared to be closed. We walked towards the other side where food is served and there was the same guy sitting at a table with food and the owner arranging the table. He looked up and I mouthed to him through the window are you open and he said no. Wtf?!Now I understand if there is some type of private event going on but why wouldn't you tell us that the first time we stopped in? Advice to the owner..Good customer service goes a long way these day. Your customers are the reason why you stay in business. Treat each one with respect and they'll continue to come back and maybe tell their friends.

39.description: The first time that i went into this bakery, the smells overwhelmed me.. It was such a good aroma coming from the back that I just had to buy something.. I started to look at the prices and they seemed pretty reasonable.. I wanted something sweet and boy was I in for a treat. Ice cream, cookies, cakes galore... I bought two red velvet w/ cream cheese cakes, 2 key lime bars, a pecan brownie, and some peanut butter and butter cookies. As you can tell I racked up on sweets for a week or two. I highly suggest new comers to try it out!

37.description: This bakery is awesome. My friend and I walked in the front door and were greeted by the scents of butter and vanilla coming from the open kitchen...Mmmm.... There's a great selection of baked goods: cookies, mini cakes, cupcakes, brownies, cobblers, pies, and bar-type cookies. I tried the key lime bar (outstanding), the red velvet cupcake, and the vanilla cupcake with pineapple-coconut-cream cheese frosting (I know, right??). You can tell everything is made from scratch here, no boxed cake mixes masquerading as the real thing! The portions are very generous (the cupcakes alone are as big as your palm) and the prices are extremely reasonable--that huge cupcake I mentioned was only $2. Go early for the best selections, though the owner is constantly rolling out new treats. Stop by That-A-Burger down the street while you're in the 'hood.

0.description: I was in the South Shore neighborhood & needed a hearty meal. Stumbled upon Give Me Some Sugah Cafe & I must say that I was truly impressed. Since the weather was cold & rainy I had to try the Turkey Chili which came with the jalapeño cornbread muffins. The chili was very flavorful even had a little spice to it (I'm a sucker for spicy chili) & the jalapeño cornbread muffins had the light airy texture of a biscuit but the wholesome goodness of cornbread. All I can say is LOVED IT! Just b/c the young lady recommended the quiche special, I tried it. Citing that I like quiche but it seems to be a hit or miss dish. She smiled & stated I would love this b/c it's homemade. The results....they nailed it! The quiche was so succulent & again flavorful.  Now it was a tad bit pricey but it was well worth it! I can't wait to stop in again!

38.description: I had the fortune of meeting the owner through a co-worker and she invited me to the bakery.  She knew that I was interested in baking and made some amazing suggestions.  The bakery is decorated very simply, but don't let that scare you away.  Everything I tried was obviously made from scratch--real butter, real lemons, real eggs.  You will not find that disgusting "icing" that comes in a bucket.  The boyfriend and I bought lime cookies, a lemon bar and a red velvet cupcake.  I think he might have only eaten about 4 cookies because I took everything else!  Oops.  Everything was delicious and I will be back, even though it's nowhere near my house!  The only thing that I would suggest is offering coffee, lemonade, or bottled water to accompany the treats.Give Me Some Sugah is a wonderful addition to South Shore!

27.description: Great little shop with excellent prices. We had the German chocolate cake which was delicious! The cake was moist and not too crumbly or cakey like some German chocolate cake tends to be. I probably would have given a higher rating, but there was really no way to eat our treats in the shop. After the trek down to this location, we wanted to eat there, but the lady behind the counter seemed to discourage this even though there were a few small tables in the place.

32.description: 2 words: lime bars, 2 more words  HOT DAMN!!!!! THE GRAHAM CRACKER CRUST IS SO BUTTERY& THESE SISTERS ARE BAKING FROM SCRATCH! Saw one of the bakers skimming off the lime zest & the potato chip cookies are great.. cant wait until my next visit.. I will be sure to try the pineapple cheesecakes! I had to rationlize not going ape shit in this place.. sugar comas are not the business. & the owner is as sweet as the treats they serve

13.description: Caramel cupcake - 2/5Red velvet cupcake - 4/5Chocolate on chocolate cupcake 3/5Potato chip cookie (seems unfair to rate because it really wasn't my cup of tea.)Will I go back? On if I'm in the area, and chances of that are low.Overall experience, 3/5

24.description: I really like this place. I dream about the potato chip cookies and always try to buy a batch of 3 because one is just not enough. If only they would offer them dipped in chocolate I would be in cookie heaven! Another stand-out, the quiche. Delicious! I had the spinach quiche and it was filling, well seasoned and meat free. A great lunch time meal. I can't wait to try more treats!

7.description: This place also provides a full service breakfast and lunch menu.  Drive past Hyde park for more personable and friendly service.  The food is delicious too.

40.description: The Key Lime Pie is the truth!!!  I think that might be the most popular item there.  Real butter is used in all of the items and you can definitely taste it!  The cookies are great - ask for any that are coming right out of the oven.  :)  The ice cream is awesome as well, but is made by a company based in Blue Island.  Stop by when you get a chance.

30.description: All I have to say is, LIME BAR!  Their lime bars are excellent along with their mini key lime pie.  Can't wait to try other items.

1.description: This is a great place for a relaxed breakfast. We both ordered the pancake special (2 pancakes, 2 turkey sausage patties, and 2 eggs).  Perfect portions, nice light fluffy/spongy and great flavor to the pancakes. We also got the hot peaches for the pancakes (I suspect this is the same thing used for the filling of their cobbler...which if it is, their cobbler will be amazing!!!)They make their own sausage patties. Yum!  After breakfast, we stopped by the bakery counter and got some brownies for later in the day.  We will definitely go back to this place...its a neighborhood gem!

9.description: This place has some delicious sweets and the potato chip cookie will keep me coming back. It took a few visits before I was able to veer from it to try something else. And I have to say that the other sweet treats here are equally delicious. I also discovered that they sale soups and a few other food delights, i have yet to try them.but it is something to look forward to when I next return for my potato chip cookie. I will definitely be back to this cozy bakery.

26.description: I was really excited to try the potato chip cookie and the key lime bar after seeing the review on TV.  The key lime bar lived up to the hype on TV.  It was amazing.  The potato chip cookie did not.  It lacked flavor and was really greasy.  Overall, a great place with a cute decor.

25.description: OK i went there for the potato chip cookies got 6 of them ate 2 and wears the chips so i gave the others away it was a butter cookie with nuts wont be getting that again. my sis got one of the key lime bar and boy all she would say was mumumumumummmmmmmm with her eyes closed.

12.description: I honestly do not know how I found out about this bakery, but I am glad that I did! This bakery is close to me and for this reason, I must be biased and give an extra star for proximity (I find myself driving 30 minutes to the nearest decent bakery, so can you blame me?).So when I found out where this bakery was located, I jumped into my car and endured a refreshing two minutes of traffic to get there. I arrived near the closing time, so I did not try any  cafe or savory items. However, that does not matter because I came for the sweets. I bought a bunch or stuff and here's what I thought:Pineapple Cupcake:  Meh (Seriously I couldn't think of any other words to add to this)Vanilla Buttercreme Cupcake: The frosting was delish, but the cake was surprisingly dry.Key Lime Pie: Now here's where the magic happens, the key lime pie was amazing! Nice balance of limey flavor, sweet, and tartness! I devoured the crust! And it was reasonably priced.Pineapple Upside Down Cake: Om Nom! It was so good, I saved my last half for the next day and discovered my mom sneaking it to her room for "safekeeping." Maybe I caught the cupcakes on a bad day, but who cares? Every bakery has cupcakes. Come here for the Key Lime Pie and the Pineapple Upside Down Cake. The end.

21.description: I had a mini lemon pound cake with lemon buttercream frosting. This is the real deal, folks. Nothiing "light" about it. Yum. I ate about 1/4 and took the rest home. I hope to try a different goody every time I go in.Why no fifth star? Something in there made my eyes sting and my nose run. And no coffee, only (very special) herbal teas. I will consider this place carry out only for me, not sit down.The decor is very pleasant and it would be a lovely spot to sit a while if not for the eye burning thing.

17.description: This is my favorite bakery. It makes deserts that are soo.... GOOD. The prices are fair for the love I taste in the deserts. My family from around the country enjoy the deserts also. Enjoy,

10.description: We ordered breakfast here and it took forever to come out. Once our food arrived we had to wait for everyone else's food to arrive in order to eat at the same time. The oatmeal was served in a small coffee mug and filled halfway. There wasn't enough sugar or butter. It tasted dry. I was a regular at the bakery but I will not be returning.

5.description: My favorite comfort food is Chicken pot pie, This bakery makes the BEST I've ever had. Everything here is homemade in the kitchen that is visible to the customers. Its so family oriented and cozy. Its like the perfect "neighborhood spot" needed in this area! The cookies are also AMAZING.

35.description: Not bad... Expected more... But don't get me wrong very nice neighborhood bakery... I WILL PATRONIZE AGAIN

19.description: The potatoe chip cookies are unique and taste good. I was disappointed when I found pockets of cake that didn't quite get done in the red velvet cake I bought. Huge issue given the cake was $40. Not sure if I will purchase cakes from here again.

28.description: Mmm...lemon bars...Theirs are by far the BEST I've ever tasted. You know how it is when you take a bite of something and you can't think of anything else but the deliciousness in your mouth? Yeah. Also a big fan of their potato chip cookies - very light and buttery.They must lose a star based on their cupcakes, however. The frosting is absolutely amazing (on the pineapple coconut cream cheese & red velvet cupcakes), but the cake itself lacks that fluffy factor (I'll admit it, I've been spoiled by Sprinkles).

3.description: Sooo I had some of the country (?)soup. Verrrrrry verrrry good! It's turkey sausage, potatoes, spinach and garbanzo beans floating in all kinds of deliciousness! It's served with 2 big @$$ corn muffins. Go get some

33.description: My friend Camillia took me to this place. Aye, remember that song: That's What Friends Are For. Forget about the times she's loaned me money, never mind the transportation costs she covered while I was away in undergrad, don't even consider the time she saved my life--all of that ashens and pales in comparison to introducing me to Give Me Some Sugah. The rich and uncomplicated strawberry cheesecakes--are fresh. The savory potato chip cookies--are innovative. The silky and flavorful red velvet cupcakes--are pure cream cheese brilliance.  Give Me Some Sugah is a fresh, innovative, brilliant bakery. It is a pound of pleasure in a layer of love with a dozen cherries on top for all the muffin babies of the world.

43.description: Awesome.  I had been trying to hit this place ever since the grand opening was announced on yelp; I missed it that day, and had a habit of coming by whenever they closed (Monday and Sunday) .  Since it's practically right next to my house, I had to stop by - I try really hard to support local businesses in South Shore.  The chocolate cake is amazing - you can really tell they cut no corners.   Everything is made from scratch, and the price is right.  If you've got a real sweet tooth and you're looking for something really rich, though, I don't think it's a good bet.  For people like me, who like sweets but get headaches if they eat really rich stuff, the chocolate cake is perfect.  The cake itself is a little dry, but the strong chocolate taste in the icing made it worth it - and I'm usually one who leaves her icing.  And their cookies just melt in your mouth - really amazing.  The price is right, too: $3 for the mini chocolates cakes, and $4 for the german chocolate ones.  I plan to be back to try their red velvet cake.

2.description: Counters weren't as clean as I thought they should be for bakery (side eye) but the owner was there really sweet enjoyed the cookies thanks again

18.description: I had a mini lemon pound cake with lemon buttercream frosting. This is the real deal, folks. Nothiing "light" about it. Yum. I ate about 1/4 and took the rest home. I hope to try a different goody every time I go in.Why no fifth star? Something in there made my eyes sting and my nose run. And no coffee, only (very special) herbal teas. I will consider this place carry out only for me, not sit down.The decor is very pleasant and it would be a lovely spot to sit a while if not for the eye burning thing.

41.description: This place is very good.  I usually buy a chocolate cupcake with sour cream (cream cheese?) icing.  The best cupcake I've ever had. Doubt there's a better one in the city.Very high quality.  Worth the price.

4.description: We love this neighborhood jewel. Not a fan of the cupcakes but the cookies and key lime bars are the best!

6.description: Yummy is the first word that comes to mind when I think of this place!I'm so lucky to have it in my neighborhood although I haven't visited as much as I would like...I keep saying bad Tonya bad, so I have made up in my mind I will be back more often!The place is clean and the staff "Amazing"Red Velvet is my guilty pleasure when I come here!  If you know "Red" you know everyone can't do it justice!  Well they do! I have heard by many other people that many of their cakes are so good that it will make you forget your diet!They also serve cookies and pies and I haven't tried them yet but I will!I pinky swear I will be back!

22.description: I may be addicted to their caramel cake. It was so good, I got one for my befriends bday and it was soo good. We can't wait to get back and try the peach cobbler.

15.description: Love love love the potato chip cookies.   There are other bakeries closer to my house but they are not anywhere as tasty as this place.  I have liked everything here except maybe the banana pudding.

20.description: Yummy is the first word that comes to mind when I think of this place!I'm so lucky to have it in my neighborhood although I haven't visited as much as I would like...I keep saying bad Tonya bad, so I have made up in my mind I will be back more often!The place is clean and the staff "Amazing"Red Velvet is my guilty pleasure when I come here!  If you know "Red" you know everyone can't do it justice!  Well they do! I have heard by many other people that many of their cakes are so good that it will make you forget your diet!They also serve cookies and pies and I haven't tried them yet but I will!I pinky swear I will be back!

8.description: The pastries and cakes are all professionally prepared and they taste like it. From the pecan pies to the walnut chocolate chip cookies and chicken pot pie. They melt in your "mouth.

14.description: I was so happy to find a bakery in my neighborhood finally. But was disappointed with my purchases.The key lime bar is very good. The carmel and red velvet cupcakes were not horrible but definitely not good. I will not purchase those again.I do my best to suppose local and small business and will go back for the key lime bar. I know they opened an additional seating area to serve sandwiches and will go back and give them another opportunity.

3.description: I just came in for some ice!!!People, watch out, there are some really sticky fingers here.I don't eat meat, but rellegedly you can get ice at this establishment. I walked in and was dryly greeted by the cashier, Amanda. I wanted ice, which they were unsure if they had. Upon further confirmation from the manager ( who was nice, btw) he ran to get it. I also ordered coffee for a friend. " Your total is $2.51. Would you like to donate a $1 for research with children with cerebral palsy?"" No. You  know most of the money goes to administration, right?""We give all our money to them." She (Amanda) said this with an attitude, like I thought she stole. I was just informing her that when you give a dollar, only like .20 gets to where it needs to go." I was just saying that not all the money goes where it's supposed to, I was just being informative, not trying to argue." At this I make a weird face, like..ok...I hand her a $20 bill and watch her take out the change and close her drawer" $17.49 is your change" With this she proceeds to give me the money in a folded wad, with the receipt in the middle. I always count my change, but now I'm really going to do it because you just aroused suspicion.I unwad the change and count 7 dollar bills...um..." You gave me $7"She hands me the $10 bill that was sitting near her drawer. Naw Amanda...you cant pull that with everyone. I didn't have the energy or patience to start anything, but don't let my boho dress and natural hair fool you. I'm from the South Side....Of course, like any seasoned thief, she showed no remorse and was not apologetic about trying to steal my money. I guess she was going to give it to the kids with cerebral palsy?I already did my bk experience survey and hope someone reads this...I was so upset about it, I told everyone I knew that day about it....You should check your change anyway, but now I have to be even more careful. Sad.

1.description: This has to be THE WORST Burger King I have ever been to in life. On the way back to Chicago from class, I decided to stop here to grab something to eat for a friend and I; the foolishness that followed was uncanny. First problem - Trying to order was a complete hassle. I couldnt understand her and clearly she couldnt understand me. NO, I DONT WANT WHATEVER SANDWICH YALL ARE FEATURING!!! "Are you sure you dont want that?" Um, if its what I wanted I would ORDER IT!!!!! There wasnt too much louder I could yell before I risked going hoarse. She spoke extremely unprofessional and it annoyed the bejesus out of me.Second problem - Yep. Order was wrong when they reread it to me at the window. There is no reason two meals shouldve been the price of FOUR of them. Get it together! Glad I didnt hand them my card right away.Third problem - Okay, I only ordered two different chicken sandwiches, but was told to pull to the front of the restaurant and wait for my order. WTF? CHICKEN SANDWICHES!!!!! What were they doing?? Killing, bleeding, and plucking the chicken themselves??! Fine, I pulled around to the front.Fourth and BIGGEST problem - I sat in the front for TEN MINUTES! TEN!!!!! As I was about to get out of the car and go bam on the door like an idiot, the manager walks to the door and happens to notice that I am still sitting out in front and looks shocked. He walks back and another worker walks out with him, with my bag, looking rather "empty." There were only sandwiches. I ORDERED MEALS!!!!! She was like "Oh, I aint know that." *sigh* So I had to wait another FIVE MINUTES to get my order. Then she wants to ask what song I was listening to in the car because she had never heard it and liked it. TRAMP, GIMME MY FOOD!!!!!!If I could give them ZERO stars with a finger up the butt, I would. HMPH!

0.description: "May I take your order?""Hi, I'd like one large order of hashbrowns, please.""Will that complete your order?""Yes.""That will be $20.82.""Oh, I think you added my hashbrowns to the last customer's order.  I just ordered hashbrowns.""Okay, that will be $1.69 plus tax, please pull up."The drive way for this Burger King, it so happens, is closed by a fence, so there's no way to get out unless you can convince the line of cars behind you to back out one by one, starting from the end.  I wait sixteen minutes, and suddenly there's a man at my window."What's the problem?""Huh?""You seem like you have a problem.""Oh, I'm just pissed Burger King is taking so long for hashbrowns.""Oh, see, I thought you had a problem with me.""Uh, no.""I saw you tapping your dashboard, and I wasn't sure if you were going with the music or if you were angry.""I was bopping to the music for a little while, then I got impatient.  But not with you.""All right.  See, I thought you was getting angry at me, while I was waiting for the bus.  Be careful around this neighborhood.  People will get the wrong idea.""This is my neighborhood.""You from Chicago?""I live in the Southside.""Oh, you mean Hyde Park.""No, I mean the southside.  Right around the corner.""Where?""Over between [insert street] and [insert street.]"Really?  Which building?""I'm not telling you where I live.""I was just trying to be helpful, is all.  Better be careful around here.""All right, thanks."Another ten minutes pass.  Driver of the car in front of me is yelling at cashier.  Several exchanges of money take place.Finally, I pull up. "I am SO sorry for the problem.  I gave your hashbrowns to that guy ahead of you.  It'll be just a moment.Five minutes pass."So what exactly is the problem?""Oh, it's nothing, we just need to get the fryer started again.""Okay.  May I pay while I'm waiting.""Sure.  That will be $20.82.""Uh, I just ordered hashbrowns.""Right, and we're working on the rest of your order.""Just hashbrowns!"*incredulous smile*"One moment.  All right, $1.87."*five minutes later*"All right!  Here you go.  Enjoy!"My hashbrowns were, of  course, stone cold and stale.All junk food places should be like this.  I'd be skinny.

2.description: Extremely disappointed in the service. This BK recently remodeled. They needed to remodel the service. Last night  I order two custom sandwiches.  I was charged extra for my changes. I knew I should have checked. Well, when I got home I had two sandwiches that I didn't order. One I don't even like. So I paid extra for sandwiches that I didn't want. I tried to call but no one answered. So here I am on social media.  I am also calling in customer service.

5.description: This was the rudest BK I have ever been too.  I couldn't really see the menu so I asked them to hold one second and the the voice that came over the intercom said sure but don't take all day. My friend and I decided to add to our order and the cashier went and got her manager who told us sorry but he couldn't do that because it was ten cars behind us when there were only two, we would have pulled to the side walked in anything but he didn't offer us a solution just told us NO so we ended up not purchasing anything.  I will never go to this BK again you can count on that even if they were giving away something for free...customer service is just as important as Food Quality!

6.description: This place is the pits. I was waiting for my car to be serviced down the street so I walked over with my kids. The manager, Nicholette paused in her other nonexistent duties to take my order. "Can I have a number 7 and 2.....?" She walks off. Comes back. That will be $4.27.  "I wasn't finished." "Oh, well I asked what you wanted." "Yea, but then you walked off in the middle of the order. I wanted two croissant sandwiches and two oj's."  She stands there staring at me. "That's all."  She continues to stare. "Are you sure, because I'm not adding anything else to my register."  "Yep, that's it."  Then I wait 12 minutes while she talks shit to the cashier, rolls her eyes at her and berates her for not being able to cash out the register. I watch someone else's food sit on the bare counter and vow never to eat fast food again. The girl making the food came to help and began touching the register and went back to touching the food. I took the kids in the bathroom to wash their hands and.....just don't. This place is filthy all over.

7.description: The service at this place is SLOW.  That's just it.  SLOW.  Not only did we wait 12 minutes for our food to served, the food wasn't good.  It tasted like someone ran over my sausage sandwich with their car.  Yuck.  The coffee used to be good.  Now they use Seatlle's Best.  That's great for Seattle's Best but their coffee used to taste better than that.  It used to have a strong 'coffee' taste to it, now it's just watered down.  Not good. The coffee has a totally different taste than it used to and I like it the old way.  Not all Burger King's are like this.  Most of the ones I've been are slow BUT the food is delicious.  Not at this one.  Avoid it if you can.

8.description: So before I call corporate, I just thought I'd let the world know how AWEFUL some of your stores are. No gloves, touching food with bare hands that they just touched money with... buns sprawled all over the place. Dirty towels just sitting around near food.... can we say cross contamination? The manager is some young punk with hickies all over his neck and the staff is just pathetic. I asked about the cinnabuns which looked as though they had been sitting out for day... they told me they weren't making anymore that they would take 30-40mins to make. o__O. The fridge is always left swinging open as well as the freezer door for the fries. Also the grease is never clean. Although some of the have gloves on, they still go around touching a BUNCH of other crap and THEN back to touching food. How unsanitary?!? The next time I go in there I'll have a health inspector with me... That Burger King needs to be shut down. No one should have to wait 12 minutes on nuggets and fries. If the staff wasn't so busy gossiping about one of their co-workers got jumped yesterday by customers, maybe they could handle the task that are given. I an HIGHLY upset. I understand it's fast food, but that doesn't mean that staff should be rude nor does it mean that my food should be contaminated with germs from their weave since they don't have a hair net on.... or contaminated by metals and cash from staff touching food and then touching money and back to food. I'll be posting video very soon.

9.description: I'm saying, I got my Whopper, and it was delish. It's fast food, hell, I don't expect to get Gibson's treatment. I'm sure my intestines was EFFEN miserable after I ate it, but wth, I was craving it and I had been on a vodka binge.

10.description: fast food is fast food is fast food...came in forf my niece..and I saw a manager that was beautiful!! So I had to google the number....and I spoke with him directly...order was correct, my niece smashed and I got the #### ..needless to say my experience was awesome....lol...

4.description: I wanted to give this place half a star. This place is horrible, service is bad and the manager was nasty and rude. The food is nasty and the manager told me I could not add to my order when I got to the window, after tasting the food I'm thinking he did us a favor. Will never go back to this burger king again

3.description: What a wonderful place! Mr. Bijou is so funny and friendly-he and his family are very good at accommodating the customer. I called ahead on Monday and got a Saturday appointment. When I arrived, they were ready for me. Two of his daughters did my hair and they were very polite the entire time. The prices listed on the wall were accurate. If you have been to a place that changes the price based on any number of factors (hair length, thickness, etc.) you can appreciate this. It took a bit longer than I expected, but it was worth the time because they dipped my braids a few times in hot water and put a soothing hot towel on my head which helped a lot. My head isn't even sore today and I doubt I'll have those tiny bumps I had before. If I decide to get twists again, I'll definitely go back!

1.description: Ok, where are my ladies? I must say how the hell do you tolerate the pain from hair braiding. I've worn locks for 5 years and never experienced this much pain. OMG! Now back to the review. This shop is clean but not top notch. It looks to be a family owned business and everyone were really nice. I have short hair so the owner suggested that I get box braids. The cost was $160.00 plus a five dollar credit card fee. I had 4 people working on my head and my oh my did that hurt. Overall my hair looks very neat and every strain in place. If you're use to head pain and want to look cute come here. I recommend taking pain pills b4 and after. LOL! THANKS SO MUCH TO THE WHOLE STAFF!

2.description: Loved, loved, loved my experience at Bijou's! I had the most miserable, unimaginable experience another African hair braiding place... well her apartment... the day before so I felt defeated and unsure I would be able to get my Senegalese twists as planned. I told a friend about my issue and she immediately recommended Bijou's. I looked them up online and gave them a call. It was a Saturday evening around 6pm. Bijou answered and we discussed what I wanted to get done including the size, length and cost of the Senegalese twists. She said she could start at 930 or 10am the next day - on Sunday! I had a tight schedule and really wanted to get them done, but I told her I needed to be done by 2pm so that seemed unrealistic. She agreed. But she then said she would arrive a little early at 9am for me and have two braiders work on my head so long as no other walk-ins or appointments showed up. Bet.On Sunday, I arrived on time and she was already there waiting for me. We discussed again what I wanted now that we were in person and could review pictures. I started to feel like maybe larger sized Senegalese twists are soooo difficult for folks to agree to style, but thankfully she installed one sample twist on my head that I liked and we got started at 9:30am. Bijou and Francis worked extremely quickly. Other than the fact that my head was being tugged in different directions, the installation was relatively painless (unlike that crazy lady on Saturday who thought I would let her rip all my hair out with her tight handedness!! Excuse the rant.) Part way through, two gentlemen, one was Bijou's son, started to twist on my head too. I was like ummmm, what's happening?? Four folks were working on my head at the same time. I didn't verbally say anything but I guess my expression was enough because Francis chimed in to explain that once the two ladies had started the twists halfway down, the two guys would follow up and complete them... Senegalese twists are super long after all. Cool. Never had four folks work on my head at the same time. What did it feel like? Beautiful chaos! I kid you not, my hair was completely twisted by 12pm! That's just 2.5 hours after they had started! The last hour from 12-1pm was just Francis trimming the excess hairs down each twists, securing the ends in hot water and spraying my scalp and hair. I was absolutely amazed at the quality of work they did and the speed. Obviously this expedited time frame is not normal if you only have 1 person on your head, but boy did I appreciate their focus on getting me in and out of the salon on time! I would absolutely recommend Bijou to everyone. They are efficient, friendly and fair.I paid $180. There's street parking. Bijou gives out $10 off referral cards.

5.description: So worth the trip! Was just passing through Chicago because of moving for work and the stress of driving from California to the east was really taking a toll on my hair. Knowing that I would be in the city for a couple of days, I decided to give them a call. I called a day before reaching the city and Bijou was Very Accommodating!!! She and her family came in on their Mother's day just for me, so that I could get back on the road. The shop was clean and she even braided my daughters hair in the short amount of time I was there. The price is well worth it!!!! I got senegalese twists and had multiple people (4 - all family members) braiding my hair at a time, which definitely cut the length of time. I got the size, length, and fullness I wanted and any questions or complaints I had about tightness, thickness or length was addresses right then.  She even recommended a few products to help reverse the damage caused by the stress of moving. They did a couple of samples before starting to ensure I would be satisfied.  They do have a couple of rules like, no children unless they are being serviced (she still allowed my kids), paying upfront (after showing the samples and ensuring you are happy of course) and getting back to them within 24 hours to address any issues with the completed product, plus a few others (good business practices, in my opinion). She gave me a few business cards offering $10 off of any service and I get $10 off if my name is mentioned on my next visit. Bijou and her family were the most professional braiders I have seen in a while and I will definitely be going back during any of my travels to the area. I will definitely be recommending Bijou to anyone else I know that is going to be in the area as well. THANK YOU BIJOU!!!!

6.description: I'm new to Chicago and was clueless as to the best place to go get micros. After a massive 3-week long search, I came across a listing for Bijou online in yahoo business pages. I decided to step out on faith and give them a try. I called a week in advance to make my appt and spoke with Bijou. I told her what I wanted and she stated the price for micros starts at $160 and goes up depending on how full, or long you want them, etc. So, on my appt day, I arrive on time, Bijou is there ready and waiting. She assessed my hair--which is fairly short, and advised that for me, the cost would be $200. I thought the price was fair. She let me take a look at the hair, asked if I was interested in certain colors...I chose black and we got started. The place was very clean. Bijou was very nice, attentive to me as her customer, made sure I didn't get a ticket if I parked by the meters, and listened when I expressed concern with how I wanted my hair to look. She was very patient with me as well, as I have a very sensitive scalp and she tried her best to be gentle. We got started about 9:20am and right at 3pm, I was walking out of there. I am used to micros being done in 3hrs where I come from, but I must say, it was a breeze and it did not seem like I was there for 6 hours. Oh, and my hair is ridiculous!! I mean that in a good way...it is so neat and very very tiny! I absolutely love my hair and I have gotten so many compliments on it. My husband loves it too so that's a plus. Also, the hair used is very good hair, it is very shiny, soft, and does not tangle; very easy to manage. Before I left, Bijou gave me some  business cards and offered me a 10$ discount for referrals. I have already made plans to take my daughter in to get braids and I've informed my best friend who also wears braids from time to time. Bijou definitely has a customer for life! I will go back again. Another plus, she was sure to address me by my name very often. I think that's important! And she made sure to let me know she appreciated my business and that she welcomes it again...and she will get it!

0.description: This is the best braiding shop in the entire city. Everyone is very polite the shop is very clean. The braiding is top notch. Give them a try. I am sure you will feel the same way.

4.description: I called and made appointment for mid back Senegalese twist. The lady told me 150 and up. I thought that seemed okay. Then I walked into the store and I walked up to the manager. As I was about to talk to the woman she pulled her boob out and started breastfeeding her baby! I thought it was so weird because I didnt know her and she had her boob out in front of me!Then I asked how long for mid-back senegalese twist and she said $250! RIDICULOUS. So I left and went to Fatou which is about two blocks away where I only paid 180. I think she was trying to trick me because I look so young (Im only fifteen). The lady was kinda rude too because I made a face when she told me.Just make sure they offer you a reasonable price...

3.description: This place is a cool place to hang out from time to time. The crowd is very casual and they serve food late night (bonus). Now the drinks and the bartenders are hit and miss.. sometimes they are great sometimes they are not (including folks attitudes).. and like I always say.. a dayum shame when people are trying to spend money and can't!$6 grey goose cocktails (I think on Fridays).. that always sweetens the deal.

1.description: This place is certainly not a spot I personally recommend like "hey let's go to Red's", BUT I will come here every now and again with my friends who frequent it often. It's an old school, chill spot. There's a DJ, TVs, cheap drinks and fried food. The bartenders aren't the most attentive nor do they make the best drinks, but if you keep your order simple it's fine. They have drink specials on certain nights, but I think they switch them up often so be sure to ask first.

2.description: The only reason I didn't give Red's 4 stars is because the drinks are a bit on the expensive side and if you don't buy a drink you can't sing karaoke!!!Other than that I had a ball and I enjoyed myself with family and friends with the neighborhood friendly atmosphere!

5.description: Just a couple of days ago (10/5/12) was my first time ever here (newby to Chicago) and it was A-Ok. I will not be rushing to get back here anytime soon.

6.description: Nice place to hang but the regular bartender there with the natural hair is mean as hell. For some reason she hates me and is very load. I payed and tipped her on a soda that was $2. She gave me the smallest glass and never came back once to see if I would order another drink. Other than her the place is real cool. Food is good and it all depends on your bartender how good the drink be. I would visit more if I knew when the natural haired chick was not working.

7.description: This is an oldy but goody.  Red's have been a go to spot of mine's and my best friend since college.  This isn't the place to "drop it like it's hot", but if you are looking for great cocktail with great conversation this is it.  This is a come as you are (most nights) place and you feel free to talk to your neighbor.  I'm getting thirsty just thinking about it.

0.description: Their long islands were great and the fish fillets were seasoned perfectly and hot.  I like the grown and sexy cowd . Going to be back soon.

4.description: This place is a good spot if want to socialize, have a drink and watch a game. This is a place for the mid 30s and older.. Im going to have to come back when the DJ is on site. Im giving it 3 stars bc the men's bathroom wasnt clean. I think as a business owner you should ALWAYS keep a clean bathroom. I can say the bartender did make good drinks but keep it simple bc there isnt a drink menu. The drinks were abt $9 but not sure how much a glass of wine and beer cost. We will be back.

0.description: Love this boutique and the owners, Lona and Lily!  I have a hard to find shoe size, and I have found many great brands and styles there.  It's such a cute space, and is also a great place to host a shoe party for the girls. If you have a pampered pooch, this is the place to be!  You'll find the most adorable coats, collars and other dog accessories.

3.description: Terrible delivery service. Ordered at 7:10, delivery scheduled for 8:20. Rescheduled for 8:50. Didn't come until 9. Took the food and realized they got the order completely wrong. Ordered 3 steak burritos with avocado and chips and guacamole. Only got one burrito and it wasn't even steak. Called back and they said I'd have to wait another whole hour until the driver made his rounds, when the food would be ice cold. Wouldn't even offer a refund until I demanded one. Only reason for 2 stars is because food and price is decent. Will not order again.

1.description: Our order was 3 steak tacos 3 chicken and ground beef nachos and steak burrito. I'd only order the steak burrito again. It had the best flavor.Ground beef was disgusting no flavor whatsoever, the have huge chunks of potatoes in the beef that make you think is lumps of coagulated grease.The chicken was very bland they gave you huge chunks of bland chicken. The steak was okay it was the best if I ever went back I'd only get steak .The tacos are very dry me an the kids choked, they don't offer anything with the tacos like a sauce or sal

2.description: innam completely dissatisfied with this place! I ordered two steak tacos and a steak fajita dinner from using grubhub. My food arrived an hour after the estimated arrival time, needless to say my food was COLD! Biting into my taco the meat was really chewy and I couldn't swallow it. The meat was really hard and old looking, as well as the rice! I don't ever have to eat here again.

9.description: This is the best carry out Mexican food I've had. Friendly staff and quick service. This could put Pepes out of business in South Shore!! Make sure you bring cash because no cards are accepted.

10.description: Great service. The girl behind the counter was really nice. Food was good. Was able to call in and it was ready when I arrived. Definitely will be back

4.description: They have the freshest tacos on the south side. They use fresh avocado , pico de gallo, queso fresco instead of the usual processed mozzarella cheese that's found at surrounding places, grilled tilapia is excellent... The meat is real and everything is made to order... But the prices are very reasonable and they're open late which is a huge plus

6.description: Great food with cheap prices! Flash Taco serves up the best chicken specialty burritos ever!!

12.description: We loved the tacos and housemade salsa (both kinds)! We will definitely be back. So glad to have something like this in South Shore.

5.description: Whack  ass business. Cold tacos, no supreme nachos, long ass wait for no reason and really to cheap to accept credit cards? I will make the journey to Pilsen for good tacos before i come back here.

13.description: Finally, authentic tacos have been brought to south shore! Flash taco is delicious,  pretty legit.

11.description: Unfortunately you cannot call in an order because their phone number rings a few times then goes into voice mail. I tried 3 times and left messages with no return call. Food is good, but a long wait if you have to walk-in and order.

8.description: Terrible. ..I ordered supreme nachos..it came with just nachos cheese  and meat...Nothing supreme  about it...no lettuce..no tomatoes...just nachos cheese and meat..mind u they charge u by the level of your nachos...instead  of veggie   nachos they sent me veggie tacos. ..the fish tacos that I ordered  did come but the presentation of the tacos were terrible ..cold...and slopped together. ...needless to say I spent 60 bucks on my employees and i felt cheated..last time spending my hard earned there!!!

0.description: Years ago I'd been to Flash Taco in Wicker Park once or twice and always thought it wasn't too good compared to other taco places. I live in South Shore now and there are no taco joints close that I know of. So I figured I'd give Flash one more shot in the new location. Had a couple of tacos - carnitas and el pastor - and the verdict is....not bad! Tacos came out in 3-4 minutes and at tasted fresh. It's no Supermercado La Internacional, but hey I'll take a decent taco place in South Shore. Knocked off a star for the annoying cash only.

7.description: Oh noooooo, here's to a business that attempted to bring i think "Mexican" food to a corner in this South Shore neighborhood that has only a few good resturants beyond the common Submarine joints but I'm sorry to say that, considering the culture of the residents in this community, I can imagine WE like good foods and therefore this place may not make it beyond the new year! Yuck yuck yuck. WTF! Not to return. The food taste like, diabetic leftovers.

3.description: Visited this shop today for the first time and my experience was very pleasant. The stylist that I saw was Zelda who is absolutely amazing and her chair side manner is wonderful. I will definitely be booking with Zelda into the summer..

1.description: The only reason why I'm giving this place 2 stars because my stylist individually was the bomb.When I got my hair done here, there was a young lady with a short blonde cut on the left side. I can't remember her name (below will tell the story) but she did a phenomenal job... still used barrel irons (which I loved) and my hair lasted forever. I had a sew in and she did a wash and style for 65$. I was planning on scheduling another appointment for a bob but until today. I had been referring people to this salon over and over. This time, my mother needed a new place to go. She's older and has a lot of questions. She called the salon and the receptionist was beyond rude to the point of my mother, the sweetest lady in the world, calling me cursing about her horrible experience and how the receptionist was rude, nasty and wouldn't answer simple questions, like "is a specific stylist still working there?" I'm confused, as I've recommended black senior leaders at my job to the shop, called the salon because this is also my brand. The receptionist was even more rude to me, I had to wait a good five minutes (after getting interrogated) to speak to the owner. After speaking to the owner, she was calm and listened. She only finished with a "Thank you for letting me know," and we hung up.I think it's so beautiful that black businesses are doing so well that a rude receptionist can lose potential clients/money and they can be just fine with it. Hats off to you sis, your next venture should be teaching a business course at Harvard focusing on how in 2015 first point of contacts no longer represent the brand.
