2.description: I've been a client of Angie's for over 20 years. I love the experience I have going to get my hair done. The environment is clean and the clientele and other stylist are very friendly. If you are looking to get an awesome hairstyle in a warm, friendly, and professional environment, then Angie's Hair Salon is definitely for you!

9.description: I went to Angie's for 2 months and there were a few things I didn't like. First off, if your appointment is at 10am, expect to spend the half the day there because they will book 20 people under that same time slot. The waiting time is crazy. Then once I've waited for 6hrs after my wash & dry then it takes only 15-20min to style my hair. I thought to myself damn, something so simple it takes almost 7hrs  to complete. It's crazy to wait that long for a simple wash and press!!!!

10.description: I scheduled an appointment with Paulette at 4 pm on a Thursday. She was very professional and pleasant on the phone.  I arrived about 20 minutes early. I was informed that she wasn't there yet. No big deal since I was early. At about 4:15, I inquired about my appointment. Another stylist, who was pleasant as well, informed me that I was next to be shampooed. At about 4:30, a rude shampoo girl came over and asked who I was there for. I told her Paulette and she said OK then walked away. At 4:45,  I was still waiting along with two other clients with no word from the stylist or the shampoo girl. At 4:50, I grabbed my coat and left. Everyone in the salon watched me walk out of the door without a word. No one ever contacted me to apologize or reschedule. I live in Evanston and I only drove all the way out there because I heard such good things about the stylist. After my experience, I would not recommend her to anyone.

4.description: Prior to finding Angie's salon on Instagram in September 2014, my hair was very brittle and limp. HOWEVER, now after six months my hair is healthy and long. I would definitely recommend my stylist, Regina, to anyone with short and long hair!

6.description: My stylist has always been Shaleah, and I love coming here! The salon has a fun atmosphere, everyone is very friendly and informative, and the architecture is flawless.  They offer a few TVs while you wait, and once you are in the chair, service is FAST! Went in for a color after getting my hair trimmed and Shaleah once again did a fantastic job! This location is also convenient for me to drive to, which is a big plus.

12.description: did a great job on my daughters damaged hair!!!!!! i am now a fan great service.

5.description: I have lived here for over seven years, an I have run into plenty of hair stylist, but never anyone like Ray. She is personal, on time, did an excellent job on my hair and very patient. She took the time to explain what and why this would be best for  my hair. Although, the salon is not in the best area Angie's hair salon is clean and the other hair stylist are great as well. You may come in feeling down, but leaving feeling like a million dollars. I must say my experiences here has been great. Thanks

11.description: It's so refreshing to find a classy salon where the staff/owner are friendly and they do good work.  I was very pleased with my hair and the overall service.  I'm definitely planning on becoming a regular.

8.description: First visit review:My stylist was Zelda. I went for shampoo, flat iron and hot oil treatment. Left the salon with bouncy, curly and healthy looking hair. Zelda was an excellent stylist, not overly talkative, but very personable. She took time to get to know me and my hair, particularly preference to style and home care routine. My hair is natural and it was great that she did not use too many or too much product...I didn't even have to tell her! The best part I booked same day and I was in and out in less than 1.5 hrs....no overbooking (I may be a southern belle, but I hate waiting)!!The salon itself is very nice, the music is not blasted, and the stylist keep conversation at a nice professional level. It felt very professional and quiet despite several stylists and customers. There was no yelling across the salon or gossiping. There are plenty of dryers so u don't have to wait with wet hair!! Salon provides a large and comfy waiting area. Beautifully decorated with an open floor plan. My only con is that on line booking is available and credit cards are accepted, but you have to double check with each stylist first. There is a beautiful front desk area, but no one is there to greet you or check u in.Overall, this a diamond in the rough! A modern, professional salon that's probably overlooked because of it's area. Quality work at a great price.Pls note I did go on a Thursday afternoon.

0.description: Not only is the owner awesome, personally she rocks as a stylist. Each stylist within her salon reflects her personality and spiritual growth. They are very passionate about hair and innovative with the latest styles and product... been a faithful customer for literally 20yrs.

7.description: Great place to go for your hair appointments. I have had Jamila as a stylist for about two years. She takes great care of my hair. Saturdays are pretty busy so I usually try to go during the week in order to be in and out in about 2 hours. All of the stylist are very nice ladies and the salon is very clean!

1.description: This business is a true diamond in the rough. Located in the lower level of the Bridgeport art center. If you are into a  Love Jones poetry feel this is the place to be. Book a party or stop in on one of their open mic nights. You are sure to have a blast. The owners are very kind and easy to work with.

2.description: I have been going to Spokenword Lounge for a few weeks now. I say go on a Friday. The Saturday set closes at  12 a.m (Even though it's advertised as closing at 2 a.m) and this set really doesn't have a lot of people. Now when we went on Friday, it was it was a different set (6/14/13) and the d.j was everything, poets were cool, Saturday has the best poets. There is a $10 dollar cover at the door. I asked the owner about that because on the youtube page, it said that ladies were free until 10 p.m ... I think he said it depends on the set. There is a big free parking lot which is fab! The owner and his wife Trina are super nice! The setting is dim, a couple of couches, and chairs. Nice size venue. Going to the bathroom is hilarious (very long and lonely hallway that makes you feel like you're going to get snatched by a killer), the exposed brick and big steel colored doors remind you of an old 90s movie. Drinks are cool. But I would def. request one of Trina's famous strawberry margarita's! They will get you right and they are delish! They play house music for the last 2 hours of the set, which is cool. This place is truly a hidden gem. The only suggestion I would make, is making it dimmer. And the projector thing behind the poet when they are reading, completely throws me off. It's because of the colors. Please switch the colors to darker ones. I would love for it to be as dark as possible in there. The owner makes me feel really safe. Safest I've ever felt in a public nightlife experience. I like it. There's a lady who sells some of the best smell goods I've ever smelt in my life, I wish she could set up inside the reading, I don't like her sitting in the hallway,she's so nice!

0.description: Man...I was so shocked. Great music, great vibe, great experience. The live music was on point and the DJ was fantastic. Loved everything.

3.description: This Walgreens have too many "don't have". I'm the type of person who wakes up at 2:00am with a craving and acts on it. I expect for my local store to have it in stock. For example this Walgreens have been out of the Hershey's with almonds and red sour patch straws for a minute and every time I'm always wondering when they will have them in stock. Also, ladies hold tight to your purses because its this crazy black dude who stands outside the Walgreens as a fixture and he's says "lady I don't mean no harm but can you spare me some change." Why do they allow this man to stand out there like that? Then u have the guy who want to run up on you & sell you bootlegs. It's too much going on, the only thing this store has going for them is the fact they're open 24hrs & the cashiers are cool

1.description: Great place wish my photos print a little more clearer. Also they need more cashiers especially when you only want to run in and out and you have to wait in line forever. Need to make sure their freezers are stocked every time I come it's empty.

2.description: The worst monotone customer services ever. When you're sick, the last thing you have energy for is playing games and bad service. 3 weeks ago, I suffered a very long and severe asthma attack. My physician wrote 3 prescriptions and they only filled one because they didn't care for the notes that my doctor wrote on 2 of them for me to aid me with special instructions and dosage.The twangy broken English alone is more than enough to drive away the customers

5.description: A nice clean Walgreens Store

0.description: I have been coming to this Walgreens for many years and I have to say they have made many improvements.  When the line is long they quickly say I see 3 which means there are more than 3 people in line I believe...now sometimes its more like 5 people but they do open up another line or send you to the camera department or the cosmetic department.They have the items that are on sale and if they don't you can get a raincheck! Now, I know that is every Walgreens but the staff is friendly and helpful.  I have seen staff members in the past act as if they didn't want to be there and I was an inconvience for asking for a raincheck!The pharmacy department and staff is great and I wish I knew the young lady's name that always seems to be there when I'm there but she is sweet and funny...and although she doesn't remember my name she remembers my face and she is always smiling...The only problem I have is the panhandlers standing outside the door but other than that I am pleased with this location!

4.description: I mean, it's a drug store. But still, I expect better. The cashiers are indifferent and only acknowledge your presence long enough to grab your money. There's one woman who works here whose name I can't recall that is a sweetie pie! The parking lot is a zoo 24/7. I only come here for basics or cash back from my debit card other wise I go to family dollar.

1.description: You say that you close at 6pm, so why are the doors locked at 5:30pm. Thanks for making me drive over for nothing.

0.description: This is one of the smaller Gamestops but the staff is so friendly and helpful that I keep coming back!I'm not a big gamer, Heck I still have my PS2 but I still find some great games to play at this location!When I upgrade to PS3, lol I will still come here!

1.description: Basic nail salon in South Shore where you can get a quick mani/pedi done. You can also get facial waxing and eyelashes... if you are into those services.  Some technicians are better than others, be prepared for a wait and a $1 charge if you use a debit or charge card.

2.description: I come here often because there in my neighborhood, they do an excellent job each & every time. I have had acrylics, pedi's, mani's, eyebrow waxes etc & I have never left disappointed. Every technician in here is that good. While it's a lil cramp & not spa like, its a very good nail salon & always packed anytime of day so that should say a lot.

0.description: So everyone who gets their nails|feet done knows the struggle of getting a really good service somewhere, and then not being able to go back because you move, your person left, etc. Since moving to the South Shore area I was a bit skeptical on getting a pedicure at a new place because my last place was incredibly good at them and they were cheap. I called around and got some prices, and this place told me a pedicure was $22, I was used to pay $16, but my feet needed to be done so I went for it.I showed up as a walk in and they were slightly busy. I took forever choosing a nail color because they didn't have the shade of red I wanted, but eventually I chose something. I waited for about 30 minutes before I was serviced.There were 3 men in there getting their feet done so it made me feel a little more confident that they'd probably do a good job because men usually have ATROCIOUS feet. I'm not sure of the woman's name who did my feet but she did an AWESOME job, probably the best or 2nd best pedicure I've ever had in my entire life. She actually did my feet like she would probably want someone to do her own. I was highly satisfied with my service, and I would definitely return.Please note there is a charge for using debit. It's only 1 or 2 bucks.

3.description: Hmmph!After going to a local really cheap hair place that totally butchered my hair.  Left me crying, on my birthday no less.  I thought I would check out this gem.They managed to fix, (ie. even out the back of my hair that was totally chopped up)They managed to get my color right also.

1.description: If you want a fabulous local place to get beautified Angie's is the place!! Stella has been doing my hair for better part of 5 years!! I am impressed every time I go in the salon. Everyone that walks out the there looks like a movie star. They are a full service salon and anything that you can think of getting done they can defiantly accommodate you!! Love this place.

2.description: I've been coming to this salon for a long time, but I think I've had enough of it and the delays and gossip that goes on in there.Yes, I'm well aware that all salons are gossip central, but all they ever do is rip on people, make fun of them if they are not "loaded" or greek.  What can you expect here? Gorgeous color and nice haircut.  What else? Spending 4-6hrs here!  Yes, between 4 and 6 hours, that is insane!  I had an 9am appt, they told me I'd be the first one, and low and behold I arrive to having some lady sitting with color, a dude with highlights, and  another lady mid way through a haircut.  I was taken AFTER all these folks were totally complete, at 11:30am.  My highlights were interrupted to do someone's roots.  When my highlights were done, the girl in the back washed my hair, and told me to sit across from the stylist to wait for her, another 1hr of waiting with wet hair, cold air blowing from the door opening and closing, and a wet towel dripping.  My haircut was YET AGAIN interrupted to go wash out and keep checking on other people's colors.  By 2pm I was finally out!  From 9am to 2pm for haircut & highlights?  Unacceptable.The pricing is tricky here, as they go by "ranges" the ranges are somewhat determined by how much they like you.  If you are talkative and agree with them, you get service a little cheaper.  If you are quiet and dont  giggle at the gossip, you pay a slight surcharge.  Maybe this was fine for 1990 on Harlem, not in 2010 on Irving.Stacy does nice up do's, she's quick and tries out unique styles, the only issue is that her stories are focused on how "rich" she is or wants to be.  She always has a smerk on her face like she is better than you, and you should be thankful she is even touching your hair.  Schedule with her once, and that means you better come in there every time to have her do your hair, otherwise she'll be mean.Angie is the owner, a bubbly nice lady.  She does a great job, but is slowww.  She did an up do for my cousin's wedding party, it took her 2.5hrs to do the brides hair, the bride was late to EVERY other appointment after hers due to this.  Who needs that stress on their wedding day.  Angie talked and talked instead of doing the hair.  If you want nice hair, these ladies will definitely do the job.  However, they are not courteous of your time, or that you had an appt for a particular time, or if you are late to your own wedding.  Once you enter here, you are on THEIR time.The reason I gave 3 stars is they do very nice work, you will be happy with your color, your haircut will be perfect; however you will spend double the time of anywhere else, not know what to expect in terms of pricing (last visit compared to current visit), starving after sitting there for 4-6hrs, and a headache from all the gossip.

0.description: Always awesome haircuts. I got my girlfriend going here now & she loves it.It's a nice family owned business too, NOT some fly by night chain, where you get your hair cut by a different person every time.All the employees here are friendly & have great suggestions.

3.description: Brutal. I'll blame myself for the 3rd try, but it's on the way home & maybe the last time was an aberration.Nope. 2 out of 3 times, I walked out. The busboys do a better job greeting customers. Wasn't busy today, but I sat for an easy 5 min. No one ever came to take my order. I got up and no one noticed. I'm embarrassed I've gotten bamboozled into giving this place a shot. The one time I was able to have a meal, the food was mediocre at best. Customer Service is taken for granted. Surprisingly, it's usually packed when I drive by. Bizarre. It's a shame people have such low standards that they feel they have to eat there. Won't be getting my $ for their overpriced menu. Basura!Take the drive to Tom's. Food is much better & you are treated well. Shame on me for giving this place a chance. Judge a book by its cover in this case.

1.description: All things being considered equal this place has an extremely rude staff across the board ( I didn't interact with the cooks), I've been coming here for years and the decline has been consistent. They managed to get two stars because the food was prepared quickly and was good. Be prepared for some attitude from the staff but a decent meal and price.

2.description: Terrible from the phone call to place the order to the finished product.  Called to order a pick up breakfast.  Wanted a bacon and cheese skillet but was told I have to order a meat skillet.  I don't want the ham and sausage and so I asked if I could sub mushrooms... No I will have to pay an extra charge of $1 if I want to add this item... It ended up costing 10.50 for a bacon mushroom and cheese skillet.  I asked for over medium eggs and got crispy fried hard eggs.  I ordered two other breakfasts as well and since it was boxed as to go I guess the cooks felt as though it could be slopped into a box and hurry to the next order... Terrible... I called to speak to the manager and I am still awaiting a return call... On day 2 of waiting!!

9.description: nothing against cops but they tend to act like big shot A**holes when they're in a group & they're ALWAYS eating here. It may serve in the restaurant favor however because it is in an extremely dangerous area if south Chicago. Would not suggest anyone to bring a family here. service is also very mediocre.

10.description: Great restaurant in an unlikely spot!  Excellent coffee (also available at the 75th and Exchange location) and excellent food.  We really enjoy the huge omelets - especially the Mexican omelet which is served with superb homemade salsa!  The quality is excellent and the food is consistent.

4.description: good breakfast, everything else is hit or miss. Try it for yourself, you may like it.

6.description: Me and my hubby stop by this Resturant sometimes before he takes me too work they have the best breakfast. And it opens at 5am that's the best.

11.description: This is a fantastic restuarant.  Its a small diner in the Hegwesch area of South Chicago. They have a convenient parking lot. The service is excellent. I went there for breakfast on a Sunday morning. Lots of customers there, but I did not have to wait long at all.  The delicious coffee refills were endless. The menu was excellent with breakfast and lunch!  My sister had the meat lovers omelet.  I had one of the skillet entrees.  The food was in ample portions and delicious!  With all the delicious food and neverending coffee, the check was less than $20!  If you are out in this area, I highly recommend this restaurant.  You will love it!

5.description: Breakfast here is amazing I have tried several places around this area and I haven't found anything better than this one. The food is great the service is even better as soon as you cup is empty you'll get hot coffee right of way. Only downside is parties of 5+ will have a hard time trying to get a table but the wait is worth it.

7.description: Has potential, lots of choices, like purple steer, big menu, very much like a wild west kind of place. Seems like at any moment a person will walk in and try to hold it up though, don't really like that vibe. Lots of food for the amount you pay but some of the soups are gross. And they have this annoying bus boy who laughs fairly often in a high pitched squeal. But all the waitresses are really sweethearts, so it balances.But that is what is fun about diners, and going to them. You can never tell what kind of person will walk in the door. There isn't really any place around like it for miles so you get a "last stop" kind of vibe. So, in conclusion, lots of vibes going on here. I don't like: Tuna melt - ugh dont get this unless you have had a murderous week, or day and need to instantly gain 4lbs, they use American cheese on it, gag. Large uncut brocolli, steamed - got this with a chicken that I would call a C+, but this unseasoned steaming tree knocked it down further. At least a little salt? Lemon? Annoying bus boy laughing like he's a ferret on meth. I do like:Breakfast all dayLarge parking lotHealthy menu that I have not explored.Waitresses are really friendly. Cost effective.

8.description: I only went into this place because Lief doesn't accept anything but cash. It was too nasty out to keep driving around looking for food so we took our chances. I WAS NOT impressed at all and can't say that I will return willingly.

0.description: Food is great. Pancakes are delicious. Chicken Skillet always goes home in doggie bag. Only negative would be wait times for a booth.

3.description: Gotta love Dandy Dollar! They have just about everything you need. Manicure kits, paper plates/cups, plastic cutlery, balloons ($2), placemats, toys, candy, jewelry. You name it, they've got it. Support this local business and be reminded the value of a dollar.

1.description: You know, it wasn't until this dollar store opened that I realized just how dollar store deficient this area is. Is there another dollar store in Lakeview? I'm not sure? Dandy, welcome...A night full of scrolling through DIY crafts on Pinterest led me to Dandy. And then, as per usual with dollar stores, I found myself carrying around a bunch of stuff I didn't really need. I have spoons, I have glass cleaner, I have trash bags, I have tiny compact mirrors, but I didn't buy any of that stuff for a dollar. Bargains! Anywho, I did find what I needed for my crafts, now all I need is motivation to actually get crafty. Dandy is rather small but well stocked, a welcome addition to an area that's used to paying more than it should for...well...just about everything.

2.description: I was in Dandy Dollar in Lakeview today and I have to say...I love, love, LOVE this place.  It is a REAL Dollar Store where everything is just $1.  The only exception and they do point it out, is that they have a special section where one featured item of something high quality, (like the candle currently presented), is over $1, but is MUCH less expensive than the comparable item at Pier 1.The store is not that big, but you wouldn't know it from the vast amount of items they carry.  Even some of the jewelry is nicer than you would imagine...especially for just $1.  I will make a point of shopping here on a regular basis.

0.description: While dollar stores now sell some things for more than just one dollar, they do still sell everything at amazingly significant discounts.  Prices are so low that sometimes I wonder how they can do it and still stay in business!Stop in any day for a wide variety of your typical household needs.  Today I picked up laundry detergent, bleach, Drain-o, and some garbage bags for a whopping $9.00......That's a serious bargain!They accept cash, debit or credit cards.  All it's all so cheap you'll be kick yourself for paying full-price anywhere else.

4.description: cute little dollar store in the neighborhood! I've gone here for birthday party supplies and they were able to supply me with everything I needed, along with some random odds and ends like home stuff and cleaning supplies. The man who was working was extremely friendly as well. Definitely worth popping in just to see what dollar finds you can get!

3.description: I grew up eating the pizza here, when I'm in the city I try to sneak back and get some more grease. If you're not used to the pizza here, you would probabaly be shocked at the thin crust with shrimp pizza. It's great!The staff is typical south side non helpful people, but I expect that from this place. Get the pizza, keep your hand on your wallet and go home!

1.description: I just called to order a pizza from italian fiesta with my FREE COUPONS only ti find out they no longer offer the FREE large pizza with 12 coupons. They have a new promotion now $10 off with 15 coupons. The last time I ordered from italian Fiesta pizza was on Feb 1, 2016 and that coupon said free large pizza with 12 coupons. They will honor the old coupons with the new promotions but I want my free pizza! Thats why I saved the coupons...I spoked to a manager named Larry and he will not honor the free coupon promotion. I WANT MY FREE PIZZA!  Italian Fiesta has been in the business since 1940 and you just lost a customer.  All those "coupons".......TRASHED! No longer needed. I will no longer order from italian Fiesta.  I have never begged anyone to take my money and I don't do business with businesses who do not keep their word.

2.description: I will never, never, ever, ever, ever order another crumb of food from this place ever again. Italian Fiesta....You have messed up my order for the last and final time. Strike 1... You guys STILL don't take credit cards???!!! Strike 2...I request pick up at the 71st street store. You fools send my pizza to the 80th street location. Strike 3...When you finally realize YOUR mistake, you offer no type of restitution. What???!!! Where they do that at?? You know what? After years of this type of abuse, poor customer service and hit or miss food..I'm throwing in the towel. I'm calling Beggar's with my huge order to feed the crowd watching the game downstairs. Deuces!!!

5.description: 3.5* Pepperoni

0.description: What can I say about this pizza disaster place that others have not said!  It's so disappointing to write this review because every since I was a little girl I use to come to this location.I would now rather go to Papa John(no offense just not authentic pizza) instead of going here and that's saying something...We placed an order and we were told that it would be about an hour before we received our order now that is typical and we weren't shocked by that wait time but what did shock us is that 2 hours later they still had not showed up and they had a nasty stank attitude about our food not being delivered to us in a timely manner.My daughter absolutely loves this place so even after that incident she asked me to give them another chance, which we did!  Well, not only were they slow we didn't get our complete order and I was asked did I just want to get it the next time I ordered something...Were they kidding I don't care if gold was dripping from the cheese I would not order anything especially delivery from them ever again.For the price you pay for their pizza they should be able to hire a staff that you can hear smiling over the phone but instead you get one that acts like you are bothering them for calling and ordering...so they don't have to worry I won't be ordering anything else.On top of that they don't take a credit, or debit card...really in this day in age when mostly everyone is carrying around plastic.  I just don't get it!!!Sadly, there poor customer service negates all of the good food that they do have!  Why would I spend my money at a place that acts like they are doing me a favor for taking my money...Um No, I don't think so!!!So, for me this is an end of an era...

4.description: I have to agree with Richard, this particuliar location has the worst attitudes and management.  Frequently, I have asked for a pizza with half pork, half beef and that it be separated so I can know the difference.  Doesn't sound so hard, I mean, other pizzeria's perform this task all the time...noooo, not this place!  As frequent as I have asked, I have frequently been told that they cannot separate the pizza.  Their solution...to look at the difference in color in the meat...WTH???  With the attitude given at this request, you would think I asked for a free...no a lifetime of free pizza's!The only reason I give this place 2 stars instead of 1 - the Southshore location has much, much better tasting pizza than the Kenwood location.

3.description: I love the Jerk chicken tacos an my daughter had the steak tacos they were so delicious.  I can not wait to return back to this restaurant. We found this restaurant  just by going south bound on Stony Island and it was truly the best decision we made.

1.description: Terrible service, terrible flavorless food, I wish I could give no stars..we have to stop accepting whatever because it's available. Check out my tip for full rant & review

2.description: The service was really good. The food was great. They have added to their menu. They could extend the hours. I would recommend this place.

9.description: This place is a south side gem. Their waffles melt in your mouth there so good and they dont need syrup. My favorite i sthere Chicken and waffles. However I love there omeletes, salads and skillets. The inside has a very warm welcoming and trendy feel. The customer service and lemonade is also great. if you are ever in the area defly try them.

10.description: I really like this place!The staff is nice and food is great!  I love how they have WIFI and I can get about from my home office to work and or meet clients.Besides Avalon Park is an awesome community and we want to support our local business!  I'm going to start 100 Percent of the time tell clients to meet me here vs StarbucksSupport Local and don't be a hater.  LOLYolandra "Faith" MartinIllinois Real Estate BrokerCell 773-301-1091Voice Mail 773-977-8630Fax 312-962-4937MartinTheBroker@gmail.comView Apartment VIDEOS:  youtube.com/MartinTheBro…*SALES*LEASING*MANAGEMENT*CONSULTING

4.description: I wasn't feeling the decor but the food was decent.  They went for a urban chic look but obviously didn't use top grade materials or furnishing. The place looks like it could use better upkeep but it's not a dump either.I had the ribeye breakfast withe eggs and hash browns with toast. The steak was thin but very well seasoned. The eggs were just okay. They were not fluffy and obviously cook on the same griddle as everything else.The wife had the Creamy caramel pecan waffle. She loved it! Sweet, nutty and crisp waffles with great flavor and texture.

6.description: Came here for Mother's Day Brunch.There was a large group of us and we waited a very long time to get our food. As a group we were not given our food around the same time either. We were all starving so this pissed people off. One person from our group actually refused her potential meal  & left because she ended up being the very last person who did not have her food. This is all after it had been an hour plus since we'd been seated.I ordered a patty melt and I guess I shouldn't have. I figure it's really hard to screw up a patty melt - but the meat tasted old and it made me quite sad. The fries that came with my food were really good though!I was too through when I found that as my infant daughter was chewing her micky mouse pancakes that there was a long hair sticking out of her mouth in her food.... It was evident that the hair did not match anyone at our table, so I had to hold myself back from flipping out. I didn't bother even complaining about it at the time because I don't ever picture myself coming back.Overall service was alright - not spectacular, but nothing to complain too much about in that department aside from our meals not being served at the same time. Menu pricing is decent as well.I give this place 2 stars instead of 1 because some people enjoyed their meals even though it took forever to come out. I was definitely not a camper though.

12.description: I've passed by this more times than i can count. I finally went in.  Decor: it must have been a lounge before or doubles as one because the velvet couches don't seem to say breakfast diner but I liked it.  Service: the two waitresses were very nice. Food: I ordered the ham&cheese breakfast with eggs fried hard with cheese, hash browns & a side of pancakes,  The ham was the best part.   The hash browns were typical &the pancakes were ok. I'll try the waffles next time.

5.description: I am so glad to have found Stony's Palace Cafe! The cafe is charming and very comfortable. The service was fast and friendly. The food and coffee were delicious!!! I will be returning again soon!

13.description: I am so rooting for this place to succeed.  The food is good, its pretty resaonable priced, and the undustrial city loft feeling and decor is AWESOME. Now for the BUT.  There is definately room for improvement in the SERVICE.  The first time that we went there, we walked in, and did not know that we were supposed to seat ourselves, and the server/bussers just walked by us. Finally someone acknowledged us and told us to seat ourselves.  The person that brought water to the table did say a word, and the server looked DEPRESSED.  I was like "WHAT A SAD PLACE".  so the other day, i decided to give the place another chance.  This time it was afraid that it was going to be the same experience.  The persoe that brought the water looked SO SAD and didnt say a word to us, and the server was just as SAD, but the food was AWESOME.  So when the server brought the chack and asked how things were, i decided to be honest and told her exactly what I thought, and she definately made an error to make a little conversation and even made a litte joke.  This is definately going to be my go to breakfast spot, but I am so hoping that it is successful.  With such a small and new spot,, If i were the manager/owner, i would definately make the rounds to the table to ask how things are and thank the customers for coming,   Just a thought.

11.description: The place is comfortable, the food is good but the service is slow for the price. I'm sitting here and had to ask the cook to make what I wanted :(

8.description: We've passed this place several times and finally got up early enough for breakfast this Sunday. If you want a waffle, you're okay. If you're hoping for anything else, go elsewhere. The turkey sausage was...I really don't know how else to describe it but wet and squishy. Although I ordered pork bacon, I'm pretty sure the pile of scraps that served as "four strips of bacon" was actually turkey bacon, deep fried and overcooked.  The inside is pretty dimly lit, but it appeared they had some patio seating out back, but it was too cold for that. Might be good for a hangover, but I don't feel like we'll be going back. I feel like I'm possibly being over critical, but I think I just had my hopes up for a good soul food breakfast, and it just didn't happen.

0.description: Great food and they are now doing party rentals. I  look forward to having my next event here.

7.description: I've been here about 3-4 times. The very first time it was for Mother's Day and it was a group of us. My mom and I had a dirty fork so they went to go get clean ones. Then they toke forever to give us all our food since it was a large group. The second visit me and my sister went in cause we just wanted pancakes and eggs. So we ordered, sat at the table to wait and get our food, we sit and the table is stuck all over. I'm like what?!?!?! It was so gross. So we went to another table and that one was sticky too. I couldn't believe it. The third time we kept having to repeat our order and they messed up my order. Then for the drinks this guy I don't know if he was deaf but we had to point to what drink we want. They need someone to do the orders that you don't have to worry about doing that. I'm not going back there. I love the food but it's not worth it

3.description: Horrible store, it's always crowded with no registers open you will see like three workers yet no one tries and help u. I been in and out of the store for the past week looking for light bulbs and yet they still have none. Need to work on customer service and keeping the store stocked!!!

1.description: This store is straight up ghetto , go inside merchandize is everywhere I stop going in there, it's just nasty & smells like dead mice, it doesn't deserve even one star  disgusting.

2.description: I Live In Between 3 Family Dollar Stores & Out Of The 3 Locations , This By Far Has Been The Worst I've Ever Came Across. Everytime I've Come To This Store I Never Find What I'm Truly Looking For NEVER.  Nothing Is Ever Fully Stocked. I Hate Going Into This Store !!!!!

0.description: Although, the store is called Family Dollar don't get that mixed up with Dollar Tree because everything in the store isn't a dollar but you can find some good deals for your dollar!First let me say I do understand that crime is high and that stores feel that by taking away my bag that will in some way bring down the shoplifting rate!  Wrong!! The people who really steal know how to do what they do and taking my bag is not going to slow them down!When it comes to security while you are there you continue to hear a script from the speakers telling you how all actions are being monitored so if that is the truth, Why do I have to give you my bag because you don't have better security at your store!I also don't understand why the cashiers have to stop in the middle of ringing up a customer to say Hello to greet each person that walks through the door, to me they are taking their focus off of the customer in front of them and that is very rude!If they want you to feel welcome when you walk through the doors maybe they need to hire a greeter don't make your cashiers have to stop being engaged with the person in front of them!Now, that I have that out of the way because this is a Family Dollar that I frequent because they do have good prices, and I also like to check out the racks when they place things on clearance!They use to have birthday cards 2 for a dollar but those days have since passed because the last time I was there all the cards were a dollar and in the big scheme of things that still isn't bad compared to how much cards cost!So, even with the things I don't like at Family Dollar there are more things that I do like so I will be back but it would nice to see a change!

4.description: Hi everyone! I am the one that complained about the Chicago store at 71st and Paxton. The cashier and the manager assistant was making fun of me because I had to put things back and make two transactions. Well a lady that is in charge of that store named Marilyn helped me and she was very nice. Now dont laugh but I have a shopping cart with duct tape on the wheels so they dont fall of lol and she offered me a new one. :) She is also going to sit down and talk to the the employees about customer service. Thank you so much Marilyn for your help. I will gladly continue to shop at the Family Dollar in my neighborhood. :)

12.description: My first time bringing my son to this shop was a very enjoyable experience. The shop was clean, well-kept, and pleasing. Leah, the barber with whom he had his appointment, was on-time, friendly, and very knowledgeable about her craft. She gave me  specific instructions and information on how to combat my son's dry scalp issues. She also took great care in cutting his hair and did an excellent job. Leah has been a great barber to my son for years and is the only one he requests when we are in town. I highly recommend Leah as barber of choice!

7.description: Friendly barbers here.  I saw Essex here for my eyebrows to be arched with straight edge, good job and super fast

20.description: This review is for Olga Little Nails and More.Olga is simply the best! I went to HP Salon to replace acrylic nails that I had gotten elsewhere. They were almost impossible to remove, but Olga very patiently got them off with acetone wraps instead of soaking them or ripping them off, even though it took over an hour. I chose gel nails to replace them. Olga did an excellent job, even extending length, which other salons don't do. My beautiful white tips and peach gel nails look perfect. The whole process took a couple of hours. And for all that? $40. Amazing.The other great thing about Olga is that she is a really genuine and fun person to talk to. She (and the rest of the staff at HP salon) were really welcoming. In addition to having certification as a nail technician and cosmetologist, she is also pursuing a Master's degree in Special Ed--smart lady. She makes the process of getting nails done really pleasant and feel like time well spent.Highly recommend!

19.description: BEST SHOP! BEST BARBERS!!! At first I went here because I heard it was thee shop of president Obama and other celebs frequented the spot. I wanted to see what all the hoopla was about. First visit I walked in and saw a barbers chair signed by president Obama enclosed in a glass casing and a lot of other neat pics and such around, pretty impressive and cool HOWEVER I begin to think  this would be a cheesy super cuts/ bo rics commercial sort of place or worst a ridiculous concept of an upscale stuffy barbershop! The kind that suck the idea of what a barbershop is supposed to be. To my delight it was neither of those things! it was a regular shop, the barbers were talking about sports and having some laughs. I felt welcome instantly. Ishmael cut my hair, best cut EVER, and I do mean EVER. my next visit I learned Ish is the owner and only cuts on Sundays and Mondays. bummer, but I got a GREAT cut from one of the other barbers Buddy! next visit, a diff barber....great cut. I love this place, good convo, great barbers,GREAT CUTS and a fun place to just relax and enjoy people. my new favorite spot

1.description: Really nice barbers. Called ahead and got a haircut the next afternoon.Not the best haircut ever, but good. Not cheap but not expensive. Worth a look.

2.description: Saw Mr. Leaks 312-719-3813. 10/10 haircut. Perfect Caesar and taper. Sharp lining. Great atmosphere barbershop.

9.description: I start going to Trinia around 2006 or 2007 to maintenance my locs... She was awesome. I moved back to Dallas in 2008 right before the presidential election. I got the opportunity to see president to be at that time in the shop. OMG!!!! If I ever move back to Chi-town and I need locs done I will be coming back to this salon... I love it with...

6.description: Conveniently located in the heart of Hyde Park...I love HP Salon. How can you hate on a shop that opens its doors on Sundays and Mondays...that's golden! They have relaxed atmosphere and a mature clientele.My choice is Leah B, a professional barber with an keen sense of style. She graciously takes my odd appointment requests with genuine character. Good side conversation when warranted is added bonus, but if she couldn't cut I'd have nothing to say..lol

18.description: It's been great to have Hyde Park Hair Salon as my college haircut place. At first I was worried about getting good cuts in Chicago, but HPHS has worked out just fine. I decided to try it after hearing that President Obama used to be a regular, and I'm glad I did. My barber is Jaron. He's a great guy to see if you're looking for someone who can cut with shears. Overall, HPHS is a great barbershop. The haircuts are quick, reasonably priced, and well-done. I highly recommend it.

10.description: Very professional. I made an appointment for 9 am and was pleasantly surprised that the barber I made the appointment with was there and ready to work before the appointment time. Not only did Tony provide me with an excellent haircut, he did it while leading me through an engaging conversation. Not an easy task as I am not very talkative, especially at that time of day. Easily the best haircut I've had in a long time. Thank you Tony.

13.description: Ish is the greatest. Took me in at the last minute. I showed him a picture of how I wanted my hair cut..... And he matched it perfectly !!!! Great attention to detail.

16.description: As a student at the University of Chicago, a nearby place to quickly and easily get a men's cut is an important thing for a student to seek out and find in his first few months in Hyde Park.  It's also difficult!  Many places charge $30+ bucks for a fast cut that used to cost me $7 in the early 1990's in my hometown barbershop.  I almost ended up taking an hour long CTA journey to BoysTown to get a trendy 'do.  Thankfully I found Leah (who was at another salon at the time with rave reviews on their Yelp page).  Leah is real professional.  Someone else's review stated that she makes you feel as if you were at the spa without the spa price and I would say that's the best way to describe my 5 or 6 haircuts with her.  Additionally, she shapes beards and brows to make men look professional, sleek, and well-groomed.  Clean, accurate lines is the best way to describe her haircutting style.  She also makes sure you know how to style your new hairstyle and what products you should use and where to find them at the best price.  My reviews tend to be too verbose, but if I were to boil it down, I'd say: Go see Leah (and make an appointment because she's busy) if you want someone who listens to what you want and delivers it, along with some education about how to keep your hair and style it to its best potential.

17.description: I went to HPHS for a haircut and I had Leah as my barber. I've been to many barbershops in the Chicago area, but I've never had a cut so clean and professional as I did with her. Not only did I get an awesome cut, but Leah's stellar customer service made it an all around fantastic experience. She's highly skilled, can do all hair types and artistic graphics. I walked out feeling like Leah gave me the spa treatment without the spa prices! Because I'm an hour outside the area, the fact they offer Sunday appointments make's it absolutely worth the commute. For those seeking an awesome barbershop with highly skilled barbers, a great diverse neighborhood and rare (Sundays and Mondays) flexible hours, this IS the shop to go to!

15.description: I love this babershop and Trinia is the most precise barber and best loctician I have ever been to.  Here's why: while other's may be great at styling and making sure that your locs are tight at the roots, Trinia maintains your entire loc, from root to tip.  She is meticulous, she is patient and she is simply great at what she does.  The maintenance process is lengthy (be prepared to stay all day) but so worth it.  I have since moved from Chicago, but made an appointment with her when I went for a recent business trip and I will continue to do so bc I trust her with my hair.  Oh, and her method of loc repair is like MAGIC!  Ive never seen anything like it.   If you want styling, there are many places you can go in Chicago.  But if you want someone to really take care of your locs, this is where you need to go.

0.description: I got a haircut here this afternoon. I haven't been to a barber shop in YEARS because I usually just shave all my hair off all strong my head lol. But I decided I wanted a new look and would go for a Mohawk. So I called ahead made an appointment. The atmosphere is very friendly all the barbers seem like they know what they are doing and are friendly to their clients. Done even seem to know they're clients really personally which is great. The guy who cut my hair was Jaffar, here did a great job, he was very careful and precise with my hair and my first Mohawk turned out to excellent! I will definitely come back to him again!

5.description: Walked in there and waited an hour and a half for someone to cut my hair. Barbers saw that I was waiting but kept letting guys go in front of me. Walked out without even getting a cut. You're better off going to Hyde Park Barber Studio up the street.Disgraceful service.

11.description: HPHS is the Gold Standard when it comes to barber shops! After all, it's where President Obama used to get cut and his old chair is on display in the shop. HPHS offers a comfortable, clean and diverse environment with some of the best barber's in the industry. HPHS is open 7 days a week and conveniently located in the heart of Hyde Park.

8.description: 3 haircuts here over the course of 6 weeks. Great place get a haircut, talented barbers. 2 Star deduction? Quality of service could be better for the $$ ($25)- Get off your phone while cutting my hair - Do you not take CC or not want to pay transaction fee- Any words besides "chin up" would niceStill a decent 4th option, if you need a haircut and just want a transactional experience. Definitely won't be a place that I go willingly.

3.description: Don't go. Unless you're a regular you are not getting a hair cut anytime soon. I went, as a walk in, was told there was one person ahead but then I'd be next. 2 hours and 4 other people later I left without a hair cut.   Other people walked in after me, who apparently had been there before, and got service right away. No one acknowledged me at all despite sitting in plain sight. Maybe it's not bad if you are the president or a regular but otherwise they don't care about you or your business.

14.description: This was my first time here and Leah was awesome! She was very professional and personable but most importantly listened to what I wanted and gave me the cut I imagined! Make an appointment bc skills like hers for such a low price just can't be beat. I live in Rogers park, but her hair magic is worth the commute and then some. My new hair home is at this Hyde park barber.

4.description: Had a great time!  I went to cost cutters for the last year and it took about 45 minutes to straighten that mess out!  I now have a men's haircut again!

28.description: It used to be good...until:a) the service got badb) the pizza got badc) the waiting time got badAnswer? ALL OF THE ABOVE. Who wants to order a pizza from a woman (whether in-store or over the phone) with a stank attitude. Sorry honey, but you're not taking my order with that tone.Who wants to wait an hour and a half for a pizza to be delivered (that sometimes arrives cold btw)? The pizza doesn't even taste as good as it used to.New places, like Gianna's Pizza and Beggars Pizza are on the south side. They are better and taking the spotlight. People are starting to notice. They just aren't good.

1.description: I was really excited to try this place, but unfortunately, I am fairly certain I won't try it again. I ordered two large pizzas (one cheese and one pepperoni). I picked them up because I had read the bad reviews about the delivery service. When I walked in I could not believe how dirty the place (including the kitchen which you can easily see) looked. The pizza boxes I received had smears of tomato sauce on the tops of them. I was still holding out hope that the pizza would be good. It was not. They were put together seemingly without any real care. Some parts of the cheese pizza didn't even have cheese on them. The sauce wasn't terrible but the cheese had a really weird consistency - almost like it was old or something. Overall, a bad experience - oh, and I paid over $40 (for only two large pizzas!).

9.description: The shrimp on top of pizza it's different but it's good with the red sauce that a lot of cheese perfect to the taste .local spot

29.description: Not a bad pizza... But not a great one... Greasy... Best with extra sauce on it... But for those of you who are having drinks this is the place for you!

23.description: I begrudgingly give this location 2 Stars. As is the case with 99% of all South side restaurants serving people of color, their customer service is HORRIBLE!! Yesterday I ordered 2 cheese,  and was told to wait for what I thought was fresh pizza. After wasting 15 minutes of my life in this grungy establishment I was told that there were no more Cheese slices. Ugh! I'm a vegetarian for Lent! They have one more strike with me. Twice they have cut my pizza in squares after I explicitly asked for wedges/pie cut.

5.description: Yummy pizza but by the time you receive it your already contemplating calling and canceling. Whoa whoa delivery takes an HOUR and 45 minutes! It's crazy! And they are very bold about it. Along with the long delivery, the driver asks you to come out to her car for you to receive your pizza. Lazy Much.

31.description: If you enjoy salty, greasy pizza with questionable ingredients,  this is the place for you.  I'd recommend this establishment for anyone who craves the unknown (will I receive my pizza tonight, will it be ice cold and squished to the side of the box again, will it have toppings I didn't want or order, will the delivery guy be high?).  I had the misfortune of living close to this place and gave them several chances to redeem themselves.  It's not worth the frustration and inevitable heartburn.  Order your pizzas elsewhere in South Shore.

25.description: Recently I ventured over here on my lunch break. Ok the pizza is good no doubt, but the crust is extremely thin. It feels like you're only eating cheese and sausage. Since the crust is so thin, you have to eat alot before you get full. However the cheese and sausage or pepperoni is good, thats why i wouldn't give it anything lower than 3 stars. Tonight is pizza night and we are hitting up Giordanos for sure.

12.description: This place has been around for years, my family and I have been ordering from them forever and sad to say I don't understand how they stay in business with such poor service. The order takers there need serious customer service training. Their consistently rude over the phone and in person. I'M sure that there are plenty of young people in the neighborhood that would love the job, nobody wants to deal with rudeness, especially while spending their hard earned money. People continue to patronize the establishment because there is nothing else around yet still the service is just terrible, I'd rather drive across town to Hyde park to eat rather than stay in my neighborhood. Sad.

21.description: I thought I wrote a review way before this but maybe it was just a tip.  If you need your food fast don't go for delivery they told us 30 minutes and we would have our order I mean I could have walked and got the food but it was late and I didn't want to be out at that time so I decided to have my pizza delivered.  It was over an hour before they arrived and I wish I could say it was worth the wait.Now, the honest truth is the quality of this pizza place has been going down for a long time but the price keeps going up.  We spent 34 dollars including tip, delivery charge and large pizza with 5 toppings.The pizza had fresh ingredients on it but it fell flat of being a real good pizza. I had stop coming here because the pizza was no longer good and the delivery sucked.Well, that hasn't changed and I will not be running to this place anytime soon to buy an overpriced, semi tasty pizza.I haven't had the chicken, meatballs, or lasagna in awhile it use to be real good but unfortunately it will be awhile before I will buy anything from them again.They need to read the reviews and listen to their customers and go back to what many of us remember about this place because right now it's just lackluster and still riding on the wave of use to be and not what is right now.

16.description: when i order here i sometimes get chicken with veggies pizza, or just a veggies pizza. you will wait a while, but it's worth it.

10.description: If you can ant to be lied to mislead unsatisfied order from this place it's a mere shell if it's glorious past the people that work here 're unprofessional and the swinging door where the delivery people ha g out at reminds you of a speak easy off the grid gambling house . Your better off taking a ride to beggars pizza or down to seashell . It's a terrible place to visit . I called in my order at 7:15pm .  I was told by the operator it would be 30 minutes ..well we arrived forty five minutes later ...I asked the lady with the bad attitude how lo g she said another six minutes ..fast forward ..ten minutes later .she said it would be five more minutes they forgot to put pepperoni on the pizza . I politely asked for my money back and left . So so sad ..I deeply encourage you to go somewhere else .

11.description: If there was a way to give this spot 3.5 stars, I would.  I decided to give them 3 stars because your night at Italian Fiesta can be a 4 or it could easily be a 2.Pizza is great to me.  I've grown up on Italian Fiesta for years and while sometimes you may get the greasy/burnt pizza, generally in my experience its usually great.  Im a fan of thin crust pizza so I prefer this place over Giordanos or other spots that are more known for their deep dish.Here is the problem with Italian Fiesta.  Their service sucks.  Absolutely sucks.  This location may be the worst of all of them.  On a Friday or Saturday night, you're likely to be on hold for 5 minutes waiting for them to pick up and place your order.  And at the very minimum, expect to wait an hour for your food.  And if you are getting it delivered, you are better off watching a movie while you wait because its going to take about 2 hours.  Simply put 3 is average which is a shame because when you get a good pizza from them, its easily a 5 in my opinion.  But their service is pretty much a consistent 1-2 so that balances it out.  They used to be so much better but it has seriously declined over the last few years.

26.description: The pizza here is over priced, slow coming delivery but  satisfying,once you bite into it. The customer service STINKS

27.description: Pizza only: Great pizza, but over priced. Delivery is really slow. Being as popular as they are for their pizza, they are very busy, and it truly effects their customer service. Order the pizza before you get too hungry, and have it delivered.

0.description: I am visiting from Southern California, my mother-in-law recommended this place saying it was an acquired taste but that it had been around since she was young. We called and ordered a medium pepperoni and sausage. They said wait time would be an hour and a half. We got it 20 mins early and it was DELICIOUS. The crust is a soft crispy (perfect) and the sauce and wherever they get their meat from is absolutely scrumptious. I have no complaints except the delivery time, but really if I had minded enough I would've got carry out.

20.description: Very bad on 71st street. Greasy burnt pizza. The customer service sucks and the delivery is God AWFUL bad. Go to the one on 47 th street. This one is bad.

19.description: It's been an hour and 35 mins and my pizza still hasn't arrived ... I swear if the pizza wasn't so delicious I would not fool with them period... They already inconvienence you with no card cash only policy they have .... Ugh I'm aggrivated and ready to EAT

2.description: After three hours they tried to deliver my pizza. No thank you, I'm not surprised as this is the second time they've done this to me,  and consequently the last!

32.description: Worst pizza on the South side. If I could give it negative stars I would. First of all, their customer service sucks. The order taker are rude belligerent, and ignorant. The delivery is slow and the pizza will come to you with sometimes the wrong ingredients, sometimes beat up looking, and sometimes they just never come. The Pizza itself is sub-standard. The sauce is almost nonexistent, the cheese is covered in an orange oil, and the crust is like wet cracker dough.I'm surprised this place is still in business. I wouldn't recommend them to my worst enemy's friend with no taste buds. They would still find it to be total crap.South-siders wake up and quit patronizing this sham of a pizza place.As my sister would say' 'It's neither Italian, nor is it a Fiesta'

18.description: Italian Fiesta continues to disappoint me. There pizza quality has declined to the point that I must warn others. The sad thing is that I continue to see terrible reviews but nothing is being done to improve their food or service. Is this because of the neighborhood it sits in??? hummmm

13.description: I'm not a fan of Italian Fiesta's pizza. So, why am I writing this review, giving them 3 stars? I'm glad you asked!They have delicious fried chicken! It is perfectly seasoned, crispy, and moist--usually! When it's good, it's very good. But when it's not, I take it back and complain. All of that shouldn't be necessary, but I endure it anyway on occasion. Yep--it's that good!

4.description: I ordered a medium half sausage half pepperoni pizza. It was about a 30 minute wait. The pizza was pretty good but I don't know little bit expensive. Was about 17 dollars. I would definitely go back though. Be careful in the area especially at night.

24.description: No one makes thin crust pizza like IF aka Cheesy Greasy! It's so good, especially w/ mushrooms, sausage, cheese, & onions. There's no one better!

6.description: So I was forced to give at least one star.(yelp rules) So there you have it. The only positive is that I actually did receive a pizza at the end of this horrific experience.  This place sucks.  I can't emphasize that enough. The service is toilet status. There were multiple, random , suspicious looking people being buzzed in and out of the work area.  I was afraid for my safety. I approached the window to inquire about my order.  The guy says 5 min. I take a seat and wait 15 min. (Noone else waiting at this time). The guy  never bothers to let me know that my order is ready.  I'm sitting right in front of him. I finally ask again. Of course it's been sitting there. Pizza was good.  But the bs you'll endure in the interim is a mess.  I'm done venting# I could go on# but I won't# I am pissed though

22.description: I'm not a fan of Italian Fiesta's pizza. So, why am I writing this review, giving them 3 stars? I'm glad you asked!They have delicious fried chicken! It is perfectly seasoned, crispy, and moist--usually! When it's good, it's very good. But when it's not, I take it back and complain. All of that shouldn't be necessary, but I endure it anyway on occasion. Yep--it's that good!

15.description: Just called to order pizza for pickup; neither 47th nor 71st taking orders; WTF? order taker was rude;

7.description: My friend called in an order for pick up and we were told it would be a 45 minute wait, but turns out it was over an hour wait. I wasn't too pleased with the taste, it tastes much different than the one in Hyde Park. Not to mention it was way to greesy  (not sure if thats how its supposed to be) and the entire crust was very hard and burnt along with some of the cheese. I will say their prices are extremely reasonable. I do like the pricing. I would probably try another pizza from there.

8.description: I thought I wrote a review way before this but maybe it was just a tip.  If you need your food fast don't go for delivery they told us 30 minutes and we would have our order I mean I could have walked and got the food but it was late and I didn't want to be out at that time so I decided to have my pizza delivered.  It was over an hour before they arrived and I wish I could say it was worth the wait.Now, the honest truth is the quality of this pizza place has been going down for a long time but the price keeps going up.  We spent 34 dollars including tip, delivery charge and large pizza with 5 toppings.The pizza had fresh ingredients on it but it fell flat of being a real good pizza. I had stop coming here because the pizza was no longer good and the delivery sucked.Well, that hasn't changed and I will not be running to this place anytime soon to buy an overpriced, semi tasty pizza.I haven't had the chicken, meatballs, or lasagna in awhile it use to be real good but unfortunately it will be awhile before I will buy anything from them again.They need to read the reviews and listen to their customers and go back to what many of us remember about this place because right now it's just lackluster and still riding on the wave of use to be and not what is right now.

30.description: This place is only better than one other pizza place in the entire chicago area. And that's reggio's. But that like saying wearing napkins on your feet is better than going bare footed or something. The pizza sucks, it's too salty and too greasy, especially resently. The only reason that people even go here is because it's convinient. I also don't trust the delivery guys and the prices are just standard.

3.description: if your looking for a decent place to get some pizza then this is it. It is not the best place but at least you wont starve. The pizza can sometimes be too greasy and you end up blotting it with a paper towel but for the most part it taste fine. I didn't get anything special, just a sausage and cheese pizza... that's all... I don't have nothing bad or good to say about this place. if you just need something to eat and you don't really care what it is, then this is the place.

14.description: I ordered a large 2 topping pizza at 8:04 pm. It is now 10:15 & I have no pizza! I called back at 9:45 to hear the lady say "oh, ma'am it's out for delivery".....still waiting! How about I'll never (& I seriously mean ever) order from them again! What pizza takes 2 hours to be cooked & delivered!

12.description: OMG!!!! They have everything but the service sucks ASS!!! The people are rude do not want to help they text on their phones I will never go here again!

7.description: Pros: Things are on the cheaps hereGreat selection of weaves an extensionsHuge selection of other beauty products such as hair accessories, jewerly, makeupCons:EVERY wig is black, where's the love for us blondes!!There is more "security" then actual workers who can help you

3.description: Upon walking in I was greeted, the owner was training a few new employees. He was kind enough to hand me a basket while doing his walk throughs. For an Asian owned business, I have to say this is by far the best place to get your beauty needs. The  staff are knowledgable and friendly. They carry non scented garlic shampoo, hard to find in Chicago. They carry a decent array of budget make up lines as well. I will definitely be back.

1.description: I walked in today for the 1st time and was followed around by (2) men like I was going to steal something. They stood very close to me and I felt very uncomfortable. The women at the front desk were extremely nice but I will not return and I will follow a complaint with the BBB and Consumer Affairs. I feel that if you are a regular customer you are treated fairly and but as a new customer I am very disappointed.

2.description: Neighborhood is seedy but beauty house is a great place to find great hair extensions at a reasonable cost. I knew what brand of extensions I wanted and the salespeople were able to find me good "Remy" quality hair just not at Remy prices. Parking lot is small. Store is off the red line Wilson stop. Just FYI. Be mindful of the neighborhood.

9.description: I used to go here to buy hair for braiding and I was a loyal customer.  They have a variety of hair brands and types, and not to pricey on hair products.  It was my go to spot when I was in Chicago and I recommended it to everybody I knew.

18.description: I come to this store every 2 weeks or so to grab a pack of extensions and the usual hair spray or oil sheen or etc. The ladies are always very nice and quick..I'm usually in and out within minutes. Huge selection, anything and everything you would need. Every color, style, you name it. Price is great too.

10.description: Ok. So this is really, really obnoxious.  Today I called Beauty House to see if they had a very expensive product I normally buy, (Indian Remi Hair). I asked for a price on it and the girl stated "I'm sorry, we don't do prices over the phone."  Wow.  While I know it's not her fault and she was very polite---this is a real turn off, and only leads me to assume they've raised their prices and lowered their customer service.  If they had the lowest prices they would have NO PROBLEM disclosing them on the phone. Way to shoot yourself in the foot Beauty House.

13.description: Ive been coming here now for several years and need to say that the customer service is usually consistent. From the door to the cashiers the staff is welcoming,  helpful and knowledgeable. The store carry just about everything...sometimes the hair selection seems a bit reduntance/overwelmning.  However the prices are usually fair.

16.description: This place has lots of hard to find hair products in one place. When I lived in the area, I went often (I'm obsessed with my hair). Now that I don't live in the neighborhood, I pop in when I can and can always count on Beauty House to have great Black hair products at reasonable prices.

17.description: Love Love Love the fact that I now have a staple Black Beauty Supply store on the Northside. Nope Sally's doesn't do it with their shelf and 1/2 of black hair care products and I am not even going to begin to comment on the lameness around the corner from this place but they had everything I needed and I wanted and at a very reasonable prices. I can even commend them for carrying some more natural hair care lines and the lines that are mostly available online. I just found one more reason to fall in love with the North side! A+ in my book

15.description: If you are a hair product junkie, this place will be Christmas Day for you.  They have aisles and aisles of hair stuff  and YES,  for black hair.  The good part for me is that it is on the north side of the city so now I don't have to drive all the way to the south or west sides of the city to get what I want. But to be totally honest, this place is better than any beauty supply store that I have been to in either of those areas.  The other good thing is that if you can't find what you want here there is another hair place right around the corner on Broadway about 2 blocks away.

0.description: Three friends walked in,to have some good times,put on black caps & donned wigs,silly looking, hilarious,friendly staff...giggling ensued.

5.description: My mom and I have been coming here for hair for over 10 years LITERALLY. there was a woman who worked there forever who was always there and knew what I wanted all the time.  Unfortunately she left. When I call I know exactly where what im looking for is located so when the new girls answer the phone I guide them. Sometimes they'll tell me they dont have it but I know they just arent looking hard enough and when I guide them. It's there. Ms.Lee is an angel she knows exactly what I want or a better alternative.  I travel all the way up north just to get what I need

11.description: Soooo... I just called to see how much Indian Remy was and they don't give prices over the phone. Kind of odd if you ask me. Several months ago I went in to buy Saga Gold Remy. I spent $100 for two packs of 10" on Amazon I spent $100 for the same hair at 12" and 14". That being said, Beauty House is something like a SCAM. This is the reason I buy on Amazon. Serivce isn't all that great inside the store either, ladies cautions.

8.description: Absolutely love this place. The workers are knowledgeable of the products and great customer service....will definitely go back!

4.description: Large selection. The employees could work on their customer service but I suspect they don't really care much because they know people will keep coming. One employee will try to get you to use his hair services while you're shopping but he's friendly and harmless. I did finally get a smile from the other employees when I showed up at the counter to pay. Overall it's the usual experience at a beauty supply, I'd return. Though I overheard another woman complaining that the wig salesperson was rushing them.

14.description: I don't actually know anything about how good this place is but it comforts me that if I really really really need a wig, I can get one nearby.

6.description: Went in yesterday to purchase extensions for my lady.  The place is like a subtle Home Depot of hair.  But the staff was VERY helpful to my needs.  Veronica especially!! She was great!!! I totally recommend this place for all hair needs!!

3.description: The rolls are good and they did a good job trying to accommodate me for being a vegetarian.  However they are a bit pricey and my miso soup was brought to me cold as they had forgotten to turn on the burner.  I wish them well, but I was a little disappointed.  I may go back and revise the review later though since they are just around the corner from me and I did enjoy the food that was the appropriate temperature.

1.description: Suddenly realized I had to bring dinner to a friend and wanted to do something new.  After being greeted warmly and walked through the options, I was fixed two giant dinner plates and a slice of peach cobbler to go, all for under $30.  The mac and cheese was GOOD, the steak and peppers over mashed potatoes was amazing, greens were good, and my non-vegetarian friend would not believe me that the meatballs in the spaghetti weren't beef.  The talk in the cafe indicates they're building a naturopathic dynasty on 73rd, too, with a garden and health clinic.  Yelp sucks, though, in that I had to search for this listing even after typing in the exact name of the place.

2.description: This spot has the right name! "Good foods". Whether you're into eating healthy or thinking about it, this is the place to start your journey.

5.description: Was suggested this place by my vegan friend, I liked all of the food, yummy, I went back  today for a lemonade slush =]

0.description: Made me feel right at home when I first walked in. Good homemade natural food for any vegan or health concise appetite.I would never had thought I would find a place like this in the area. This restaurant is a big plus around here. I found this lovely place while working a few blocks away and was looking for a healthy place to eat lunch besides fast food. Great food, service and conversations.... I will be back!

4.description: Shh....I've got a secret. Once again, my friends held out on me. My friend keeps talking about these tamales. She won't let her husband come home with out picking up these tamales.....So, I finally make it. The owner is very hands on. If you have dietary restrictions, let her know. They have entrées with sides(somewhat cafeteria style), sandwiches, salads, fresh juices, smoothies and desserts.  The tamales are pretty tasty, but I prefer the tamale pie. I have ordered a plate which can consist of a protein(beans, tofu), starch(rice, potatoes) and seasonal vegetables. Overall, the food is nicely seasoned and filling. The entrées rotate, while some foods(like the tamales) are staples.I also enjoyed the lemon and blueberry pies on my last visit. A little on the sweet side but delicious. She had gluten free cake which was also good.During my last visit, I had a kale salad which was made with kale, zucchini, raisins and a nut dressing.  It was a little on the spicy side. I also had the enchilada which was filled with veggie meat and rice and covered with a nut cheese. She has some other raw selections like the strawberry, coconut, sweet potato desserts.

58.description: Terrifically intimate place to enjoy live jazz. The owner is generous and has a great ear for talent!

56.description: What a find this was. Was strolling down Chicago lanes, getting ready to say good bye to my abode of 1 year..and what do I find ? A tucked away Jazz lounge..which turns out is almost 66 years old. Walked in right in time for a Jazz Matinee show by David Sanchez Quartet, from Mayaguez Peurto Rico. They were teriffic.We were instantly treated like one of their inner circle guests...Wayne Segal, the perfect host, made sure we were entertained as well as well attended to...with perfect wines to accompany the music.It is such a cozy atmosphere, getting to socialize with the artists and guests and have a very merry time. I am going to miss Chicago and I would definitely add this to my list of Chicago faves.Highly recommend :)

29.description: My first visit and definitely not my last. This small listening room resonates history -- walls covered with photos and posters of jazz greats who have performed here, a mishmash of antique upholstered settees and less-comfy chairs, and small round tables with candles. I wanted to send the large photo on the stage out for conservation and apply furniture polish to the abused legs of the Steinway but the feeling of being in the living room of someone who is not a great housekeeper has its charm.  The intimacy makes for wonderful sound and interaction with the performers. We were privileged to hear Benny Golson with three excellent sidemen. Mr. Golson's stories and delight with his colleagues and the music was pure joy to experience.

42.description: The only place I know where I can take my kids to hear live music on a Sunday afternoon.  We have heard top acts in a comfortable family friendly venue.  I love the Sunday matinees!

23.description: I love music. Our concierge recommended this place. The music is good. The service is okay. The cocktails were average but not worth the price. To end the evening I chose to have coffee, $3 per cup... Ridiculous! The music is worth the experience, but would I come back....probably not.

47.description: This is the best place in Chicago to to see the BIG Names in jazz up close and personal. There is not a bad seat in the house and the staff is always welcoming. If you love or even like jazz support this place as nothing in Chicago comes close to the Jazz Showcase.

8.description: Wonderful venue for jazz.Saw Jodi Roberts who took requests from the audience (just no Miley Cyrus :-(). She was absolutely amazing. The people are chill AND the couches are nice. What more can you ask for?
