The goat-cheese flan alone is worth the trip! My husband also raved about his jambalaya. He finished the etouffée entree in short order, pronouncing it "very good," and I also enjoyed my crab-encrusted catfish. For dessert, my husband said the peach cobbler was among the best he'd had, and my banana bread pudding was good as well, although just a bit on the dry side. Maybe more sauce would have helped? We also enjoyed a couple of the signature cocktails, the Parrot Martini and the Pineapple Martini.  Overall, I would give the food and service and solid 4 stars, while the beauty of the location rates a 5. We will make an effort to return... the Wednesday prix fixe is a great value!

19.description: went to the Sunday Jazz Brunch in April and it was AWESOME!!!the variety of entrees and breakfast foods was beautifully displayed, the omelet and carving stations gave fast service, and the staff were very attentive.  The highlight of course was the live entertainment , both inside the dining room and the Harold Washington College Jazz Combo in the lobby!  Worth every penny!  (The only downside is you have to feed the parking meters in the lot...OUTRAGEOUS.)  We have dined for dinner during the week and the food and service were top notch.  check out both experiences and try their variety of dinner entrees.

33.description: We took the family to brunch here.  What a great deal.  With the 10% added grattuity, 8 drinks for 5 of us, the bill was only $110.  Again, service is unsophisticated but food is excellent.

2.description: We have dined at The Parrot Cage a number of  times in the past and have even used it as an interesting venue for entertaining clients and colleages. However, our experience this past Saturday evening was such a profound disappointment on so many levels that we shall never return. The menu has been dumbed down to cafeteria-grade entrees bearing no resemblance to the menu posted online; the atmosphere has also been degraded to that of a cafeteria with bright lighting and excessively loud music; and the service was completeky untrained. The Parrot Cage is but a shadow of its former self. It no longer represents a palletable culinary experience much less a good value. The proof is in the pudding--the dining room was nearly empty. There were only three other tables seated. That speaks volumes.

34.description: Hate to do it, but it must be done: Had dinner here tonight and the service and the food was awful. I think the concept of the restaurant and the fact that culinary students are working there is great. But they have a long way to go toward making the experience an enjoyable and professional one and taking constructive criticism in order to improve.Our service was lackluster and paint-dry slow. When the food finally came my salmon was overcooked and the bed of rice accompanying it was undercooked. The server tried to tell me that  the texture was supposed to be that way because it was "sticky rice" but it wasn't. It was just bad, gritty, undercooked rice. My nephew's "well-done" steak was pretty much burnt to a crisp. The roasted tomato soup was a standout but that's about it.We tried telling our server the meal about little things -- forgotten beverages, slow service, etc. and it was met with "we're students and at the end of the night we're just trying to get an A." No real effort to try to make the service any better.Well, tonight, nobody there, from the rude hostess to the slow server to the indifferent manager should get an A.. I wish the restaurant and its students well but professionalism can't be sacrificed in the learning process. This is my second experience here and my second time being utterly underwhelmed. I'd love to say that this place is a diamond in the rough, but right now it's far more rough than diamond.

32.description: Amosphere:B+Service:B+Food:C+The restaurant is located inside the South Shore Cultural Center. The entrance of SSCC has well manicured lawns and a curve driveway, however the parking lot is not paved, full of pot holes & gravel. There was another event taking place, when we arrived. We felt odd, like party crashers in search of the Parrot Cage, which is to the left of the entrance.  The small restaurant has high ceiling with a parrot cage in the middle of the room. There are huge windows on one side, in view of the lakefront, which makes this a nice setting for a romantic dinner. I noticed a balcony facing the lakefront, not sure if this is open during the summer. Our waiter was pleasant. The menu was pleasingly simple. I ordered the Baked Catfish Fillet with stuffed crab, served with rice and spinach. While waiting on our order, we were served a choice of several types of bread. The sour dough bread was soft and delicious, but the pretzel shape bread with the sesame seeds was hard as cement.The fillet was a generous piece, undercooked in the middle and missing the stuff crab. I was so disappointed, since I'm a seafood lover. I'm guessing the sauce on top of the fish was crab sauce. The yellow rice was ok, nothing out the ordinary, aside from the kids meal serving. The texture of the cooked spinach was fine, but it tasted AWFUL......plain, blanched taste. It would have been better if a butter or cream sauce of some kind was served on top.  The soup sampler (chicken, turtle and pea soup), served in 3 tea cup size portions. The chicken soup was delicious, plenty of vegtables and season just right. The pea soup was nothing short of evaporated milk mix together with whole peas.....NOT good at all. I didn't have the nerve to taste the turtle soup, my party said it was good! I will return and give them another test and perhaps try the desserts.

18.description: I got a red velvet cupcake from their booth at the taste of chicago.  Dropped it right in front of them and they didn't even give me another. Sure it's at the Taste but the point of this yearly event is to promote your establishment. Thiscustomer service reflects poorly on the restaurant and of course I will never taste that cupcake so I really have no reason to remember this place.  Really, how much would it cost for you to get a customer another mini-cupcake?  FAIL.

13.description: Went here with hubby for the 87.7FM Sunday Brunch.  I thought the food was pretty good, my favorite was the Jambalaya, my least favorite was the dressing aka Stuffing. I loved the ambiance, and the building which has an old southern charm to it, not to mention our family used to visit the park in general for the 80's committee picnics when I was a youngin.  I would recommend Parrot Cage to others because it helps support the culinary school, and it's students which did an awesome job at cooking.  The service was great.  The "Noteworthy Band" was wonderful.  If you're ever in the area, I would recommend you give this place a try.

4.description: Pricey but one of the best breakfast buffets on the south side. Ample "free" parking is a plus and the eating area is quaint and airy. Wait staff was very friendly as well and they catered 2 special requests.

24.description: I chose this restaurant because of its name (The Parrot Cage ... ridiculous and awesome?) and because it's part of a culinary school, which usually leads to good and cheaper results. Also BYOB. ($5 corkage fee)The setting is amazing. It's in the South Shore Cultural Center, which is right on Lake Michigan and a beautiful old building. It's a bit of a hike from the North side, but worth it.The service is a little slow (as is the crowd in general, lots of older people), but the food is great and the staff is so friendly and nice. And it's always fun to support students. They start with this delicious seed-bread? I'm not great with tastes (or memory - it's been almost three years since I've been there), but it was bread with some seeds in it or something. Whatever, it was great. Since I'm boring, I always ordered the salmon, but that was GREAT and obviously I liked it enough that I continued to return there and order it.It's also a fun date place.

6.description: Let me preface this review by saying that on another occasion, I had a most delightful experience at The Parrot Cage...such was NOT the case yesterday, and unfortunately it was Mother's Day!The Brunch Buffet was HORRIBLE ...and that's putting it mildly! Had it not been for the wonderful atmosphere and the company we were with, it would have been a COMPLETE disaster. From no plates, to cold food, to NO food, to JAMES BROWN serenading us after the Jazz Quartet packed up BEFORE the last guest departed, the EXPERIENCE was definitely memorable, but in the WRONG way. Perhaps the students need to stick to fine dining, because they flunked at buffet. As I mentioned before, my previous experience at The Parrot Cage was wonderful, but that was fine dining and not buffet. Perhaps they should stick to fine dining until the buffet is better tuned for the public!

22.description: Went here with hubby for the 87.7FM Sunday Brunch.  I thought the food was pretty good, my favorite was the Jambalaya, my least favorite was the dressing aka Stuffing. I loved the ambiance, and the building which has an old southern charm to it, not to mention our family used to visit the park in general for the 80's committee picnics when I was a youngin.  I would recommend Parrot Cage to others because it helps support the culinary school, and it's students which did an awesome job at cooking.  The service was great.  The "Noteworthy Band" was wonderful.  If you're ever in the area, I would recommend you give this place a try.

15.description: What a unique and interesting dining experience!The Parrot Cage restaurant is the kitchen and stomping grounds of a culinary school, but you hardly notice and the food and service are wonderful!  The restaurant is located in the gorgeous South Shore Cultural center/country club that I now want to research.We were seated at a table with a lovely view of the lake and our server greeted us quickly.  The wine list is small, but all of the glasses are offered for $6 and the bottles are all $24.  The menu includes a wide variety of items and you can choose anything you want for the prix fixe menu, which is $30 (we lucked out and got it for $19 because there was a special promotion).We started with the shrimp and grits and the crawfish soup.  The soup was hearty and spicy and the grits were TO DIE FOR.  If this place was not so hard for us to get to than I would return often for these.  For our entrees we had the salmon and the steak.  The salmon was nicely prepared, however the steak had a lot of fat on it.  For dessert we had the banana bread pudding and the cookie sundae.  The cookie was impressive as it was freshly baked in a hot skillet, however it did not taste quite as good as it looked.Overall, I would give the food three stars, however I bumped it up to four as the venue was just so impressive.The check is a little strange here are they charge an automatic 10% gratuity.  I added an additional 10% on top of this (to make it 20%) but then when I asked my server about it, she said that the 10% gratuity was actually for a scholarship and did not go to her so I am not sure if you are supposed to add 20% on top of the 10% already included....THE FACTS:Prix-fixe is $30 on Wednesday and Thursday night (anything on the menu)Corkage is $5There is a 10% gratuity/scholarship added to your bill

7.description: The Parrot Cage is a hidden gem in the South Shore community inside of the historic South Shore Cultural Center.  This restaurant is ran by the Washburn Culinary School (Kennedy King College).  The students provide a 5 star dining experience on a dime.  The ambiance is breathtaking and is the perfect place for alfresco dining with the view of Lake Michigan in the background.  This is a perfect date spot and best of all, they offer BYOB for a small corking fee.  Please note that seating is by reservations only.

8.description: I went to The Parrot Cage for the second time yesterday for Sunday brunch.  They have changed their brunch offerings since I was there last.  Much improved! The setting is just beautiful.  If you haven't been to the historic South Shore Cultural Center I'd highly recommend going.  The restaurant itself is decorated in a very charming way with, as you can imagine, lots of parrot related decorations.  Our server was very attentive,  refilling our glasses before they were even empty.  They had made to order omlettes and waffles.  They also had a a beautiful turkey breast cut to order.  They also had the usual offerings of bacon, sausages, salads, fried chicken.   It looked like that there is an outdoor dining area just outside for warm weather dining.  I'll be back in summer!After brunch we sat in the lobby looking out the windows at the lakefront and took out our I Pad and Googled images of the South Shore Country Club and looked at dozens of old pictures of the space when it used to be a fancy members only country club.  The Park District has done a very good job restoring it.  We walked outside around the grounds after brunch.  This place is truly amazing.  Definitely worth the drive down Lake Shore Drive.

30.description: I had dinner there on a Thursday night and I thought everything was great. I had been there for brunch previously and thought both the food and service was awful so it took some convincing to get me back there. But I am always looking for interesting dining on the southside and we all know how difficult that can be! At any rate, the man who created the Parrot Cage was on hand to show us a great time. He was knowledgeable, unpretentious, and committed to providing great food to a community starved for it. The fact that the restaurant is a training ground for Washburne Culinary students is great. Plus, you don't have to tip them because they are students and they've incorporated 10% gratuity to the bill. Everyone was exceptionally nice and attentive. I would definitely go back. The food was also very good. I had the butternut squash soup and the catfish entree. I enjoyed them both. This place needs some more foot traffic. Please check it out!!

3.description: Parrot Cage February 13, 2015Valentine's Disappointment--Still a B+ for the StudentsWOW! What a difference a year makes. In my February 13, 2014 review I wrote: "Six of us went to dinner at the Parrot Cage for a GREAT night out. ... An adequate wine list that was reasonably priced. Culinary students run this place? Really? Bon Appetite!" What an ABOUT FACE for my experience on February 13, 2015. My experience last night warrants an overall grade B+ (down from the A+ I issued in 2011): Our Waiter Alex gets an A+++; the Hostess a D; the Manager a C+; and the Chef a B. Allow me to explain why the adults in the front of the house hurt the students' grade, and why our experience was somewhat disappointing.First and foremost, our 2014 experience lead to exceedingly high expectations for 2015. They recently remodeled and I was concerned they might not open in time for our dinner. Despite speaking to the hostess/manager/staff three times in the six weeks prior to this dining experience, including on the day of our dinner, not once did they bother to mention the major development of no longer having a valid liquor license--it's BYOB now. Literally 10 minutes before my 5 guest arrived I had to drive to 71st & Jeffery - in the hood - to purchase three bottles of the most average wine imaginable. I probably should not have been surprised when the hostess had an attitude with me because I politely expressed my displeasure with not having been told of this development. Her "bad behavior" was consistent with my previous experience there. In a review of Parrot Cage that I wrote on June 5, 2011, I stated: "A relatively rude manager/hostess, and a pedestrian wine list, did not overshadow the otherwise outstanding front-of-the house service from these culinary students, and an exceptional very diverse menu with exceedingly well-prepared food by the back of the house." With regard to the food, my comments are generally the same as in my 2011 and 2014 reviews, although I had to send my steak back. I ordered medium rare, they delivered well-done. The second version was medium-well, but as everyone else had eaten, I ate the center of the steak and we moved on to the decadent dessert course. Our waiter Alex, and the other servers were the BEST aspect of the evening, other than the exceptional company of my guests.The most disappointing aspect of the evening was how much the ambience of this establishment has changed since it was remodeled last month. By removing the carpet (now tiled floors), drapes (no window treatments at all), and wallpaper (it was due to be changed), and adding bright lighting, they not only eviscerated the quaint and almost romantic aspect of the room, but the place is now loud. That does not excuse the rude old man who conned his way into a free meal, from interrupting our dinner to tell us to "quiet down." Next year he won't have to worry about our group--we'll be at La Petite Folie where we started to go this year! Let me close by saying that if you chose to dine there, and I plan to, it's best for couples only. Large groups will resonate too loudly. By the way, did I mention that I'd give Alex an A+++

14.description: Not a huge reviewer, but had to comment on this place. First of all, I've been going to the South Shore Cultural Center since I was a little boy. I spent many a year in their summer camp program. I though it was an awesome place then, and I think the facility is an awesome place now. The views (when it's not pouring rain, like last night) are wonderful and the overall atmosphere is just great.With that said, the Parrot Cage received 4 stars from me. The food was excellent (I had the Pan Seared Tilapia), our server was nice and attentive and even apologetic when my Aunt's fish was a little too spicy for her tastes and couldn't be redone for her. She even went the extra mile to not charge my Aunt for the drink that she had.  My biggest complaint however, is that it took what felt like 5 years for us to get our food after we ordered. I never knew it took that long to cook what was a majority of fish dishes. However, the plating of each dish in my opinion was really nice.I've read a few harsh reviews about the restaurant here and the only think I can think of is that because they are students, maybe they rotate out and you don't have the same people there every year, because everyone was pleasant from the moment we walked into the door to the minute we walked out.

1.description: wonders what idiot runs this place, why do you only have two lines open in the days leading up to thankgiving. you have a store full of people two cashiers and no smoked oysters. this place sucks !

0.description: I think that it is unfortunate that many Aldi's that are not in the suburbs don't get the same resources.Now, I don't know if they have different independent owners or if they are all under one Umbrella, what I do know I have and I will continue to shop at Aldi's although they are not as reasonable as they once were but they are still not as expensive as Jewels or Dominicks!There is nothing like being a line that is almost to the back of the store and they only have one or two cashiers available!I also wish they had a express line where if you have ten items or less you could check out there instead of standing behind someone who has two carts of food and you just have a handful of stuff.I know that's just a dream when they don't have enough cashiers right now to handle the customers.Let me say this though other than my problems that I listed earlier the cashiers, the managers at this location has always been friendly to me...I don't have a problem with them or the cleanliness of the store!Aldi also doesn't take credit cards but they will accept your debit card!

3.description: Great customer service from knowledgeable practioners. I've found a new place to shop.

1.description: I've been going to this place for years and I have yet to have a bad experience. They are very helpful and extremely knowledgeable about their products and about improving your hair. So they have given the best product selections. Everything I have bought from them actually worked like they told me it would. Great place to go!!

2.description: I agree with all.  I went in once last summer to do a haul of hair products before moving to Portland and I experienced the best customer service I have experienced on Chicago's South side than I can ever remember in all my life.  Instead, of re-stocking my products on the internet, I will be making a stop to Jordan's on my next trip! Great staff, please keep up the excellent work!

5.description: Their service is great and their choice of quality products are unbeatable. Whenever I need professional hair products Jordan's Beauty Supply is the place for me. You can't go wrong here they have everything you need from products to ceu classes.

6.description: Jordan's is hands down the best beauty supply in Chicago.  The staff is friendly and extremely knowledgable about all of their products.

0.description: Hello!  BLACK OWNED  BEAUTY SUPPLY!  And staff actually trained in the products?  And an incredible range of products, including many that are usually only available at salons?Paydirt, people!  There's a new location west, as well, but this is worth the trip.

4.description: I often get overwhelmed when I walk into this beauty supply because there are such a wide variety of products. As a cosmetology student or professional, you get a huge discount and you save so much money rather than going to your neighborhood beauty supply. They sell dozens of professional brands and their customer service is great as well. Oh yea, they offer classes to students and professionals. I effin' LOVE this place!  :)

3.description: I don't know  what happened.  The last two visits to this establishment left my palate in a meloncholly state. The beef fried rice was heavy,dark, and overcooked. The beef egg foo yung was stringy and had an unpleasant after taste. I can not believe this is the same cook. The quality of the food was very disappointing. I can no longer recommend this eatery.

1.description: I've been there a couple of times, and the food is ok, not bad, but had better. The good thing is,They also give you more for your money

2.description: It has been a few months since I have been to Ming Chop Suey and it isn't the best but it isn't the worst!I come here when I have a taste for Chinese but my pocketbook isn't saying I can go where I really want to go!So, it satisfies my craving for less!

5.description: I'm not sure what happened with the other reviewers, but I've always had nothing but great food and service at Ming's.  I LOVE their eggrolls!  I usually get the Beef and Broccoli or Chicken and Broccoli and it's always delish!  The Crab Rangoon is tasty as well.

6.description: Way too expensive and a flavor miss.

0.description: We come here often. Carry-out only; but the service is quick. The food is underrated because it's the best Chinese food than anywhere else near here.  Caution -- cash only.

4.description: Chop Suey Fooey!There is something strange about ordering my food and five minutes later its done. I should have thought twice about this place. I took the meal anyway. How can anyone botch chicken and broccoli anyway? Well, They did. The end.

0.description: This is my preferred hardware store, and it's in the South Shore community.  They are the third generation in the same location.  I am striving to be Green, and they have what I need for my bungalow restoration, including low VOC paint.  They also will cut shades to order, fix windows and screens, and have lots of gardening supplies, all at great prices.  Everyone in the store is very knowledgeable and more than willing to answer any of your questions.  If you want excellent customer service, you won't be disappointed.

Barbershop on 1 side...Beauty shop on the other side...Its usually 3-4 barbers there daily (Tues-Saturday), so when you go in ask for Dave, Lamar or Rich and they will hook you up.  Fades, Afros, they can do it all.  Inexpensive too. It can get loud so if you aren't used to going to a neighborhood barbershop or traditionally go to Supercuts, stay away.  Its a barbershop so you are liable to see and hear all types of things.   But if you are used to that type of setting, head in.  Make sure whoever cuts you up, to grab there number later for future appts to avoid waits especially on Saturdays. CASH ONLY!!!!!

3.description: I just picked up a pizza that is so disgusting that it is going straight into the trash. I specifically asked for the pizza to be well-done/overcooked, and instead it is undercooked, including pieces of uncooked bacon. I requested extra sauce and do not appear to have gotten it. I ordered a 3-topping pizza: pepperoni, bacon, and extra cheese. It has extra cheese, almost NO pepperoni, and the most disgusting bacon I have ever had on a pizza.This is the single worst pizza experience I have had in 8 years living in Chicago.

1.description: I like this place, not the 5 star pizza place but it is great for the price!!!The chicken wings aren't that great anymore that's why I took away a star...they taste old and I even called and complained they gave me another order and it was then when I realized they must have gone for a cheaper company to get there products because it was like so gross...My grand daughter loves the cheese sticks and I have to admit I do too!!!I am also glad that when you order and get it delivered they have your food to you in less than an hour!!!I like placing my order online!!!I had to tell one driver though to come to my door and not to call me to come to the street to pick up my home delivery...I had to inform him this is not street delivery but home delivery and he still thought he was going to get a great tip if I had to come down my stairs and walk to his car....um no!!!When my funds are low and I'm looking for some acceptable pizza Papa Johns is the place to go!!!

2.description: I've enjoyed the PJ pizza product ever since my college days in Florida. I was very happy to see PJ move into my neighborhood. I am especially proud that the service here is better than I've had in other locations in Chicago. The only time I had trouble is with the restaurant.com coupon that made a deal more expensive than if I just used their in store special. But that's OK because their price is fair and the management treats me with respect. They have gotten to know my name from my online orders and when they made a mistake on my last order they corrected it quickly without requiring me to bring the original pizza back to prove that they missed an ingredient (like the South Loop location did).I am treated here with the respect I deserve as their customer even through their jobs must be very tedious.

5.description: This place is a hot ass mess. The first time I ordered from here I got to the store just to be told they gave my pizza to someone else by accident and they hadn't started remaking MY pizza yet. Then as I waiting the employees started cussing each other out and screaming at the top of their lungs at each other about who's fault it was. i asked for the shift manager and apparently one of the people in the altercation was the shift lead manager. mmm super professional. I asked for the number to corporate, got my pizza and left.The 2nd time I ordered delivery which was a pretty decent speed but when they called to tell us they were downstairs they called the old number so it rang my boyfriends phone and luckily he was home with me to answer it. I get downstairs and the delivery guy goes, "he said you could just put the tip on there." What a damn liar. For one I paid with MY card and I was standing next to my boyfriend the whole time. His ass was just trying to be greedy. Super unprofessional. The last time I ordered from here try got my order wrong. I got pepperoni and bacon but instead they have me pepperoni and banana peppers which I would never eat. I called back and spoke with the actual store manager who said he could resend the pizza or credit me. I asked him to resend the pizza. He said that was fine and let me keep the mistake pizza as well. Everything was fine until 5 minutes later when they called and told me they'd only bring the correct pizza if I paid the delivery fee again because in his exact words "i wont be making any money off of this" Wtf? I should have gotten the correct pizza the first time. I'm not paying a fee because you guys screwed up. Get real. They also said if I didn't pay it they wanted the pizza they messed up on back. By that time my boyfriend had already dug in so I got pissed asked for corporate and he sai never mind that he would send a driver and hung up.This location is as unprofessional as unprofessional gets. They're greedy and will attempt to get over on you if you let them.  Safe to say I'm done ordering from here. 3 strikes and you're out and rarely am I ever that nice.

6.description: SO happy we found this place! Excellent service, FAST delivery, and the pizza was really good! I will definitely order from here again. I am reading the other complaints and it makes me laugh. Its called customer service!! Would you rather them NOT call and you're waiting for hours? I would LOVE for someone to call when they are on the way, so you can come down and meet them if you are in an apt building, etc. And Italian Fiesta IS good, but you have to acknowledge that there are other pizza places that are just as good or even better. Welcome to South Shore Papa Johns!!

7.description: It is so awesome that we have a Papa Johns pizza in Southshore. I also love how efficient ordering on the iPhone app is. The staff is always nice and there are always great specials available. My food has always been great.  While Papa Johns cant compare to Italian Fiesta in regards to taste, it is SOOOO much cheaper.  Not sure why all of the negative reviews.

8.description: Man, I haven't had Papa Johns in Years! I now know why... poor quality, very basic and not so tasty. It's cheap, and that 's all I can say, I'd rather have cheap Pizza Hut than cheap PJ's. Plus once youve had an Italian Fiesta Pizza, nothing, I mean NOTHING compares.

9.description: the delivery drivers seriously call WAY too much! just call when u get here.  that's it! they call when they are leaving papa john's, 2 mins away and when they are outside.  so ridiculous.

0.description: I ordered several pizzas from Papa Johns for a kid birthday party. All of the pizzas were yummy except one but that's because someone ordered badly. Somethings aren't good together on pizza.  You guys delivered promptly,  the pizzas were hot. The kids ate them up like piranhas. We were able to feed alot of folks and not break the bank. Thanks for making the birthday party awesome. Your garlic butter is SO YUMMY!!!

4.description: I thought I would try this store. I had a restaurant.com certificate and they refused to honor. So I'm out of money because it was only good for this store. If you do not want to fully participate get out of the program

1.description: I recently went to Tj Nails to get a pedicure the service was mediocre, they weren't personable or friendly.  The nail tech engage in continuous conversation in her native language with other coworker/family member, that did not bother me as much as her eagerness to just get my money; the only time she spoke to me was to pay my bill before the service was completed.  I also purchased a pair of sandals to wear out of the salon mind you, the sandals were literally unraveling  and coming apart on my feet the same day.  I took the defected sandals back to the salon and explained that I bought them the day before however they refused to exchange the shoes nor would they  give me my money back.  There was just no respect and bad customer service.  I would never go back there again.

0.description: Frankly speaking, they suck in just about everything but eyebrows. Seriously, I live down the street and the one time I got my nails done by them they damn near ripped off my skin, nail polish didn't take long to start peeling, overall never go there for nails. Please save your money. Celine's nails is a place I would suggest that is much better, if anyone would like one. And if you're thinking I'm promoting them, I'm not. I just think for the Chicagoland area and good pricing they almost can't be beat.

58.description: Over rated tourist atraction!! The guy working the door was very rude!  He acted entitled like he didn't want our business. He said there was standing room only and we should just leave. We later came back once again feeling unwelcomed. We asked to speak to the manager who was also extremely rude! Do NOT go here!

56.description: Great authentic jazz, perfect atmosphere, go after dinner. Can't comment on the food.

29.description: Solid Jazz club in the heart of North Side Chicago, which is a great part of the city.  The vibe was exactly what I was looking for, mellow yet fun.  I went on a Monday so it wasn't packed at all.  Cover was $10, which is what it is for the week ($15 for the weekend).  There was a great band with several trumpet players taking turns.  Kinda of a rehearsal vibe, which I actually liked, given that it was a relaxing Monday.  They did get into it however, so don't think you won't hear some great music.  The stage is large for the room and central, so you will get a great view anywhere you sit.  The bar is right next to the entrance so on packed nights that might be a minor issue, but the bar was very large and the bartenders were friendly and prompt.  Stiff pours also and I found the drink prices to be very reasonable.  I could have sat there all night!  Check the website for times but I believe they have live music nightly.  I didn't try the food but it did look good.  If I'm back in town I would definitely go back and probably get dinner as well.  Go check out some live jazz...you will be glad you did!

42.description: Its a good place - just that the unless you're eating you have to sit at the bar which has an indirect view of the stage.. also the cover charge is a bit annoying.. staff and music were good though

23.description: Stumbled in here for the first time on aThursday night @ 9:30, a ten dollar cover gets you in. This spot was actually mentioned to me by a random local who I met at a bar. Luckily we were able to find a few seats available at the bar, we were immediately greeted and ordered manhattans, which were wonderful. Got a burger which was also great, egg was overcooked, but no other complaints. Unfortunately, I did not get the names of the bands who played but I remembered the woman's name was Opal. The jazz was awesome, fully enjoyed the instrumentals and when the singer popped on, it was even better. After a guy went on the mic and did a little rapping to the music. It was great. One thing I didn't love, was there wasn't any standing room, just a bunch of packed out dining tables. I like to move to the music and I kind of had to hide in the back next to an empty table. I still had a blast and even snagged a shirt as a souvenir.

47.description: Bad service. Ignored by the bartender to the point where the Manager came over so we could cash out. The one star is for the musicians and door guy.

8.description: I had a burning feeling in my stomach after having the meal deal of the Restaurant week. The waitress was terrible. I'm allergic to certain food and she said she can't do anything and they can't substitute it with anything. She hasn't even asked the chef or whoever is in charge. We reserved table for two and they took us to the table right by the stage that's not a good sit for pregnant me. Speaking of the waitress no food was recommended by her and only because of the service i'm giving 1 star. Very poor servicing.

31.description: My husband and I went here on our last night in Chicago and it was a great experience. We went on a Monday night and it was $10 cover each to get in, but well worth it. The Jazz band that played was wonderful. The food was also surprisingly delicious. We got the lamb and shrimp risotto and a bottle of wine.

34.description: Food was surprisingly good for a club.  We had the Ruben and Cajun shrimp risotto- both very good.  Music was great and our server Ty was awesome! A fun night on the town.

16.description: Stumbled in here for the first time on aThursday night @ 9:30, a ten dollar cover gets you in. This spot was actually mentioned to me by a random local who I met at a bar. Luckily we were able to find a few seats available at the bar, we were immediately greeted and ordered manhattans, which were wonderful. Got a burger which was also great, egg was overcooked, but no other complaints. Unfortunately, I did not get the names of the bands who played but I remembered the woman's name was Opal. The jazz was awesome, fully enjoyed the instrumentals and when the singer popped on, it was even better. After a guy went on the mic and did a little rapping to the music. It was great. One thing I didn't love, was there wasn't any standing room, just a bunch of packed out dining tables. I like to move to the music and I kind of had to hide in the back next to an empty table. I still had a blast and even snagged a shirt as a souvenir.

13.description: This is such a great place.  Not because of its surprisingly decent food, the acceptable availability and good music groups performing, it is because of the nice combination of all of this and more.  The menu is not bad at all with options for everyone ( including our vegetarian friends) and fair prices.  Not sure why they need the cover fee, I would rather pay for more drinks, get happier and enjoy the show even more.  A win-win. Isn't it? A Recommended dinner and a show duo.

11.description: Went to celebrate my friend's birthday. It was a disappointment from the moment we walked in. We had to pay a $15 cover although we had a dinner reservation. That left a bad taste in my mouth. Our server was unattentive. We had to flag him down everytime we wanted another drink or to order additional appetizers. The food was just okay. Nothing spectacular and quite on the pricey side. Overall our bill was $300 on top of having to pay $15 cover. The bands were awesome though which is why 2 stars.

39.description: Honestly I want to give this place a higher review because the music is good and genuine. However the staff makes you feel very uncomfortable unless it's apparent you'll be spending $200 or more. My boyfriend and I dropped $100 on one small pizza and a VERY small bottle of wine and our waitress was nowhere to be found. Quite a shame since the talent of the musical staff is being wasted on very bad service.

37.description: I recently had an experience at this very Club. I felt like everyone on the staff was very attentive. The food was amazing and the drinks flowed when the cups were emptied. It reminded me of a club at 606 mill, or course I miss the people at the latter club but sure enough of you give the former club the time it grows on you like a bamboo tree. I suggest the Bloody Mary and miller light starter it was a great conversation starter. We added the spicy chicken wings again they were a seasoned perfectly. I would suggest giving this place a chance of you are in town the music is great with sets and breaks enough to enjoy the food and your company. It's not a snobby Jazz Club either you can actually have soft conversations without being asked to leave. I wish I had more time to tell you about the rest of my experience but I think the 5 stars can help you figure out what I would say.

0.description: I have recently really started to appreciate Jazz and would have to say I've become a little obsessed with America's classical music. Along with the blues, its forefather, it is one of the first truly indigenous music's to develop in America. I have been excited to experience the Jazz club scene since I have moved here from south Florida but I couldn't find anyone that was truly interested in going and checking out the scene until one of my friends was in town for a business trip and he just so happened to be a little obsessed with it himself and was actually in a Jazz band when he was younger. So it was game on from that point and just needed to find the right place!  I saw that Andy's had great reviews so we decided to check it out. It was a Thursday night and we arrived at around 6:30 and they told us the entree fee would be $15 a person. My friend gave him his credit card but the guy said that they only accept cash for the entree fee. So we had to dig around for cash or go across the street to the ATM.  They also told us that there was a 2 hour limit but did say that if they were not packed then we could stay longer. I thought the fact that they only take cash for the entree and that there was a 2 hour limit was quit odd but was still staying very optimistic to try this out. Since we were the first to arrive we had our choice of where we wanted to sit so we choose right up front in the middle of the action for the dinner and show. My friend ordered the Moscow mule to and was served in the traditional copper mug (I had a few sips and have to say it was one of the best I've had) I ordered my usual Dirty Martini but had to send it back to be fixed because it wasn't dirty enough but they hit it right on the nose the 2nd try. We decided to skip the appetizer and go straight for the entrée. We both were thinking about the Cajun Shrimp Risotto but we decided to order one and then the Mustard Crested Halibut for a little variety. By this time the band was setting up and our entrée's came out right when the music was starting. It was perfect timing!! The Cajun Shrimp was so so but the Halibut was absolutely amazing!  We sat there and allowed the drinks to flow as we enjoyed the company of an old friend and the energy of Chicago earthy grooves of soulful jazz. We were tapping our feet to the speedy, hard hitting rhythms of be-bop jittery, atonal forays of free jazz. I felt like I was in heaven. We stayed long past the 2 hours and they never said a word. The server was very attentive It was an amazing experience and was very pleased with my first experience in a Jazz club!

38.description: Service was excellent!! Good music, management was very attentive to our needs. I highly recommend for a great night out with friends.Best Bloody Mary in Chicago!!

51.description: The club scene was awesome.  Jazz band was on point and everyone had a blat.  If I had one complaint it's that there specialty cocktails weren't anything to brag about

27.description: We went last night with a group of friends. We were all from out of town and one of our crowd has a brother who's local and he accompanied us. The music was great. The quartet that was playing was excellent and could have used a vocalist. The service, however, was terrible. We had to beg for menus and water and it took 3 hours to get food. I won't be returning when I visit Chicago again, no matter who's playing.

32.description: So I was visiting from out of town. I was solo for dinner so I thought I would check this place out. The cover was listed as $10 on Thursdays but when I entered, it was $15 bc of a spotlight band. Okay, that's a minor ding, so whatever. I sit down at the bar, which has plenty of space and the band sounds good. The drink selection is good and the bartenders are friendly. I ordered some wings to start and then a few minutes later the bartender took my menu. I told her that I wanted to order a burger too, so she asked which one and took my menu. As I am waiting I look around the bar and it is all old people. And when I say old, I mean 70 plus. I felt out of place. 10 minutes later I have a burger, but my wings never came out. I figure they forgot my wings so I ate he burger and then 15 min later my wings come out. At this point, I really don't want the wings but feel obligated to pay for them. Overall, a nice place but not sure I would go back, at least for a solo meal. The food quality was good and the place seemed clean.

54.description: Band was talented. Best "Old Fashioned" I've ever had. Service was great throughout the whole house. Cover charge is steep.

48.description: The music here was fantastic! Great musicians!The food and drinks were very good and reasonably priced. The service was ok at best, they were really busy so it took a long time to get any service, and then once we did it took a while to get anything that we ordered.

44.description: Went to Andy's to see Marquis Hill - didn't have reservations but, got lucky with an amazing table & I wasn't expecting the food to be so great!  Ordered the jambalaya with duck!  OMG!  So good!  Marquis Hill & his band were amazing & so was the entire evening!!!  Would have gotten 5 stars if we knew that dinner reservations were an absolute must.

24.description: The music was nice but given the reputation and reviews, I expected much more.  Don't come here for the food.  There really should be crab in the crab cakes.  Service was pleasant and attentive but couldn't make up for the lackluster atmosphere.

7.description: Solid Jazz club in the heart of North Side Chicago, which is a great part of the city.  The vibe was exactly what I was looking for, mellow yet fun.  I went on a Monday so it wasn't packed at all.  Cover was $10, which is what it is for the week ($15 for the weekend).  There was a great band with several trumpet players taking turns.  Kinda of a rehearsal vibe, which I actually liked, given that it was a relaxing Monday.  They did get into it however, so don't think you won't hear some great music.  The stage is large for the room and central, so you will get a great view anywhere you sit.  The bar is right next to the entrance so on packed nights that might be a minor issue, but the bar was very large and the bartenders were friendly and prompt.  Stiff pours also and I found the drink prices to be very reasonable.  I could have sat there all night!  Check the website for times but I believe they have live music nightly.  I didn't try the food but it did look good.  If I'm back in town I would definitely go back and probably get dinner as well.  Go check out some live jazz...you will be glad you did!

49.description: $15 cover. Less than professional acousticsMusic is in audible from the bar seatsSo .. It's not a good place to visit if you are here for the music

40.description: Went there while visiting Chicago with my husband on a combined business/vacation trip.  Food was excellent. I had roast chicken with mashed potatoes and fresh broccoli.  The chicken was moist, tasty and perfectly cooked.  The potatoes were smooth and delicious, and were not obscured by garlic, too much cream/butter, or any other miscellaneous additions.  For a mashed potato minimalist, they were perfect.  Fresh broccoli was a generous serving, cooked perfectly--not too crunchy and not at all mushy.  My husband had Duck Breast Jumbalaya, which he thought was very tasty and had a "nice spicy kick to it."

53.description: Bottom line, poor to mediocre customer service.First, we are expected to pay a $20/person cover charge + 2 drink minimum. Fine, that can be excused as the music played here is definitely something I am not used to, and is a level above that which is played at most bars.However:We were told by the hostess after paying a large amount of money to get in that we had to wait for seating until people sitting at the bar cleared out, or until another table was cleared. To be fair, she did get us seated soon after a table opened up. However, this should have been made known to us before admittance.The server asked us what we wanted to drink, pointing at the menu. No sooner do we look up to answer his questions than he walks away. Also, the server failed to remember who ordered what as far as drinks at a table of three.I am not usually picky about idiosyncrasies such as this, but at a place that apparently tries to classify itself as an upscale restaurant, this is unacceptable.The three of us got a dessert. It was okay, nothing incredible.I'm not sure when I'll be back to Chicago, but I do know I'll be finding a different jazz/blues bar. Maybe one that also notices when it is my birthday.

30.description: Had an excellent time here on a Thursday night with friends. I love moscato d'asti and it is rather hard to find a place that has it. This place had it and that made my night. The jazz music was amazing and we were seated right by the band. Highly recommend you stop in to see some amazing musicians. Just an FYI there was a cover and a two drink minimum.

46.description: Awful service.  1 star for the talented musicians.  The blonde, tattooed bartender went out of her way to ignore us.  She refused to take our money because she was busy pouring someone else's water.  She was also wearing very inappropriate attire, something the bar claims to enforce. $10 cover an hour before the show was also inexcusable.  Go anywhere in Chicago but this place.  I Left a 5 cent tip and I feel like I was too generous.  This place could be awesome but the employees seem to actively try to make it an unfriendly place.

1.description: Came here on Monday because there was nowhere else to go. What a pleasant surprise! The quality of the music is impeccable. World class jazz. Food is good. Service could be a bit better. We had Seviche -great! Salads -one came too vinegary,so we asked for a replacement. The look we got was... condescending? ... but they did replace it. Drinks are good. Ambiance as expected. So, solid 4 stars.

55.description: The location itself is nice, but the constant harassment of the two hour notice of table use is ridiculous. The hostess and members play a vigilant role of ruining your time of enjoying the music and sharing the moment with your friends. I thought to myself we clearly heard the first time the hostess came around. Anyway the food itself is good the price itself is expensive for the value. The service was also good. The waitress checked upon us periodically even though the place was full so, that's appreciated. However, I personally don't recommend this place due to the hostess's attitude. Oh, the jazz music was okay too, the saxophone player think he's the top notch compared to all the other music players, but whatever floats his boat. By the way finding parking stinks and the more closer you're to the location the more expensive it gets. Also, let's not forget the cover charge before 7pm $10 and after 7pm $15 so with all the heavy duty pricing it isn't recommended, but only going for the band then it's worthwhile. Anything else, I say pass.

9.description: Last night was my first time experiencing a Jazz club. I'm pleased to say that Andy's atmosphere is very inviting and laid back. I can't wait to go back and bring family and friends to experience this venue. The only con was the $15 cover charge. However, it was not enough to keep me away.

26.description: Tuesday night 1030p10 dollar coverNo drink minimum at the bar, not sure about at the tablesEasy to find a seatAwesome talent with Fareed and the Funk Brothers

25.description: Great time. Good food and the music was great. Will take other guests back here.

12.description: Service was excellent!! Good music, management was very attentive to our needs. I highly recommend for a great night out with friends.Best Bloody Mary in Chicago!!

59.description: I was skeptical of this place at first, but it definitely exceeded my expectations. There was a cover of $10, and we were able to get a great seat at the bar right next to the band. I tried the burger, which was great. The fries weren't the best, so I would probably recommend a different appetizer. Nonetheless, it's definitely a cool place to try if you are in Chicago.

21.description: Went to celebrate my friend's birthday. It was a disappointment from the moment we walked in. We had to pay a $15 cover although we had a dinner reservation. That left a bad taste in my mouth. Our server was unattentive. We had to flag him down everytime we wanted another drink or to order additional appetizers. The food was just okay. Nothing spectacular and quite on the pricey side. Overall our bill was $300 on top of having to pay $15 cover. The bands were awesome though which is why 2 stars.

17.description: Really was looking forward to visiting this place while in Chicago but of course...no reservations leaves you hounding for a chair at the bar. HOWEVER, give the hostess a LARGE TIP and an available table will appear!Didn't eat but music WAS GREAT. 3 stars is for the music!

10.description: Enjoyed some live jazz after dinner here! They have food & drinks, for those wondering if they can eat, drink, & be jazzy! Ha. The band was very talented. It was my friend's first jazz show, & after her 2nd glass of wine, she was very persuasive & the band was nice enough to let her take a picture with them. So nice. Awesome place to check out if you're looking to explore some of Chi's music scene. Wish we had a laid back, casual place like this back in the Bay Area! Would come back again to support more local talent(;

5.description: Nice venue. Sunday night jam session was great. Highly recommended. Average food and drinks but the fantastic live jazz made up for the made up for the mediocre cuisine and drink service.

3.description: I wanted to get the Chicago jazz experience while I was in town on a Saturday night so I came here. We called ahead to see if they would be able to seat us when we arrived and we were accommodated. There is a $15 cover fee on Saturday's and a 2 hour table seating limit. We arrived around 9 so we had some time to wait until the next set was up. We were sat and ordered some wine and some appetizers. We went with the teriyaki steak tips and the ceviche and these were some amazing choices. The steak was cooked perfectly and the flavour of the teriyaki was perfect. I loved the ceviche with the plantain chips, it made for a unique pairing that really worked. We were going to order some mains, but decided after this that we were kind of full. The band started around 9:30 and consisted of some of the works from their influences as well as some original stuff. They were pretty good and we enjoyed the lovely sounds or their instruments while we sipped on our wine. It's a pretty good place to enjoy some jazz music over dinner and drinks.

35.description: I was at this place on July 18th.  Invited a group of women out for a "Lady's Night Out" to celebrate my 48th Birthday.  The food was great. The level of service received was not great at all.  In fact I was embarrassed by a comment that was mentioned to me and my guest about noise.  The funny thing is we were not that loud at all. Apparently the table next to us did not like that a group of professional African American women were having a great time.  We paid for our food and drinks and left after two hours.  I will never recommend this place or return here again.  Highly overrated!

19.description: Sadly couldn't get to the show with my 17 yo goddaughter who's big fan of jazz. After 7 they just wouldn't let us in

28.description: The chicken sandwich was decent and the Reuben was better. But you are coming here for the music which is great. Get there at 5pm when they open for prime seating.

45.description: Really was looking forward to visiting this place while in Chicago but of course...no reservations leaves you hounding for a chair at the bar. HOWEVER, give the hostess a LARGE TIP and an available table will appear!Didn't eat but music WAS GREAT. 3 stars is for the music!

33.description: I came down here on Friday, July 31st for the Fareed Haque trio. It was my first time in and I loved it. Although I did not eat, the food I saw come out to tables looked great. I paid the cover which did not bother me at all., was greeted at the door immediately and found a seat right at the bar. The bartender was friendly and quick with my bourbon drink. I thought the sound was good and the bar was fun. Got to even meet and talk to the players. Overall a great night and I cant wait to go back.

43.description: Had an amazing time at this fantastic jazz club. We were able to enjoy the music and dinner with our two teenage children at the 7 o'clock set. Everyone had a great time. The music was fantastic and the food was good

2.description: Our Chicago-savvy friend recommended Andy's for dinner and a show, and we were so glad we listened! The atmosphere inside is delightfully old-fashioned, with gussied-up patrons, stylized line drawings and a wall full of framed photographs. It's also VERY crowded, understandably, as they want to squeeze in as many paying customers as possible -- I was just grateful we were seated by an aisle, as I'm a little claustrophobic!I ordered a moscow mule to start, which was served in the traditional copper mug and had a nice kick to it (hey, wonder if that's how it got the name?) and my husband had a draft beer. Later, we split the Cajun jambalaya, which was fabulous -- fluffy rice topped with a vegetable-studded spicy sauce and beautifully fanned-out slices of crispy duck breast. It was very fairly priced at $24; it probably would have only served one hungry diner, but we had already enjoyed appetizers and cocktails somewhere else.But for once, the food has to be secondary in my review, because the real reason we were there was the music. I used to go to jazz clubs all the time in college and absolutely loved them, and as soon as the music started I wondered why in the world I had stopped going at all. It was incredible. The group wasn't well-known (at least to me) but they were amazingly talented, a combination of American and European musicians who worked together to create musical alchemy. It was such a thrill to hear their solos, feel the electricity in the air and see how hard they were working (major sweat happens when you play with energy!) Reading some of the other reviews, most of the negative comments seem to center around their fees and policies, but in our experience they were much stricter on paper than in person. We ordered one drink each and split one entree, but no one raised an eyebrow. We stayed longer than our allotted two hours, and again, not a word or nasty look from anyone. The only person who was censured by the management while we were there, truly deserved it; he had had way too much to drink and kept trying to sit down at tables while they were being cleared, but the clever FOH manager was having none of that. We actually appreciated her taking charge of the situation, as it distracted from our experience. And finally, the cover charge? Totally worth it. $15 each for two hours of top-quality live music is something of a bargain in a big city. Andy, our hats are off to you, and we'll see you soon!

18.description: Everything was fabulous. I had the best time and can't wait to go back. Our waitress was very attentive   Music was awesome and food was outstanding

41.description: Great atmosphere and music. Really good food. Had a fantastic time. Reasonable cover charge. A little over priced for food, but it's a jazz club so they gotta make money from more than just the cover. I highly recommend if you're in Chicago!

52.description: This is such a great place.  Not because of its surprisingly decent food, the acceptable availability and good music groups performing, it is because of the nice combination of all of this and more.  The menu is not bad at all with options for everyone ( including our vegetarian friends) and fair prices.  Not sure why they need the cover fee, I would rather pay for more drinks, get happier and enjoy the show even more.  A win-win. Isn't it? A Recommended dinner and a show duo.

50.description: The problem with Jazz clubs is that 15 minutes in (or maybe more if you're really an enthusiast) you're kind of done with the jazz and want to talk to the people that you came to spend the evening with but its too loud to talk! This is even worse if you're seated with your back turned away from the musicians so you can neither really enjoy them or your company. The space is really not very large so other than a handful of tables you're really just 15-20ft away from someone playing a saxophone (playing it really well of course).

4.description: Great chill spot with live jazz and good food!!! I recommend this place for a nice date or funny relaxing time with your girls!!!

6.description: Surprisingly good food considering you come more for the music. The mustard crusted halibut was really fresh and delicious. The salads aren't bad either and you can add meat to them to make them more of an entree.You'll have to pay a cover to get in even with dinner reservations but the music is worth it! If you're looking for a fun random night of music and pretty decent food then this is your place.

22.description: Interesting place... Definitely seems best with dinner reservations. Incredibly slow bar staff with no where to just hang out if u just want a drink & music. Having to fight over windowsill space.... Having to wait 10 min for a basic drink on a night with a trio... Not even a key or known band...

15.description: If you want to hear ok jazz and be treated terrible, have fun. This wasn't only my experience, my friend said the same thing. They have strange rules and make you feel bad about them. "You cannot leave a menu at the table, we don't want you to spill drinks on them." "You made a reservation for 8, there are 9 here." So weird!!

57.description: Great place for a cocktail and live jazz. The menu is not very extensive and the food quality is marginal which leads one to the conclusion its over priced. You pay for atmosphere which is probably worth it though.

20.description: Enjoyed some live jazz after dinner here! They have food & drinks, for those wondering if they can eat, drink, & be jazzy! Ha. The band was very talented. It was my friend's first jazz show, & after her 2nd glass of wine, she was very persuasive & the band was nice enough to let her take a picture with them. So nice. Awesome place to check out if you're looking to explore some of Chi's music scene. Wish we had a laid back, casual place like this back in the Bay Area! Would come back again to support more local talent(;

36.description: Great, historic jazz venue!  Music was great!  We didn't eat, but the menu looked great with a New Orleans flare.  Drinks were delicious and bartenders were friendly and attentive.  Will definitely go back!

14.description: My first visit here to Chicago and must I say, WOW!! Live music, great service, and amazing vibes all around! I can't wait for my next visit to Chicago, I'll definitely be stopping back into Andy's!!

3.description: This is one of our favorite spots. The fried rice has a lot to be desired but the chow mein noodles are very tasty. Their food is very fresh and we enjoy it each and every time we eat here.

1.description: I visited the restaurant on 1/12/16 with the intent of buying something to eat.  Prior to doing so, I asked the cashier to let me use the washroom.  She refused, stating that I must order first.  I felt extremely disrespected.  I have eaten at this restaurant several times, but will never do so again.  I will also tell friends, family, and colleagues about how poorly I was treated.  Don't patronize businesses that disrespect you!

2.description: The food here is always fresh and they give you huge portions! The bourbon chicken and orange chicken are my favorites. The chow mein also gets an honorable mention. Friendly staff, and the speed of service is great too.One of my favorite places to eat in the South Shore area.

0.description: I've been @ this place before, and wanted to try the sweet & sour chicken, and Mongolian chicken,with shrimp fried rice.  Because I never tried it, and it was great. Usually get the  Orange chicken..had to switch it up

4.description: Lo Mein noodles are the best

3.description: I have been seeing the loctician, Kerry, for about 4 weeks now.  I am easily able to make my appointments online and have never had an issue. The Salon is clean and has a very relaxing atmosphere.  I have never had a long wait -in, worked on . and out.  AND I get lots of complements on my babylocs...lol.

1.description: Where do I start? By shaking my head.....I scheduled an appoinment via style seat with 'NicolbyBriana' for today. Unfortunately I can't give a review of my hair because I never got my hair done. 2 hours before my scheduled appoinment at 11am she asks to reschedule for 4pm. *Please note that her policy on style seat puts the burden on the client that if you cancel or reschedule less than 24 hours notice you will be charged 50-100%.Okay....but what if the stylist cancels for reschedules at the last minute?I was on my way to Chicago from 2 hours away, so to text me at that short notice is a problem. It shows a lack of professionalism that unfortunate is prevalent in this industry for African Americans.She tells me in her last message that she is not in Chicago , but ATL.WHA???? I took as reel shot of her profile on style seat that clearly states she is at Anu Salon in Chicago. This was really sad.The worst part......Not ONE apology was sent......no offer of accommodations or anything. Please can our businesses learn to adopt better customer service relations, but also learn that professionalism goes a long way with becoming successful? From her profile it seems as though she is  very talented. Unfortunately her customer service and professional etiquette don't' match--at least not for me.Too bad,

2.description: I have been a client of Lalitha for almost 10 years! She is a very talented and gifted stylist. I joke with her and call her a hair surgeon. I currently live in Houston, TX but I do not trust anyone except Lalitha to take care of my hair so I am often back in town for an appointment. She is skilled to take care of a variety of different hair types. When I hear ANYONE mention a need for a stylist I always recommend Lalitha. But if I ever get established enough to cover her full time salary, I will be stealing her from you all! Lol! So book now while you can!

5.description: I came to this salon for an ombre hair coloring from hairstylist Roxanne Dunigan. I waited an hour and half to be seen and when I was finally waited on Roxanne's assistant while she talked on the phone. Once my color was done, it was not what I asked for.....it was done incorrectly. My color is not ombre style, its a simple color. So once Roxanne blew out my hair....I let them know the color was done wrong. Roxanne immediately got an attitude with me and I asked for my hair to be curled, she curled my hair in little tight curls like Shirley Temple.....which i clearly didn't ask for. So I tell Roxanne I don't like the style so she starts raising her voice at me saying "What you want me to do?" Clearly she didn't want to do my hair in the first place. She agreed to curl me hair over once I told her I was not satisfied, which was a rush job because she was upset with me not liking the style. So then she starts talking about me while i'm there to her assistant and friend that was just hanging in the salon. I asked to speak to manager for her unprofessionalism and she starts cursing me out saying I'm on some bullshit and instead calling her manager she's calls the police on me as if i was the irate customer when it was her the whole time yelling and cursing at me.

6.description: Sharon (salon owner) has been my stylist for close to 7 years and I love her. Not only can she style hair, but my hair is healthy! She has been responsive to any questions I have and truly knows how to cater to her clients. If you want a cut, that will have people stopping you in the street to ask who does your hair... visit Sharon!

7.description: Went based on a referral from a friend because I have short nappy hair.  I called the stylist a few days before and she said she could not talk to me but I could make an appointment online.  I reviewed their website which states they blow out natural hair which is what I wanted.  After sitting in the shop for 30 minutes, the stylist came over looked at my hair and said "I don;t blow out short hair".  You say you handle natural hair but you can't do short nappy hair?!?!??!  I think she was about three people behind and just did not want to spend the time working on my hair and I was a first time customer.  What a waste of time and another reason why I don;t like going to beauty salons for services.

0.description: Lalitha (Lala) is an amaing stylist. She offers $225 sew ins (i always make it $240 with the tip) and she can blow out natural hair like no other! She is extremely professional and has never cancelled an appointment. I have been going to her for 6 years now! She does not overbook her clients so you will be in and out. I typically go during the week and in the mornings. There is free street parking available. The salon is clean and relaxing. There are 3 levels and they offer other services such as waxing and nails. You can reach Lala at (773) 540-1772!

4.description: I visited A'nu Salon for the first time last month.  I was seen by stylist Getaun (not sure if I spelled that correctly) and she was fabulous! The salon is in a townhome style building so the setting is comfortable & cute, like you're in someone's home. I usually dread going to salon's because it seems you never get seen at your actual appt. time, but I was greeted promptly and attended to even as she finished with the previous client.  I told her the look I was going for and she executed it perfectly.  Getaun was friendly and professional and I will definitely be going back!

3.description: Nice spot for the southsiders, but I would not recommend traveling for this spot. It was remodeled in the last couple of years so it looks good. One of the touch screen games never works :-( They used to play alot of darts here before the renovations, but now I never see it being used. They still have awesome live shows but it's virtually empty at other times. The music is Circa Diana Ross/Gloria Gaynor so it does not appeal to all, especially the younger crowd who would like some of the current music mixed in. All in all it's a good spot to have a drink and see a good live show.

1.description: This place was a great night in Chicago. Cheap drinks, awesome people and the drag show was very entertaining. This place is on the south side so unless ur adventurous u may not want to go. This place is more bar than club but I spoke with the manager who told me they are expanding to the building next door and when they do it should be even better and more club like. The outdoor smoking area was a great spot to meet people n i met some really awesome people. I would definitely go back next time in chi town.

2.description: Ruff n Stuff's events are what makes this place five stars!

0.description: Last night was my first time there in over 8-9 years. And I was really impressed at the upgrade/remodel of the bar. Yeah it's still a hole in the wall bar but who doesn't love a good hole in the wall?? The DJ played some really good music. I was hanging out with a few buddies for the first time so it wasn't too loud. Drinks were reasonable $2 shots of tequila!! LOVES IT!!! The bartenders didn't play that whole "I don't see you" game. It was an older crowd which wasn't bad either. I'm thinking of making this a regular hang out spot.
